original: nam mkha' 'dra ba ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' 'dra ba ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The space-like Dharma Body is

original: sgrib pa thams cad mi mnga' bas so //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad mi mnga' bas so //
translated: free from all obscurations.

original: rdul bral ni phyi dang nang gi 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul bral ni phyi dang nang gi 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The stainless one is free from the stains of attachment, both internal and external.

original: gzugs bzang 'chang ba ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'chang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs bzang 'chang ba ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'chang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who bears a beautiful form is the Enjoyment Body, which bears the adornment of the thirty-two major marks.

original: lus mi mnga' ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus mi mnga' ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who is formless is equal to space.

original: mtshan mi mnga' ni mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan mi mnga' ni mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: The one who is signless is devoid of the characteristics of signs.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: The one who is without the characteristics of form is devoid of the characteristics of the form body.

original: shes rab sras po ni gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab sras po ni gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who is the son of wisdom is born from the meditation on the perfection of wisdom, which is characterized by the formless.

original: yang na nam mkha' dang 'dra bas na rdul dang bral lo //🔽rdul @50a * //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' dang 'dra bas na rdul dang bral lo // rdul @50a * //
translated: Alternatively, the one who is like space is stainless.

original: dang bral ba ni gzugs bzang 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: dang bral ba ni gzugs bzang 'chang ba ste /
translated: The stainless one is the one who bears a beautiful form.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs la gzugs zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs la gzugs zhes byas nas so //
translated: Form is called the form of reality.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs dang mtshan mi mnga' ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs dang mtshan mi mnga' ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Because the absence of form and characteristics is the essence of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab pha rol tu phyin gnyis med //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol tu phyin gnyis med //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is nondual.🔽That intuition is the Tathagata.

original: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And because it is the mother of the Tathagata, it is the mother of the Buddhas.🔽And because it is the mother of the Bodhisattvas, it is the mother of the Bodhisattvas.🔽And because it is the mother of the Solitary Sages, it is the mother of the Solitary Sages.

original: goms par byed pa'i dus la ltos nas de'i sras po nyid do //
analyzed: goms par byed pa'i dus la ltos nas de'i sras po nyid do //
translated: And because it is the mother of the Disciples, it is the mother of the Disciples.🔽And because it is the mother of all beings, it is the mother of all beings.🔽And because it is the mother of the three vehicles, it is the mother of the three vehicles.🔽And because it is the mother of the three worlds, it is the mother of the three worlds.🔽And because it is the mother of the three times, it is the mother of the three times.

original: de lta bas na thams cad du dman pa la mos pa rnams kyis gting dpag par dka' ba'i phyir dang / shin tu zab pa'i yon tan rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad du dman pa la mos pa rnams kyis gting dpag par dka' ba'i phyir dang / shin tu zab pa'i yon tan rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: And because it is the mother of the three knowledges, it is the mother of the three knowledges.

original: yon tan rgya mtsho rab zab ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho rab zab ces bya ba'o //
translated: And because it is the mother of the three liberations, it is the mother of the three liberations.🔽And because it is the mother of the three doors of liberation, it is the mother of the three doors of liberation.

original: de ltar na sems can gyi don bya ba ji ltar nges par 'grub ces bya na /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can gyi don bya ba ji ltar nges par 'grub ces bya na /
translated: And because it is the mother of the three concentrations, it is the mother of the three concentrations.

original: thugs rje can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thugs rje can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: And because it is the mother of the three knowledges, it is the mother of the three knowledges.🔽And because it is the mother of the three knowledges, it is the mother of the three knowledges.🔽And because it is the mother of the three knowledges, it is the mother of the three knowledges.🔽And because it is the mother of the three knowledges, it is the mother of the three knowledges.🔽And because it is the mother of the three knowledges, it is the mother of the three knowledges.🔽And because it is the mother of the three knowledges, it is the mother of the three knowledges.🔽And because it is the mother of the three knowledges, it is the mother of the three knowledges.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i sku yin pa'i phyir dang / sngon sbyangs pa'i nus pa'i stobs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa yang nges par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i sku yin pa'i phyir dang / sngon sbyangs pa'i nus pa'i stobs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa yang nges par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: because he is the body of great compassion without an object, and because it is certain that he will act for the sake of sentient beings by the power of his former training.

original: de ltar bstod nas rang gi 'dod pa'i don la gsol ba 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar bstod nas rang gi 'dod pa'i don la gsol ba 'debs pa ni /
translated: Having thus praised him, he makes a request for his desired aim:

original: mtshungs med phyag ni bdag gi spyi bor zhog / ces pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs med phyag ni bdag gi spyi bor zhog / ces pa ste /
translated: Place your incomparable hand on my head.

original: phyag zhog ces bya ba ni gsol cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: phyag zhog ces bya ba ni gsol cig ces pa'o //
translated: The words place your hand mean please do.

original: bdag gi mgor te spyi bor ro //
analyzed: bdag gi mgor te spyi bor ro //
translated: On my head, that is, on my crown.

original: mtshungs med ni 'dra ba med pa'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs med ni 'dra ba med pa'i don to //
translated: Incomparable means without an equal.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ji ltar gsol ba btab pa'i don yang dag par bsgrub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ji ltar gsol ba btab pa'i don yang dag par bsgrub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the Blessed One will accomplish the aim of the request just as it was made,

original: phyag g-yas pa zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa'i spyi bor bzhag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa'i spyi bor bzhag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: he places his right hand on the crown of Candraprabhakumārabhūta's head.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag g-yas pa bzhag ma thag tu skad cig de nyid la zla 'od gzhon nur gyur ba la gzugs thams cad nges par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag g-yas pa bzhag ma thag tu skad cig de nyid la zla 'od gzhon nur gyur ba la gzugs thams cad nges par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: As soon as the Lord placed his right hand on Candraprabhakumārabhūta, in that very instant, he attained the samādhi called “the manifestation of all forms.”

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi gzugs thams cad kyi snang ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi gzugs thams cad kyi snang ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the appearance of all forms in all their aspects.

original: yid ltar mgyogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yid kyi bsam pa tsam gyis thams cad du 'gro zhing 'ong ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yid ltar mgyogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yid kyi bsam pa tsam gyis thams cad du 'gro zhing 'ong ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The samādhi called “swift as thought” is the essence of the magical power of going and coming everywhere by mere thought.

original: nam mkha' mdzod ni 'dod pa tsam gyis 'dod pa'i don thams cad nam mkha' las yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod ni 'dod pa tsam gyis 'dod pa'i don thams cad nam mkha' las yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The “sky treasury” is the accomplishment of all desired goals from the sky by mere wish.

original: rdo rje lta bu ni rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad kyis mi phyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu ni rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad kyis mi phyed pa nyid do //
translated: The “vajra-like” is the state of being indivisible by any distraction.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yul non pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yul non pa'o //
translated: The “heroic stride” is the conquest of the objects of all samādhis.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i mtha' ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi mthar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i mtha' ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi mthar 'gro ba'o //
translated: The “unobstructed limit” is the going to the end of all obstructions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ston pa @50b ni 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon sum du mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ston pa @50b ni 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon sum du mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The manifestation of all Tathagatas is the very essence of the direct perception of all Tathagatas dwelling in infinite world systems.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba thob pa ni stong pa nyid thams cad kyi ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon sum du byas pa'i shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba thob pa ni stong pa nyid thams cad kyi ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon sum du byas pa'i shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The consecration of the attainment of all emptinesses is the consecration of the wisdom-knowledge through the direct realization of the perfection of wisdom, the essence of all emptinesses.

original: de dag la sogs pa ste gtso bor gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dpag tu med pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa ste gtso bor gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dpag tu med pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: These and other principal kinds of meditative stabilization become manifest, in infinite number.

original: gzungs kyi sgo dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba gang lha yul gyi dga' ba dang bde ba thob po zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag gi mthil gyis reg pa'i mthu khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba gang lha yul gyi dga' ba dang bde ba thob po zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag gi mthil gyis reg pa'i mthu khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya'o //
translated: The doors of retention, and the joy and bliss, are the attainment of the joy and bliss of the gods. By this it should be understood that the power of the touch of the Tathagata's palm is especially exalted.

original: de dag nyid kyi don tshigs su bcad pas so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi don tshigs su bcad pas so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of those very [verses] individually, [the Bhagavān] says,

original: dra bas mdzes 'brel bum pa lcags kyu'i mtshan mnga' zhing //
analyzed: dra bas mdzes 'brel bum pa lcags kyu'i mtshan mnga' zhing //
translated: Adorned with a vase, hook, and svastika marks,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: bum pa dang / lcags kyu dang / dpal be 'u dang / 'khor lo dang / rgyal mtshan dang / nya dang / ba dan la sogs pa'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: bum pa dang / lcags kyu dang / dpal be 'u dang / 'khor lo dang / rgyal mtshan dang / nya dang / ba dan la sogs pa'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: [He is] adorned with the marks of a vase, hook, svastika, wheel, victory banner, fish, banner, and so on.

original: bskal pa mi nyung ba dpag tu med par sbyin pa'i char 'bebs pa la mkhas pa'i phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog can zla 'od kyi mgo la bzhag par gyur bas zla 'od gzhon nu la dpe med pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan par gyur
analyzed: bskal pa mi nyung ba dpag tu med par sbyin pa'i char 'bebs pa la mkhas pa'i phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog can zla 'od kyi mgo la bzhag par gyur bas zla 'od gzhon nu la dpe med pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan par gyur
translated: With his right hand, which is the color of gold, skilled in raining down the rain of generosity for countless eons, he placed it on Candraprabhakumāra's head. Candraprabhakumāra became endowed with incomparable joy and bliss.

original: bas bcom ldan 'das gal ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas tshul dang mthun pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bstod pa /
analyzed: bas bcom ldan 'das gal ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas tshul dang mthun pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bstod pa /
translated: Having bowed with palms joined in the direction of the Bhagavān, he praised with appropriate verses:

original: bla med mi 'jigs sbyin pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bla med mi 'jigs sbyin pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, the unsurpassed giver of fearlessness!

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa stsol bas mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa stsol bas mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: He gives fearlessness, because he bestows fearlessness on all beings.

original: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa sdug pa bzhin du brtse bas sbyin pas na sems can gnyen rtsa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa sdug pa bzhin du brtse bas sbyin pas na sems can gnyen rtsa'o //
translated: He is the kinsman of beings, because he gives with love to all beings as to a beloved only child.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pas sems can gyi don la 'jug pas na bden pa'i rtsal mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pas sems can gyi don la 'jug pas na bden pa'i rtsal mnga' ba'o //
translated: He has the power of truth, because he engages in the aims of beings in various ways.

original: mnyam pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad dang mnyam pas mi mnyam mnyam pa'o ;
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad dang mnyam pas mi mnyam mnyam pa'o ;
translated: He is the equal of the unequaled, because he is the equal of all the Tathagatas, who are unequaled.

original: / dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyi sku yin pa'i phyir shin tu thugs rje can no //
analyzed: / dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyi sku yin pa'i phyir shin tu thugs rje can no //
translated: He is the Great Compassionate One, because he has a body whose nature is the great compassion that is without reference.

original: dpa' bo dgra bzhi rnam par btul la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya ba ni dgra bzhi rnam par btul ba ste /
analyzed: dpa' bo dgra bzhi rnam par btul la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba ni dgra bzhi rnam par btul ba ste /
translated: Homage to the hero who has conquered the four demons.🔽Here the four demons are conquered.

original: bdud bzhi'i dgra las rnam par rgyal ba nyid do //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i dgra las rnam par rgyal ba nyid do //
translated: He is the conqueror of the four demons.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis @51a * //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis @51a * //
translated: By the power of his diligence,

original: don dam pa sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du mdzad pas na brtson pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du mdzad pas na brtson pa'o //
translated: He is the Striving One because he has made manifest the ultimate Buddhahood.

original: chos nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyi phyir sku mchog go /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyi phyir sku mchog go /
translated: He is the Supreme Body because he is the embodiment of the Dharmakaya.

original: shin tu yangs ba ni shes rab ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor las shar ba snying rje byams pa'i 'od zer stong dang ldan pa'i rgyal ba'i nyi ma mi shes pa'i mun pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu yangs ba ni shes rab ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor las shar ba snying rje byams pa'i 'od zer stong dang ldan pa'i rgyal ba'i nyi ma mi shes pa'i mun pa sel ba'o //
translated: The Sun of the Victorious One, which is the vast wisdom, arises from the sphere of the sky, and it is endowed with the thousand rays of compassion and love, and it dispels the darkness of ignorance.

original: skyabs su mchi zhes bya ba ni gus par phyag 'tshal nas bdag la skyabs gzhan ma mchis pas skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: skyabs su mchi zhes bya ba ni gus par phyag 'tshal nas bdag la skyabs gzhan ma mchis pas skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: The words I go for refuge mean that, having paid homage with devotion, he says, I go for refuge because I have no other refuge.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: Thus he prays to the Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhes bya ba la /
translated: The words For the sake of your compassion, O Lord mean that

original: thugs kyis dgongs la /
analyzed: thugs kyis dgongs la /
translated: he prays to the Lord with a compassionate mind.

original: sang bdag gi sdum par byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas par bshos gsol ba gnang bar mdzad du gsol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sang bdag gi sdum par byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas par bshos gsol ba gnang bar mdzad du gsol zhes bya'o //
translated: He says, Please consent to come tomorrow to my house together with the Bodhisattva Sangha and the Sangha of Sravakas to accept my offering of food.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyis kyang don de nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyis kyang don de nyid bstan to //
translated: The same point is taught by the verse beginning “To that, he said…”

original: thugs brtse ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thugs kyis so //
analyzed: thugs brtse ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thugs kyis so //
translated: “Out of compassion” means with his mind.

original: gnang ba ni bdag gir mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gnang ba ni bdag gir mdzad pa'o //
translated: “He gave his consent” means he accepted.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa cang mi gsung bar gyur bas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa cang mi gsung bar gyur bas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it says, “he remained silent.”

original: de nas zla 'od kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas zla 'od kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas stan las langs te /
translated: Then, knowing that the Blessed One had given his consent by remaining silent, Candraprabha rose from his seat,🔽bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, and departed. He made the entire road from the royal capital to Vulture Peak Mountain even,

original: bcom ldan 'das la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te song nas rgyal po'i khab nas bya rgod kyi phung po'i bar gyi lam thams cad mnyam par byas nas me tog sna tshogs dang / spos dang / na bza' dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te song nas rgyal po'i khab nas bya rgod kyi phung po'i bar gyi lam thams cad mnyam par byas nas me tog sna tshogs dang / spos dang / na bza' dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
translated: and adorned it with various flowers, incense, clothing, victory banners, flags,

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang / gar dang / zlos gar la sogs pa dang / rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs brgya stong du ma dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang / gar dang / zlos gar la sogs pa dang / rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs brgya stong du ma dang ldan pas /
translated: and banners of total victory, as well as with various dances, dramas, and so forth, and with many hundreds of thousands of musical performances.

original: skyes pa dang bud med rnams kyang yang dag par brgyan to //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med rnams kyang yang dag par brgyan to //
translated: Men and women were also properly adorned.

original: lam gyi ngos gnyis su yang 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser las byas pa lha rdzas kyi ta la'i phreng brgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa rnams bkod /
analyzed: lam gyi ngos gnyis su yang 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser las byas pa lha rdzas kyi ta la'i phreng brgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa rnams bkod /
translated: On both sides of the road, there were rows of palm trees made of gold from the Jambū River, adorned with various divine ornaments.

original: nam mkha' la yang rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i shing rin po che sna tshogs kyi khyad par mar me bzhin du gsal bar byed pa rnams btsugs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i shing rin po che sna tshogs kyi khyad par mar me bzhin du gsal bar byed pa rnams btsugs so //
translated: In the sky, there were trees made of the seven precious substances, illuminating with the distinctions of various precious substances like lamps.

original: sngar bstan pa'i don rnams tshigs su bcad pas rtogs par sla ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i don rnams tshigs su bcad pas rtogs par sla ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to make it easier to understand the meaning that was previously explained, it is stated in verse:

original: lam ni sna tshogs shin tu legs par brgyan //
analyzed: lam ni sna tshogs shin tu legs par brgyan //
translated: The road is well-adorned with various things.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here,

original: lhug pa'i gzhung bshad pa yin @51b pa'i phyir yang bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhug pa'i gzhung bshad pa yin @51b pa'i phyir yang bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: it should not be explained again because it is a loose text.

analyzed: de ltar rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs la sogs pa lam brgyan pas rgyal po'i khab gang yin pa dang / rang gi khyim gang yin par song nas rang gi khyim du zhugs nas de'i nub mo mang zhing bzang ba gya nom pa dpag tu med pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dang myang bar bya ba rnams mngon par bsgrubs shing lha'i zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pa
translated: In this way, he adorned the road with various jewels and so forth. He went to Rājagṛha and his own house. He entered his house and prepared an immeasurable amount of excellent, delicious food, drink, and edibles for that night.🔽He also prepared divine food with a hundred flavors.

original: yang tshogs par byas nas nang par snga rab kyi dus su rgyal po'i khab kyang de bzhin du brgyan nas de la rang gi khyim yang rgyan sna tshogs pa du mas brgyan cing rin po che'i stan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma yang ba ting ngo
analyzed: yang tshogs par byas nas nang par snga rab kyi dus su rgyal po'i khab kyang de bzhin du brgyan nas de la rang gi khyim yang rgyan sna tshogs pa du mas brgyan cing rin po che'i stan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma yang ba ting ngo

analyzed: // de'i dbus su lha rdzas kyi seng ge'i khri lha dang mi las 'das pa bshams so //

analyzed: me tog rnam pa sna tshogs kyang bkram mo //

analyzed: gar byed glu len sil snyan sgra dag gis //
translated: By the performance of dance, song, and music,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

analyzed: 'dus byas pa'i sgra'i sbyor bas ni mtho ris 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: don la brtan par bya'i yi ge la brtan par ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should rely on the meaning, not on the letter.

original: don dang sgra la 'brel pa grub pa ci yang med pa'i phyir gang su yang rung ba sgra de dag gis sam lag pa la sogs pa'i brda yang rung bas rab tu bsgrubs pa'i don gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes rtogs par bya'i rmongs pa sgra la

analyzed: zhen pa rnams kyis yongs @52a * //

analyzed: su brtags pa'i 'dus byas pa'i sgra la 'bad pa bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gar dang glu dang brdungs pa'i sgras nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i khang pa'i mchog ni lha la sogs pa'i sems kyang ngo mtshar du 'dzin cing lha'i gzhal med khang yang zil gyis mnan pa'i rnam par rgyal ba'i gnas pas lhag par zla 'od kyi khang pa rnams

translated: The palace of Candraprabha,

analyzed: thams cad kyang lha'i me tog manda ra bas snyim pa bkang ba'o //

analyzed: yang ta po ta zhes bya ba ni bya rgod phung po'i ri'o //

analyzed: de dag thams cad tshigs su bcad pas bstan par 'dod nas / bdag gis grong khyer mchog kun rnam par brgyan //

analyzed: de'i phyir / sras dang thabs cig bdag gi sdum par gshegs su gsol //

analyzed: ji ltar mar me mdzad kyis khyod la lung bstan pa //

analyzed: rim gyis sems can grol ba'i phyir dpag tu med pa'i smon lam gyi go gyon pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir / 'di na snod min sems @53a * //

original: can gang yang med //
analyzed: can gang yang med //

analyzed: ces bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i sems kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that you should arouse the Awakening Mind with a mind that is unmoving.

analyzed: de bzhin byang chub shing dbang drung bdag mchi // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi sdum bar khyod gshegs pa bzhin du byang chub kyi shing drung du bdag mchi bar bgyi'o //

translated: Having gone there, I will sit down in the vajra posture, and remaining on the vajra seat, unshakable and unmoving, I will conquer the four maras and attain enlightenment, just as you have done.

analyzed: longs shig zla 'dod rgyal ba'i sras //
translated: Rise up, son of the Victorious Ones, who desires the moon!

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: khyod kyis mngon par 'dod pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya'o //
translated: You should accomplish what is desired.

original: zan la de ni khyim du 'dong ;
analyzed: zan la de ni khyim du 'dong ;
translated: Go to the house for the meal.

original: / zhes bya ni de skad gsungs nas dus la bab ste gdan las bzhengs nas sham thabs gsol /
analyzed: / zhes bya ni de skad gsungs nas dus la bab ste gdan las bzhengs nas sham thabs gsol /

translated: and taking his alms bowl, he went with the great saṅgha of monks from the gate of the hot springs to the great city of Rājagṛha for alms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang lha la sogs pas yongs su bskor te mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams kyis ni mchod cing stod par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po dang sangs rgyas kyi byin rlabs chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul chen po dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang lha la sogs pas yongs su bskor te mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams kyis ni mchod cing stod par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po dang sangs rgyas kyi byin rlabs chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul chen po dang /
translated: Surrounded by bodhisattvas, gods, and others, he was worshipped and praised by humans and non-humans, through the great power of the Buddha, the great blessing of the Buddha, the great miracles of the Buddha,

original: cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i spyod lam gyi rdzu 'phrul gyis cho 'phrul nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i spyod lam gyi rdzu 'phrul gyis cho 'phrul nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and various miracles, in order to demonstrate the miracle of non-conceptual conduct.

original: 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong ni rab tu gtong zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong ni rab tu gtong zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He emits hundreds of thousands of millions of light rays.🔽From the parts of his body,

original: sku lus kyi cha shas las zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o ;
analyzed: sku lus kyi cha shas las zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o ;
translated: and so on.

original: / sil snyan sna tshogs dang / gdugs sna tshogs dang / ba dan la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par dang / ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / ngur ba la sogs pa'i bya'i tshogs dpag tu med pa snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i sgra skad rnam pa sna tshogs pa sgrogs shing nam mkha'i @53b dkyil nas 'khor zhing bstod pa'i dbyangs sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: / sil snyan sna tshogs dang / gdugs sna tshogs dang / ba dan la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par dang / ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / ngur ba la sogs pa'i bya'i tshogs dpag tu med pa snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i sgra skad rnam pa sna tshogs pa sgrogs shing nam mkha'i @53b dkyil nas 'khor zhing bstod pa'i dbyangs sgrogs par byed do //
translated: With various musical instruments, various parasols, banners, and so on, with flocks of geese, cranes, and ducks, with countless pleasant and melodious sounds, they circle in the sky and sing songs of praise.

original: gnod sbyin gyi dbang po gzugs bzang dang / dbang po'i tog la sogs pa gnod sbyin gyi dbang po bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dag gis lag pa gnyis gtun shing 'dzin cing gdug pa can rnams skrod par byed do //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi dbang po gzugs bzang dang / dbang po'i tog la sogs pa gnod sbyin gyi dbang po bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dag gis lag pa gnyis gtun shing 'dzin cing gdug pa can rnams skrod par byed do //
translated: With their two hands holding pestles, the lords of the yakshas, such as the lord of the yakshas Subhadra and Indrakosha, and many hundreds of thousands of millions of yaksha lords, drive away the evildoers.

original: phyogs sna tshogs nas lhags pa'i rgyal po dbang che ba /🔽dbang che bar grags pa rnams rta dang ba lang dang shing rta dang rkang thang rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan pa rnams ma zhon par khrid pas yongs su bskor ba dang / tshangs pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs na mchod pa dang / rim gro dang /
analyzed: phyogs sna tshogs nas lhags pa'i rgyal po dbang che ba / dbang che bar grags pa rnams rta dang ba lang dang shing rta dang rkang thang rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan pa rnams ma zhon par khrid pas yongs su bskor ba dang / tshangs pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs na mchod pa dang / rim gro dang /
translated: The powerful kings from various directions,🔽very famous for their power, were not mounted on horses, cows, chariots, or footmen, but were led and surrounded by them, well adorned with ornaments.

original: bsnyen bkur byed cing 'gro'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed cing 'gro'o //
translated: Brahma also went, making offerings, service, and respect to the Bhagavan.

original: g-yon nas ni lha'i dbang po 'gro'o //
analyzed: g-yon nas ni lha'i dbang po 'gro'o //
translated: On the left, the lord of the gods went.

original: nam mkha'i ngos thams cad bar mtshams med par gang ba'i lha'i bu mchod pa sna tshogs thogs pas lag pa sprel bas /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngos thams cad bar mtshams med par gang ba'i lha'i bu mchod pa sna tshogs thogs pas lag pa sprel bas /
translated: The sons of the gods, filling all the directions of space without gaps, with various offerings in their hands,🔽gathered in the sky, and sat down for the purpose of making offerings to the Bhagavan.

original: nam mkha' gang bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir 'khod de zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa rnams kyis bskor nas bcom ldan 'das chu dron can gyi sgo nas gshegs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' gang bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir 'khod de zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa rnams kyis bskor nas bcom ldan 'das chu dron can gyi sgo nas gshegs so //
translated: Thus, surrounded by those who were taught, the Bhagavan went out through the gate of the hot spring.

original: de la 'di skad ces te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa nyid gsal bor bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa nyid gsal bor bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, thus and so forth clarify what was previously taught.

original: sangs rgyas de bzhin gshegs pas dus mkhyen nas ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas de bzhin gshegs pas dus mkhyen nas ;
translated: The Buddha, the Thus Gone One, knowing the time,

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: dus mkhyen nas 'od zer gyi cho 'phrul sna tshogs ston pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa snang bar mdzad cing gshegs par gyur to //
analyzed: dus mkhyen nas 'od zer gyi cho 'phrul sna tshogs ston pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa snang bar mdzad cing gshegs par gyur to //
translated: Knowing the time, he displayed various miraculous lights and went, illuminating immeasurable buddha realms.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i g-yon phyogs nas ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / mthu chen thob dang / mthong ba don yod dang / spos kyi glang po dang / lag na rin chen dang / lag bzangs dang / rin chen tog dang / 'byung bar dka' ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i g-yon phyogs nas ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / mthu chen thob dang / mthong ba don yod dang / spos kyi glang po dang / lag na rin chen dang / lag bzangs dang / rin chen tog dang / 'byung bar dka' ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: To the left of the Blessed One were Avalokiteśvara, Mahāsthāmaprāpta, Amoghadarśin, Gandhahastin, Ratnapāṇi, Sumitrāhasta, Ratnaketu, Durjayajñāna, and so forth.

original: g-yas phyogs nas ni byams pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bskal pa bzang po pa rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs nas ni byams pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bskal pa bzang po pa rnams so //
translated: To the right were Maitreya and the other Bodhisattvas of the Fortunate Eon.

original: zla 'od ni mdun nas 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: zla 'od ni mdun nas 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Candraprabha was leading the way in front.

original: 'jam dpal ni dpag tu med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor nas g-yon phyogs de nyid nas so zhes bya bas ni shes rab dang byams pa dag gis mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas thob par bya ba nyid yin @54a * //🔽pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //🔽'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / byams pa dag g-yon dang g-yas phyogs su gnas par bstan nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rjes thogs su ni nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ni dpag tu med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor nas g-yon phyogs de nyid nas so zhes bya bas ni shes rab dang byams pa dag gis mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas thob par bya ba nyid yin @54a * // pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no // 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / byams pa dag g-yon dang g-yas phyogs su gnas par bstan nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rjes thogs su ni nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: This shows that the left and right sides are the sides of wisdom and love, respectively, because they are the means of attaining the desired goal.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi rjes thogs su goo ta ma la sogs pa'i drang srong chen po rnams te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi rjes thogs su goo ta ma la sogs pa'i drang srong chen po rnams te /
translated: The fact that Manjusri and Maitreya are shown on the left and right sides indicates that the assembly of disciples is immediately after Manjusri, and the great sages such as Gautama are immediately after the assembly of disciples.

original: bstan ma thag pa de dag thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das yongs su bskor ba ni nam mkha' dri ma med pa'i dbus na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa la skar ma'i tshogs rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba ltar nye bar mdzes par gyur pas bcom
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa de dag thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das yongs su bskor ba ni nam mkha' dri ma med pa'i dbus na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa la skar ma'i tshogs rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba ltar nye bar mdzes par gyur pas bcom
translated: All of those just mentioned, surrounding the Blessed One, were as beautiful as the full moon in the middle of a clear sky, surrounded by a multitude of stars.

original: ldan 'das grong khyer du gshegs nas nga gang gi tshe dbang po'i phur bu'i sgo them la bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gzhag pa de'i tshes chen po rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur te /
analyzed: ldan 'das grong khyer du gshegs nas nga gang gi tshe dbang po'i phur bu'i sgo them la bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gzhag pa de'i tshes chen po rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur te /
translated: When the Blessed One entered the city and placed his foot on the threshold of the door of Indra's palace, the great earth shook in six ways.

original: de dag kyang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag kyang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Those have already been explained.

original: don de nyid yang tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa'i phyir /🔽grong khyer mchog der 'dren pa gshegs pa na //
analyzed: don de nyid yang tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa'i phyir / grong khyer mchog der 'dren pa gshegs pa na //
translated: In order to teach that very meaning again with verses,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, When the Leader entered that supreme city... and so on.

original: sems can rnams rab tu dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can rnams rab tu dga' bar gyur to //
translated: There, sentient beings became extremely joyful.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa dang bral lo //
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa dang bral lo //
translated: They were free from hunger and thirst.

original: dbang po ma tshang ba rnams kyis ni dbang po tshang ba thob bar gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang ba rnams kyis ni dbang po tshang ba thob bar gyur to //
translated: Those who were incomplete in their faculties became complete.

original: yi dags rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyis reg pas bde ba thob par gyur to //
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyis reg pas bde ba thob par gyur to //
translated: The hungry ghosts, too, having been touched by the light of the Tathagata, attained happiness.

original: sa yang rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos so //
analyzed: sa yang rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos so //
translated: The earth shook in six ways.

original: 'on kyang sems can 'ga' la yang gnod par gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can 'ga' la yang gnod par gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: But no sentient being was harmed.

original: 'tshe ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa'o //
translated: There was no violence.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i lha rnams kyang gdugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'dzin par byed do /
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i lha rnams kyang gdugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'dzin par byed do /
translated: The gods who travel through space held up various parasols.

original: sil snyan bye ba brgya stong du ma dag kyang ma brdungs par nam mkha'i dkyil nas rang sgra snyan ba sgrogs so //
analyzed: sil snyan bye ba brgya stong du ma dag kyang ma brdungs par nam mkha'i dkyil nas rang sgra snyan ba sgrogs so //
translated: Hundreds of thousands of millions of musical instruments sounded a sweet and pleasant melody in the sky without being played.

original: ljon shing sdong po stong phrag brgya yang de'i tshe me tog rgyas par gyur cing bcom ldan 'das la 'dud bar gyur to //
analyzed: ljon shing sdong po stong phrag brgya yang de'i tshe me tog rgyas par gyur cing bcom ldan 'das la 'dud bar gyur to //
translated: Hundreds of thousands of trees blossomed with flowers and bowed to the Blessed One.

original: rta dang / glong po che dang / khyu mchog dang / ri dags kyi bdag po rnams kyang rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i sgra sgrogs so //
analyzed: rta dang / glong po che dang / khyu mchog dang / ri dags kyi bdag po rnams kyang rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i sgra sgrogs so //
translated: Horses, elephants, bulls, and the lords of the deer all let out cries of joy and delight.

original: phyogs sna tshogs nas 'ongs pa'i sa bdag rgyal po rnams kyang spyi bo sa la btsugs nas phyag 'tshal zhing 'dud do //
analyzed: phyogs sna tshogs nas 'ongs pa'i sa bdag rgyal po rnams kyang spyi bo sa la btsugs nas phyag 'tshal zhing 'dud do //
translated: The kings of the various directions bowed their heads to the ground and paid homage.

original: kha cig ni mu tig gi phreng ba dang / dpung rgyan dang / rkang gdub dang / cod @54b pa na dang / gdu bu dang / rna cha la sogs pa'i rgyan gyi khyad par rnams 'thor bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni mu tig gi phreng ba dang / dpung rgyan dang / rkang gdub dang / cod @54b pa na dang / gdu bu dang / rna cha la sogs pa'i rgyan gyi khyad par rnams 'thor bar byed do //
translated: Some scattered various ornaments such as pearl necklaces, armlets, anklets, crowns, bracelets, and earrings.

original: gang yang mchog tu sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i sems can gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nyam thag cing mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug pa de dag ni skad cig de nyid la bde ba dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: gang yang mchog tu sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i sems can gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nyam thag cing mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug pa de dag ni skad cig de nyid la bde ba dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: Those beings who were in the greatest suffering, tormented by various harms and the pain of sorrow, in that very instant became happy.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil nas 'gro ba'i bya'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs rnams kyang snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i sgra sgrogs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil nas 'gro ba'i bya'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs rnams kyang snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i sgra sgrogs so //
translated: The various flocks of birds flying in the sky also utter pleasant and delightful sounds.

original: gang dag gis sgra skad de thos pa de dag kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug zhi bar gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag gis sgra skad de thos pa de dag kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug zhi bar gyur te /
translated: Those who hear that sound will have their desire, anger, and ignorance pacified.

original: chos zab mo la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: chos zab mo la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: They will attain the acceptance that accords with the profound Dharma.

original: de dag sangs rgyas nyid du yang de bzhin gshegs pas lung ston to //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas nyid du yang de bzhin gshegs pas lung ston to //
translated: The Thus-Gone One will prophesy their buddhahood.

original: de'i dus na nyon mongs mi 'byung ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i dus na nyon mongs mi 'byung ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: At that time, afflictions do not arise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis nyon mongs pa dang bral nas rab tu dang ba'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal nas byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis nyon mongs pa dang bral nas rab tu dang ba'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal nas byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
translated: Through the Thus-Gone One's blessing, they become free from afflictions and, with a pure mind, they bow to the Thus-Gone One and generate the mind set on awakening.

original: ba spu'i khung bu re re nas kyang 'od zer stong phrag brgya stong dum byung ba'i 'od kyis zil gyis mnan pas nyi ma la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi 'od shes pa med do //
analyzed: ba spu'i khung bu re re nas kyang 'od zer stong phrag brgya stong dum byung ba'i 'od kyis zil gyis mnan pas nyi ma la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi 'od shes pa med do //
translated: And from each of his pores a hundred thousand light rays issued forth, so that the light of the gods, the sun, and so on, was overwhelmed and became invisible.

original: mi gtsang ba dang / dri ma dang / nag nog snang ba med par gyur te nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi gtsang ba la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dang / dri ma dang / nag nog snang ba med par gyur te nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi gtsang ba la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: There was no appearance of impurity, filth, or darkness. For it is through the power of the afflictions that the impure and so on appear.

original: gzhan du na nyon mongs pa thams cad bag chags dang bcas bar spangs pa la mi gtsang ba la sogs pa snang ba'i skabs lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gzhan du na nyon mongs pa thams cad bag chags dang bcas bar spangs pa la mi gtsang ba la sogs pa snang ba'i skabs lta ga la yod /
translated: But when all afflictions are abandoned, together with their traces, how could there be any occasion for the appearance of impurity and so on?

original: zla 'od kyis thams cad yongs su sbyangs pa'i yang phyir ro //🔽lha rnams kyis gtor ba'i me tog de dag ni sa'i steng du me tog bkram par gyur to //
analyzed: zla 'od kyis thams cad yongs su sbyangs pa'i yang phyir ro // lha rnams kyis gtor ba'i me tog de dag ni sa'i steng du me tog bkram par gyur to //
translated: And it was also because Candraprabha had purified everything.🔽The flowers thrown by the gods became a flower-carpet on the ground.

original: mi rnams kyis gtor ba rnams ni nam mkha' la me tog gi gdugs su gyur to //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis gtor ba rnams ni nam mkha' la me tog gi gdugs su gyur to //
translated: Those thrown by the humans became a flower-canopy in the sky.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das srang gi dbus nas gshegs pa'i tshe sprul pa spros nas sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das srang gi dbus nas gshegs pa'i tshe sprul pa spros nas sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: When the Lord was going through the middle of the market, he emanated emanations and taught the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: 'og min gyi mthar thug ba'i lha rnams mchod pa sna tshogs kyis lag pa 'brel ba yang 'ongs so //
analyzed: 'og min gyi mthar thug ba'i lha rnams mchod pa sna tshogs kyis lag pa 'brel ba yang 'ongs so //
translated: The gods up to the Akaniṣṭha heaven also came, their hands full of various offerings.

original: de bzhin du gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / drang srong rnams tshar gcad pa dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams kyang 'dus nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la @55a * //🔽phyag 'tshal bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / drang srong rnams tshar gcad pa dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams kyang 'dus nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la @55a * // phyag 'tshal bar byed do //
translated: Similarly, the yakṣas, gandharvas, kinnaras, mahoragas, and ṛṣis, both those to be subdued and those to be benefited, gathered and bowed their heads to the feet of the Tathāgata.

original: grong dang grong khyer dang / ro dang nags na gnas pa dang / chu klung gi lha rnams kyang lhags so //
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer dang / ro dang nags na gnas pa dang / chu klung gi lha rnams kyang lhags so //
translated: The gods of the villages, towns, cities, charnel grounds, forests, and river banks also came.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi khyad par dpag tu med pa bskal pa bye ba brgya stong du yang shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi khyad par dpag tu med pa bskal pa bye ba brgya stong du yang shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Such were the countless special miracles, difficult to know even in a hundred thousand eons.

original: gtso bo'i yon tan dri ma med par 'jug pa'i mthu rnams ni //
analyzed: gtso bo'i yon tan dri ma med par 'jug pa'i mthu rnams ni //
translated: The qualities of the principal one, the powers of engaging in the stainless,

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam dpag med 'jam dbyangs blo yi yul gyur pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam dpag med 'jam dbyangs blo yi yul gyur pa //
translated: are equal to space, immeasurable, the domain of Mañjuśrī's mind.

original: grong mchog gshegs pa'i sgo them zhabs gzhag tshe na bstan //
analyzed: grong mchog gshegs pa'i sgo them zhabs gzhag tshe na bstan //
translated: When he places his foot on the threshold of the door to the supreme city, he reveals

original: bdag gi blo yis de la 'jug par ji ltar nus //
analyzed: bdag gi blo yis de la 'jug par ji ltar nus //
translated: how my mind can engage in that.

original: skye dang 'chi ba dang ldan bems po shin tu sdug bsngal bas //
analyzed: skye dang 'chi ba dang ldan bems po shin tu sdug bsngal bas //
translated: Having a nature of birth and death, being an inanimate being, and having great suffering,

original: skye ba kun du bdag ni 'di 'dra dang 'brel par //
analyzed: skye ba kun du bdag ni 'di 'dra dang 'brel par //
translated: in all births, may I not be connected with this.

original: bdag gis bsod nams sa bon 'di dang ldan par ma gyur ces //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams sa bon 'di dang ldan par ma gyur ces //
translated: May I not possess this seed of merit,

original: bkral ba yin gyis 'jig rten ngo mtshar gyur pa ci yang med //
analyzed: bkral ba yin gyis 'jig rten ngo mtshar gyur pa ci yang med //
translated: thus it is explained, there is no wonder in the world at all.

original: grong khyer du gshegs pa'i le'u ste bcu pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: grong khyer du gshegs pa'i le'u ste bcu pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the tenth chapter on entering the city is complete.

original: // / da ni mdo sde 'dzin pa'i le'u bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni mdo sde 'dzin pa'i le'u bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the chapter on upholding the sūtra,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zla 'od gzhon nu'i khyim du gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zla 'od gzhon nu'i khyim du gshegs so //
translated: it is said Then the Blessed One... and so on. He went to the house of the young Candraprabha.

original: gshegs nas kyang gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: gshegs nas kyang gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
translated: Having arrived, he sat down on the seat prepared for him.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun yang so sor gar 'os pa'i stan la 'khod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun yang so sor gar 'os pa'i stan la 'khod do //
translated: The community of bodhisattvas and the community of monks also sat down on their respective seats.

original: de nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang dge slong gi dge 'dun bzhugs par rig nas rang nyid kyis sngar 'dus byas pa'i zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pas tshim par byas nas /🔽bdar te zhes bya ba ni ci bzhed pa rnams ji ltar bde bar byas nas so //
analyzed: de nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang dge slong gi dge 'dun bzhugs par rig nas rang nyid kyis sngar 'dus byas pa'i zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pas tshim par byas nas / bdar te zhes bya ba ni ci bzhed pa rnams ji ltar bde bar byas nas so //
translated: Then, the youthful Candraprabha, knowing that the Blessed One, the community of bodhisattvas, and the community of monks were seated, himself served the previously prepared food with a hundred flavors and satisfied them.

original: bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol nas lhung bzed bzhag ste phyag bcabs par rig nas chos ston gyi yon du ras bcos bu zung bye ba stong phrag brgya ri ba phul lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol nas lhung bzed bzhag ste phyag bcabs par rig nas chos ston gyi yon du ras bcos bu zung bye ba stong phrag brgya ri ba phul lo //
translated: Having served and satisfied them as they wished, he said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, please accept this gift of a hundred thousand pieces of cloth for teaching the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ras zung re re'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ras zung re re'o //
translated: To the bodhisattvas, he offered a set of robes each.

original: dge slong rnams la ni chos gos gsum gsum phul lo //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la ni chos gos gsum gsum phul lo //
translated: To the monks, he offered three sets of robes each.

original: de nas langs te thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la tshul dang mthun pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bstod pa /
analyzed: de nas langs te thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la tshul dang mthun pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bstod pa /
translated: Then, rising, he bowed with folded hands and praised the Lord with appropriate verses:

original: skyes pa med cing 'gag pa med //
analyzed: skyes pa med cing 'gag pa med //
translated: He is unborn and unceasing,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: sku lus mi mnga' ba ni chos kyi sku la sku med par bstan to //
analyzed: sku lus mi mnga' ba ni chos kyi sku la sku med par bstan to //
translated: The absence of a physical body indicates the absence of a body in the Dharma Body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @55b skyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @55b skyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-birth.

original: de nyid kyis na 'gag pa med do //🔽bsam pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'gag pa med do // bsam pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: And for that very reason, he is unceasing.

original: bsam mi khyab ces bya ste /
analyzed: bsam mi khyab ces bya ste /
translated: He is said to be inconceivable because he transcends the domain of thought.

original: chos kyi sku'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: This is the praise in terms of the Dharma Body.

original: gzugs dang mtshan ni phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: gzugs dang mtshan ni phun sum tshogs //
translated: He is endowed with form and the major marks,

original: zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sgo nas so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sgo nas so ;
translated: in terms of the Enjoyment Body.

original: / shes rab kyis skyes zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las nges par byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / shes rab kyis skyes zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las nges par byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is born of wisdom, because he has emerged from the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: thabs dang stobs kyi rtsal kyang mnga' //
analyzed: thabs dang stobs kyi rtsal kyang mnga' //
translated: He has the power of means and strength,

original: zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i thabs kyis sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i phyir dang / don dam par nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i thugs mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i thabs kyis sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i phyir dang / don dam par nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i thugs mnga' ba'o //
translated: This is because he acts for the sake of all sentient beings without exception by means of the method of great compassion that is without objective referent, and because he has a mind that is ultimately like space.

original: ye shes rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: The phrase “ocean of intuition” is a homage to the basis of the intuition of omniscience.

original: de ltar na gtsug lag khang dang / zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / chos ston pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de ltar na gtsug lag khang dang / zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / chos ston pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: In this way, how does one engage in the activities of temple, food, drink, teaching the Dharma, and so on?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhugs pa'i spyod yul te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhugs pa'i spyod yul te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The domain of the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: gang la dran ba nye bar gzhag pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la dran ba nye bar gzhag pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who has the four establishments of mindfulness is called that.

original: gzims mal ni dga' ba dang bde ba'o //🔽btung ba ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: gzims mal ni dga' ba dang bde ba'o // btung ba ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Bed is pleasure and happiness.🔽Drink is meditative concentration.

original: bshos ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bshos ni bsam gtan no //
translated: Food is meditation.

original: stong pa nyid ni dgon pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni dgon pa ste /
translated: Emptiness is the wilderness.

original: thams cad du stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir dgon pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir dgon pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: He is a forest-dweller, because he always abides in emptiness.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin na yang gzugs kyi skur yang ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin na yang gzugs kyi skur yang ston pa'i phyir /
translated: And although he is of such a nature, he manifests a body of form.

original: rgyal ba thugs rje bsnyen bas na //
analyzed: rgyal ba thugs rje bsnyen bas na //
translated: The Victor, out of compassion,

original: zhes bya ba la thugs rje'i gzhan dbang du gyur pas bshos gsol ba dang / btung ba 'thung ba la sogs par yang ston te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la thugs rje'i gzhan dbang du gyur pas bshos gsol ba dang / btung ba 'thung ba la sogs par yang ston te //
translated: He manifests eating and drinking, etc., because he is under the sway of compassion.

original: ae ma sangs rgyas bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: ae ma sangs rgyas bsam mi khyab //
translated: How wonderful is the Buddha, inconceivable!

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni mchod pa tsam gyis mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa ngo mtshar che bar bstan to //🔽sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas par bshos gsol ba'i //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni mchod pa tsam gyis mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa ngo mtshar che bar bstan to // sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas par bshos gsol ba'i //
translated: By this and the following verses, he shows the wonder of passing into final nirvāṇa by the mere act of worship.🔽The merit that I have accumulated

original: bsod nams bdag gis gang gi bsags pa des //
analyzed: bsod nams bdag gis gang gi bsags pa des //
translated: by offering food to the Buddha and his disciples,

original: ji ltar khyod bzhin bdag kyang sangs rgyas su gyur cig / ces smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod bzhin bdag kyang sangs rgyas su gyur cig / ces smon lam btab bo //
translated: By this prayer, he prays that he might become a Buddha just like Śākyamuni.

original: yid kyis zhu ba zhus ba ni ngag gi bya ba la ltos pa med par yang tshig 'jug pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid kyis zhu ba zhus ba ni ngag gi bya ba la ltos pa med par yang tshig 'jug pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mental request is taught in order to show that the engagement of speech is not dependent on the activity of speech.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pas ci spyad na //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pas ci spyad na //
translated: What is the practice of the wise bodhisattva?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽ji ltar zhugs na chos rnams ji lta ba @56a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / ji ltar zhugs na chos rnams ji lta ba @56a * //
translated: and so forth.

original: bzhin du rab tu shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhin du rab tu shes par 'gyur /
translated: How does one engage in the practice so that one will know phenomena just as they are?

original: ji ltar na 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid bya ba la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid bya ba la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How does one engage in the practice of the characteristics of engagement?

original: skye ba dran par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba dran par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How does one remember one’s past lives?

original: 'khor rnams mi phyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'khor rnams mi phyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How does one become inseparable from one’s retinue?

original: ji ltar spobs pa mtha' yas par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar spobs pa mtha' yas par 'gyur /
translated: How does one become endowed with infinite eloquence?

original: zhes bya ba sogs pa'i zhu ba rnams kyi lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sogs pa'i zhu ba rnams kyi lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: and so forth.

original: bla 'od kyi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la bos nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bla 'od kyi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la bos nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts of the bodhisattvas, addressed the youth Candraprabha:

original: chos gcig dang ldan na yon tan 'di dag rab tu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: chos gcig dang ldan na yon tan 'di dag rab tu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: The phrase if one possesses one quality, one attains these good qualities refers to the immediately preceding passage.

original: chos gcig po gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gcig po gang zhe na /
translated: What is that one quality?

original: zhes the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dris pa dang / gzhon nu 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dris pa dang / gzhon nu 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: In order to dispel doubt, [the bodhisattva] asks, and the Blessed One replies beginning with Young man, in this regard...

original: chos thams cad ming dang bral bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni ming dang skad dang yi ge dang bral bas skye ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad ming dang bral bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni ming dang skad dang yi ge dang bral bas skye ba dang bral ba /
translated: The phrase one fully understands that all phenomena are free from names means that [one understands that] they are free from arising, free from names, languages, and syllables.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa sgro btags pa thams cad las dben pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can sems dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa sgro btags pa thams cad las dben pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can sems dang /
translated: They are devoid of all superimposed discordant characteristics of causes, conditions, and defining characteristics, and have the nature of non-duality, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and the defining characteristic of natural luminosity.

original: yid dang rnam par shes pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: yid dang rnam par shes pa dang bral ba /
translated: They are free from mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med bar chos thams cad rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med bar chos thams cad rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows all phenomena as devoid of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: don 'di dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify these very topics, he states the following verse:

original: chos rnams bstan pa gcig po ni //
analyzed: chos rnams bstan pa gcig po ni //
translated: The single teaching of the Dharma🔽is the teaching of the Dharma by the Tathāgatas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The single teaching is stated in the following:

original: chos rnams thams cad mtshan nyid med //🔽ces bya ba ni nges par bstan pa gcig go //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad mtshan nyid med // ces bya ba ni nges par bstan pa gcig go //
translated: All phenomena are devoid of a characteristic.

original: gang gis chos gcig rab tu bstan pa 'di rab tu shes pa des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyin gyi rlabs kyis yang dag pa'i mtha' rab tu shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis chos gcig rab tu bstan pa 'di rab tu shes pa des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyin gyi rlabs kyis yang dag pa'i mtha' rab tu shes par 'gyur te /
translated: One who knows this single teaching of the Dharma by the Tathāgatas, he knows the limit of reality through the Tathāgata’s empowerment.

original: 'dir gang gis ci yang brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang gis ci yang brjod du med pa'o //
translated: Here, he knows that nothing whatsoever is expressed.

original: gcig gis kyang ni thams cad shes //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gcig gis kyang ni thams cad shes // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One who knows one thing knows all things.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid du gang gis shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid du gang gis shes pa'o //
translated: One who knows the limit of reality as it is.

original: shes nas ming dang rgyu mtshan la sogs pa la chos thams cad sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' med pas ma skyes par shes so /
analyzed: shes nas ming dang rgyu mtshan la sogs pa la chos thams cad sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' med pas ma skyes par shes so /
translated: Having understood, one knows that all phenomena are unborn, because they are without a prior limit or a posterior limit, in terms of name, reason, etc.

original: skye ba dran par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba dran par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can one remember what has not arisen?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan ni gang gi tshe skye ba dran pa de'i tshe bya ba thams cad @56b la rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan ni gang gi tshe skye ba dran pa de'i tshe bya ba thams cad @56b la rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The answer to this is that when one remembers what has arisen, then one is not confused about all actions.

original: des na rmongs pa med na yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su shes so //
analyzed: des na rmongs pa med na yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su shes so //
translated: Therefore, when there is no confusion, one understands the reality limit.

original: yang dag ba'i mtha' yongs su shes na /
analyzed: yang dag ba'i mtha' yongs su shes na /
translated: Having understood the reality limit,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams mi phyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams mi phyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: the retinue of bodhisattvas becomes inseparable.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin yongs su mi shes pa'i byis pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin yongs su mi shes pa'i byis pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Childlike beings, who do not understand the nature of phenomena, experience the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: chos rnams la mi rtog pa ni rang gi rnam par rtog pas bzos sprul pa'i sgyu ma'i dra ba'i rang bzhin la mkhas pa rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams la mi rtog pa ni rang gi rnam par rtog pas bzos sprul pa'i sgyu ma'i dra ba'i rang bzhin la mkhas pa rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not conceptualize phenomena, who are skilled in the nature of the illusory net of emanations created by their own conceptions, are not confused.

original: de'i phyir / stong pa rnyog pa med pa'i chos //
analyzed: de'i phyir / stong pa rnyog pa med pa'i chos //
translated: The Dharma is empty, clear,

original: 'di ni mkhas pa'i sa yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni mkhas pa'i sa yin te //
translated: This is the stage of the wise.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyan ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyan ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa ste /
translated: The ornament of the Buddha's teachings is the Blessed One's teaching,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa ma lus pa bag chags dang bcas pa rab tu spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa ma lus pa bag chags dang bcas pa rab tu spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the complete abandonment of all afflictions along with their traces through the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rab tu spangs par gyur pa de'i tshe gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rab tu spangs par gyur pa de'i tshe gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the bodhisattva has completely abandoned the afflictions along with their traces, then he does not cling to forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile objects, or mental objects.

original: de mi gnas pa'i sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi rigs la gnas nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten te /
analyzed: de mi gnas pa'i sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi rigs la gnas nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten te /
translated: By the application of non-abiding, abiding in the lineage of the Buddha, relying on the spiritual friend,

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyis sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyis sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom, one attains buddhahood.

original: de la lha klu rtag tu bkur sti byed //
analyzed: de la lha klu rtag tu bkur sti byed //
translated: The gods and nagas always honor him.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni chos la gus pa nyid kyis chos nyid la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la thams cad mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni chos la gus pa nyid kyis chos nyid la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la thams cad mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro ;
translated: By this and other such statements, it is shown that because of his reverence for the Dharma, the bodhisattva who is engaged in the Dharma will be honored by all.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rab tu dgyes pa'i thugs kyis zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams rab tu ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rab tu dgyes pa'i thugs kyis zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams rab tu ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Tathagatas, with minds of delight, will teach him the profound and extensive Dharma.

original: gang gis stong nyid shes de byang chub sems //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid shes de byang chub sems //
translated: The bodhisattva who knows emptiness

original: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa 'dul ba'i phyir stong pa nyid dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa 'dul ba'i phyir stong pa nyid dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in emptiness will teach the Dharma endowed with emptiness in order to discipline the immeasurable realm of sentient beings.

original: de thos nas bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thos nas bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having heard that, they will enter into the attainment of the unsurpassed pristine awareness of buddhahood.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then they will see the Tathagata.

original: des kyang de dag la chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang de dag la chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will teach them the Dharma.

original: chos kun @57a * //
analyzed: chos kun @57a * //
translated: All phenomena

original: sgyu ma lta bur shes par gyis //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur shes par gyis //
translated: are to be understood as illusion-like.

original: ji ltar bar snang rang bzhin stong pa ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar bar snang rang bzhin stong pa ltar //
translated: Just as space is naturally empty in the middle,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i nam mkha' ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i don byed pa tsam gyi phyir rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i nam mkha' ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i don byed pa tsam gyi phyir rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: pristine awareness is like space, which is originally unborn, because it is naturally empty, since it merely performs the function of obstructing material things.

original: de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par shes nas zhen pa med pas thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par shes nas zhen pa med pas thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having understood that all phenomena are naturally empty, they will be free from attachment and will perform the benefit of all sentient beings everywhere.

original: de dag gi yang rang bzhin de 'drar shes //
analyzed: de dag gi yang rang bzhin de 'drar shes //
translated: And they will understand the nature of those to be like that.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: shes pas gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la mngon par bltas nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas pa'i sems can gdul bya rnams gdul ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa rnams spros te /
analyzed: shes pas gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la mngon par bltas nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas pa'i sems can gdul bya rnams gdul ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa rnams spros te /
translated: Having fully observed the beings to be trained by means of his knowledge, the emanations of the Tathagata emanate in order to train the beings of infinite buddha-fields to be trained.

original: de dag tu sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de mya ngan las 'das kyang skye ba dang 'gag pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: de dag tu sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de mya ngan las 'das kyang skye ba dang 'gag pa ci yang med do //
translated: And they perform the deeds of a buddha there, but they do not have any birth or cessation at all.

original: de ltar chos kun la yang rab brtags te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar chos kun la yang rab brtags te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, having fully examined all phenomena,

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyud mi gcad pa'i phyir zhugs nas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'i sku chen por gyur nas /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyud mi gcad pa'i phyir zhugs nas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'i sku chen por gyur nas /
translated: Having generated the mind of enlightenment, having entered in order to not cut off the lineage of the buddhas, having become a great body adorned with the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks,

original: bdud thams cad kyis mi g-yo ba'i yid dang / sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar brtse ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / gsol ba 'debs pa med bzhin rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis mi g-yo ba'i yid dang / sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar brtse ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / gsol ba 'debs pa med bzhin rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the one with an unshakable mind against all demons, the one with the superior intention of loving all sentient beings as his only child, and the one with spiritual friends who always remain close by without being asked.

original: spobs pa mi zad pas mdo sde dpag tu med pa'i don shin tu phra ba rab tu ston pa la mkhas pas nges pa'i tshigs so sor yang dag par rig pa'i stobs kyis sems can thams cad gdul ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa mi zad pas mdo sde dpag tu med pa'i don shin tu phra ba rab tu ston pa la mkhas pas nges pa'i tshigs so sor yang dag par rig pa'i stobs kyis sems can thams cad gdul ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is the one with the power of analytical knowledge of the meaning, skilled in teaching the extremely subtle meaning of the limitless sūtras with inexhaustible eloquence, and the one skilled in guiding all sentient beings.

original: ma tshang ba med pa'i stobs kyis shugs 'chang zhing //
analyzed: ma tshang ba med pa'i stobs kyis shugs 'chang zhing //
translated: He is the one who possesses the power of the complete strength,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: shin tu phra ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir mtshang ba med pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir mtshang ba med pa'i stobs te /
translated: The power of completeness is the realization of the nature of extremely subtle phenomena.

original: stobs bcu thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs bcu thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will attain the ten powers.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams la yang yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon dang yon tan gyi tshogs ston te go sla'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams la yang yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon dang yon tan gyi tshogs ston te go sla'o //
translated: And it is pleasing to the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and so on, shows the qualities and benefits in this life, which are easy to understand.

original: bskal pa stong mang de yi bsod nams stobs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
