analyzed: bskal pa stong mang de yi bsod nams stobs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The merit of those who uphold the sutra is said to be like this: For many thousands of eons, their merit would be immeasurable.

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa'i bsod nams ni mtha' yas shing smra bar mi nus te /
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa'i bsod nams ni mtha' yas shing smra bar mi nus te /
translated: Here, the merit of upholding the sutra is limitless and cannot be expressed.

original: dpag tu med pa'i phyir @57b ro ;
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i phyir @57b ro ;
translated: Because it is immeasurable,

original: / mdo sde 'dzin pa'i bsod nams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir /🔽skyes bu la la bsod nams 'dod pas 'dir //
analyzed: / mdo sde 'dzin pa'i bsod nams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir / skyes bu la la bsod nams 'dod pas 'dir //
translated: in order to express the greatness of the merit of upholding the sutra,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said:

original: ji ltar skyes bu bsod nams 'dod pa 'ga' zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med par bsnyen bkur dang kun tu spyod pas bsnyen bkur byas la /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu bsod nams 'dod pa 'ga' zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med par bsnyen bkur dang kun tu spyod pas bsnyen bkur byas la /
translated: If someone desiring merit were to serve the Tathagatas with various offerings for countless hundreds of thousands of millions of eons,🔽and if another person were to take up this sutra and recite it, or even just a verse of four lines, the merit of the latter would surpass that of the former.

original: gzhan bsod nams 'dod pa zhig gis chos zab mo'i tshul 'di las sems shin tu dang bas tshigs su bcas pa gcig cig phyi mi 'dus te dam pa'i chos 'jig pa'i dus su 'dzin na /
analyzed: gzhan bsod nams 'dod pa zhig gis chos zab mo'i tshul 'di las sems shin tu dang bas tshigs su bcas pa gcig cig phyi mi 'dus te dam pa'i chos 'jig pa'i dus su 'dzin na /
translated: If he holds it at the time of the destruction of the holy Dharma,

original: de la snga ma'i bsod nams char mi phod //
analyzed: de la snga ma'i bsod nams char mi phod //
translated: the former merit does not equal even a fraction of that.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: sngar bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur byas pa'i bsod nams kyi char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur byas pa'i bsod nams kyi char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: it means that it does not equal even a fraction of the merit of making offerings and venerating the Tathagatas as previously explained.

original: gtso bo nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the principal one.

original: de phyir bye brag 'di 'phags de 'dra ste //
analyzed: de phyir bye brag 'di 'phags de 'dra ste //
translated: Therefore, this is the distinction of the noble ones, such as🔽.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar sdud pa'o //🔽bsod nams dpag med dpe las 'das gyur ba //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar sdud pa'o // bsod nams dpag med dpe las 'das gyur ba //
translated: This concludes the summary.🔽Having attained here immeasurable merit beyond example,

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam 'dir ni thob gyur pas //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam 'dir ni thob gyur pas //
translated: equal to space,

original: tshig gi bdag po 'jom mchog 'dra gyur pa //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag po 'jom mchog 'dra gyur pa //
translated: the one who becomes like the supreme lord of speech,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' de rgyal sras //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' de rgyal sras //
translated: that is the bodhisattva, the heir of the victors.

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the eleventh chapter, the chapter on the holders of the sutra.

original: // / da ni ting nge 'dzin rjes su bslab pa'i le'u /
analyzed: // / da ni ting nge 'dzin rjes su bslab pa'i le'u /
translated: Now, the chapter on the subsequent training in samadhi.

original: gzhon nu de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ta /
analyzed: gzhon nu de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ta /
translated: The youthful one, etc.

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa'i le'ur phan yon bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig gis /
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa'i le'ur phan yon bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig gis /
translated: In the chapter on the holders of the sutra, the benefits were taught first.

original: gzhon nu sems ni ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu sems ni ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: The youthful one, the mind is essenceless,

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: formless,

original: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: indemonstrable, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'o //
translated: Because it is essenceless, it is formless.

original: gzugs med pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di'o 'di ni 'di'o zhes nges par bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di'o 'di ni 'di'o zhes nges par bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Because it is formless, it cannot be demonstrated with certainty as this or that.

original: sems ci lta ba sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems ci lta ba sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yang de lta bu'o //
translated: Just as the mind is, so are the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de lta bu'o //
translated: The Tathagata is also like that.

original: chos thams cad kyang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de lta bu'o //
translated: All phenomena are also like that.

original: zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de ni nges par brtags pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de ni nges par brtags pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who understands this will become skilled in definitive investigation.

original: de ni khams gsum las byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni khams gsum las byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is skill in the arising of the three realms.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa'o //🔽khams gsum la ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa'o // khams gsum la ma chags pa'o //
translated: It is to do what one says.

original: khams @58a * //
analyzed: khams @58a * //
translated: It is to be free from attachment to the three realms.

original: gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: It is to transcend the three realms.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sgra dang yi ge la mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba de ni chos kyi tshul la mkhas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sgra dang yi ge la mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba de ni chos kyi tshul la mkhas so //
translated: It is to be free from attachment to desire, form, and formlessness, to afflictions, to words and letters. This is skill in the way of the Dharma.

original: chos thams cad kyi tshul rnam par dgod pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa'i blo dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyis zil gyis non par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshul rnam par dgod pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa'i blo dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyis zil gyis non par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one is endowed with the mind that is skilled in the wisdom that establishes the way of all phenomena, one cannot be overcome by others.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: When this Dharma discourse was explained,

original: lha dang mi'i skye dgu sngon yongs su sbyong ba byas pa khrag khrig phrag dgu bcu rtsa brgyad kyis zhes bya ba ni sbyang ba byas pa bye ba brgya stong chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye dgu sngon yongs su sbyong ba byas pa khrag khrig phrag dgu bcu rtsa brgyad kyis zhes bya ba ni sbyang ba byas pa bye ba brgya stong chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The 9,800,000,000 gods and men who had previously purified themselves, up to: by the power of their acceptance of the profound Dharma.

original: gzungs ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: gzungs ni shes rab bo //
translated: The dhāraṇī is wisdom.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i bzod pa so sor thob par gyur to //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i bzod pa so sor thob par gyur to //
translated: They attained the acceptance that is free from obscurations.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan pa ni sangs rgyas su de bsam pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan pa ni sangs rgyas su de bsam pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One prophesied them as Buddhas because their intention was definite.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: Here it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni don de nyid slar yang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni don de nyid slar yang bstan pa'o //
translated: And so on. With this verse and so on, he again teaches that very meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan gang //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan gang //
translated: The wise bodhisattvas

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas chos thams cad chos nyid du mtshan nyid gcig par shes pa'i phyir sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i sems brten pos chos
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas chos thams cad chos nyid du mtshan nyid gcig par shes pa'i phyir sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i sems brten pos chos
translated: In such passages, a bodhisattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood should rely on the mind free from the perception of multiplicity in order to understand that all phenomena are of one characteristic in reality.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su bslab par bya'o //
translated: In order to perfect the meditative absorption that elaborates the equality of the nature of all phenomena, one should train accordingly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku yin gyi gzugs kyi sku ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku yin gyi gzugs kyi sku ni ma yin te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is the dharmakāya, not the rūpakāya,

original: sgro btags pa'i rtog pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rtog pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all conceptual superimpositions have been thoroughly abandoned.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos kyi sku mthong ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos kyi sku mthong ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing the inconceivable dharmakāya is seeing the Buddha.

original: ting nge 'dzin mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seeing meditative absorption.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid do zhes rnam par rig nas khams gsum la mi brten pa'i sems ni bdud dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa'i sems kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid do zhes rnam par rig nas khams gsum la mi brten pa'i sems ni bdud dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa'i sems kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: In the same way, having understood that all phenomena are of the nature of space, the mind does not rest on the three realms. With a mind that is unshaken by all demons and thoughts, one abides in the bliss of samadhi.

original: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med par chos rnams rang bzhin rtogs na yang /
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med par chos rnams rang bzhin rtogs na yang /
translated: Even though phenomena are realized to be unborn and unceasing by nature,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i @58b gnas rnams ma nyams pas gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba der smon lam gyi dbang gis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i @58b gnas rnams ma nyams pas gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba der smon lam gyi dbang gis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: one is not without the precepts of morality taught by the Tathagata. Wherever one sees the benefit of sentient beings, one is born there by the power of aspiration.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i smon lam 'grub par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i smon lam 'grub par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the aspirations of one with morality will be fulfilled.

original: bzod pa sgom par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa sgom par byed /
translated: One cultivates patience.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: One undertakes effort.

original: bsam gtan las mi nyams ;
analyzed: bsam gtan las mi nyams ;
translated: One does not fall away from meditative concentration.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can kyi shes rab la slob pa ni ting nge 'dzin la rjes su slob pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can kyi shes rab la slob pa ni ting nge 'dzin la rjes su slob pa yin no //
translated: Training in the wisdom which has the characteristic of discriminating the dharmas is training in samadhi.

original: ting 'dzin sems la nges rtog pa //
analyzed: ting 'dzin sems la nges rtog pa //
translated: Samadhi is the ascertainment of mind.

original: kun du rnam par mi rtog nyid //
analyzed: kun du rnam par mi rtog nyid //
translated: It is non-imagination in all ways.

original: de la yang dag rjes slob pa //
analyzed: de la yang dag rjes slob pa //
translated: Training in that is

original: bsgrub pa zhes 'dir bshad pa yin //
analyzed: bsgrub pa zhes 'dir bshad pa yin //
translated: called “accomplishment” here.

original: ting nge 'dzin la rjes su slob pa'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la rjes su slob pa'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twelfth chapter, on training in samadhi.

original: // / ting nge 'dzin la slob pa'i rjes su ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / ting nge 'dzin la slob pa'i rjes su ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of samadhi after training in samadhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin nges par bstan pa la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nges par bstan pa la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “One should be skilled in the teaching of samadhi.”

original: gang chos thams cad kyi ji lta ba bzhin nyid dang zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi ji lta ba bzhin nyid dang zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: “The suchness of all dharmas” means that suchness is the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: de ni mi rtog pa log par mthong ba ma yin pa gang gis kyang nye bar ma bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rtog pa log par mthong ba ma yin pa gang gis kyang nye bar ma bskyed pa ste /
translated: It is not produced by any kind of false non-imagination.

original: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: It is non-arising and unceasing.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / chos dang chos can dang / las dang bya ba la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa rgyun chad pa /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / chos dang chos can dang / las dang bya ba la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa rgyun chad pa /
translated: It is the cessation of mental activity concerning mind and mental factors, phenomena and their attributes, actions and their results, and so on.

original: phung po la sogs pa rjes su mi dmigs pa dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtog pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / brtan pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / nan tan gyi gnas su gyur pa /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rjes su mi dmigs pa dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtog pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / brtan pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / nan tan gyi gnas su gyur pa /
translated: It is the absence of the object of mindfulness, understanding, thought, conscience, firmness, ritual, sphere, and conscientious attitude, which is the nature of the non-apprehension of the aggregates and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi slob pa ting nge 'dzin las rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi slob pa ting nge 'dzin las rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: It is the renunciation of concentration that is the training of all bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa la de ni ting nge 'dzin nges par bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa la de ni ting nge 'dzin nges par bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And it is the basis for the qualities of a buddha. This is called the teaching of concentration.

original: nges par bstan pa 'di la rab tu gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par bstan pa 'di la rab tu gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who definitely abides in this teaching will not be separated from meditative concentration.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan dang mngon par mi 'bral te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan dang mngon par mi 'bral te /
translated: One will not be separated from the qualities of all the Buddhas.

original: sems 'khrul pa med pa yin /
analyzed: sems 'khrul pa med pa yin /
translated: One will have an undeluded mind.

original: lhun gyis grub pa yin /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa yin /
translated: One will be spontaneous.

original: sems can ma lus pa'i don byed par nus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa'i don byed par nus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One will be able to benefit all sentient beings without exception.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo gsungs te /🔽ting @59a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo gsungs te / ting @59a * //
translated: Then, the Blessed One spoke about the essence of meditative concentration, beginning with the words “Then, the Blessed One entered into the meditative concentration called ‘The King of Meditative Concentrations That Are the Essence of All Buddhas.’🔽Meditative concentration

original: 'dzin mnyam pa med pa'i sa //
analyzed: 'dzin mnyam pa med pa'i sa //
translated: is beyond equality.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: mnyam pa med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Equality is emptiness.

original: zhi ba ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'o //
translated: Peace is natural peace.

original: phra ba ni rags pa la dmigs pa'i blos rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba ni rags pa la dmigs pa'i blos rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Subtle means that it cannot be realized by a mind that observes the coarse.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mthong dka'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mthong dka'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is difficult to see.

original: gang gi phyir 'du shes thams cad bcom pa ste de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'du shes thams cad bcom pa ste de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Because all discriminations are destroyed, therefore it is called meditative concentration.

original: stong pa nyid ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Emptiness is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “samādhi.”

original: de dag rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rtog pa med cing rnam rtog med //
analyzed: de dag rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir / rtog pa med cing rnam rtog med //
translated: In order to teach those extensively,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, “Without thought, without discursiveness.”🔽In that,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par spangs pa ni gzhi med pas bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par spangs pa ni gzhi med pas bstan du med pa'o //
translated: the avoidance of the concepts of apprehended and apprehender is taught to be baseless and imperceptible.

original: sems kyang dmigs pa med pa ste //
analyzed: sems kyang dmigs pa med pa ste //
translated: The mind is also without reference point.

original: de phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is called “samādhi.”

original: mnyam par gzhag par gyur kyang rlom sems med pa ni /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag par gyur kyang rlom sems med pa ni /
translated: Even when one is in samādhi, there is no conceit.

original: rlom sems med pa ji bzhin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bsgrags so ;
analyzed: rlom sems med pa ji bzhin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bsgrags so ;
translated: That non-conceit is proclaimed to be samādhi.

original: / chos ni rdul tsam yang yod med pas yod pa ma yin pa la dmigs par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: / chos ni rdul tsam yang yod med pas yod pa ma yin pa la dmigs par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since there is not even an atom of phenomena, how could there be an existent reference point?

original: chos rnams dmigs su med pa ste //🔽de phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya //
analyzed: chos rnams dmigs su med pa ste // de phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya //
translated: Phenomena are without reference point.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is called “samādhi.”

original: sems kyis dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba de yang rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba de yang rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: That is also a conceptualization.

original: chos de rnam par ma brtags pa //
analyzed: chos de rnam par ma brtags pa //
translated: Those phenomena are not examined.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang zhes byas nas so //
translated: Having said that, the phenomena of mind and mental factors are also🔽.

original: sgra yis don rnams rab bstan te //🔽sgra de nyid kyang dngos po med //
analyzed: sgra yis don rnams rab bstan te // sgra de nyid kyang dngos po med //
translated: Sounds teach objects.🔽That sound itself is unreal.

original: mi bden pa yi sgra de yis //
analyzed: mi bden pa yi sgra de yis //
translated: By that unreal sound,

original: gang du ci zhig ston par byed //
analyzed: gang du ci zhig ston par byed //
translated: what is taught and where?

original: sgra ni brag ca lta bu ste //
analyzed: sgra ni brag ca lta bu ste //
translated: Sound is like an echo,

original: 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig tsam nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig tsam nyid do //
translated: merely a delusion.

original: zhes bya'o // chos 'di rnams ni mi gnas te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // chos 'di rnams ni mi gnas te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: These phenomena do not abide.

original: gnas dang / gnas pa dang / gnas pa po rnams mi dmigs pa ni gnas pa med pa nyid gnas pa po zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: gnas dang / gnas pa dang / gnas pa po rnams mi dmigs pa ni gnas pa med pa nyid gnas pa po zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod do //
translated: Here, the non-observation of an abode, abiding, and an abider is called “non-abiding” and is expressed by the term “abider.”

original: de bzhin du /🔽'gro zhing 'chi 'phor brjod pa yi //
analyzed: de bzhin du / 'gro zhing 'chi 'phor brjod pa yi //
translated: Similarly,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said that one goes and transmigrates.

original: 'chi 'pho dang 'gro ba dang bral ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang 'gro ba dang bral ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: The essence of meditative concentration is said to be free from death, transmigration, and going.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'o zhes bya ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o snyam pa'i rlom sems te /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'o zhes bya ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o snyam pa'i rlom sems te /
translated: The thought “I am in meditative equipoise” or “I am not in meditative equipoise” is conceit.

original: rlom sems ma lus pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shin tu mnyam par @59b gzhag pa nyid kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rlom sems ma lus pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shin tu mnyam par @59b gzhag pa nyid kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is free from all conceit attains unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment through meditative equipoise itself.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang mngon par ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang mngon par ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who engages in the sameness of meditative serenity and insight is said to be endowed with the cultivation of meditative concentration.

original: yi ge dag gis 'jug par mi nus te ;🔽/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yi ge dag gis 'jug par mi nus te ; / zhes bya ba la /
translated: It cannot be entered by means of syllables.

original: chos nyid la zhugs pa la yi ge'i nyams su myong ba yod par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: chos nyid la zhugs pa la yi ge'i nyams su myong ba yod par mi 'gyur te //
translated: One who has entered reality does not experience syllables.

original: yi ge dang skad dang sgra thams cad dang bral ba bsgom pa tsam gyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge dang skad dang sgra thams cad dang bral ba bsgom pa tsam gyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be realized by mere meditation, free from all letters, speech, and sounds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig ji skad bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la mngon par dga' bas sems gzhan ma yin pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig ji skad bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la mngon par dga' bas sems gzhan ma yin pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i sems so //
translated: The bodhisattva who is devoted to the cultivation of the meditative absorption as it has been explained, whose mind is not otherwise, has a mind equal to space.

original: gal te zhing 'di bskal pas tshig gyur kyang //
analyzed: gal te zhing 'di bskal pas tshig gyur kyang //
translated: If this realm were to be consumed by the conflagration at the end of the eon,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi nus pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi nus pa ston pa yin no //
translated: This and the following passages show the power of meditative absorption.

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di bskal pa sreg pa'i mes bsregs pas snod kyi 'jig rten thal ba bzhin du mngon sum du byas par gyur kyang ri'i mchog gi dbus su zhugs pa de mes mi tshig go //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di bskal pa sreg pa'i mes bsregs pas snod kyi 'jig rten thal ba bzhin du mngon sum du byas par gyur kyang ri'i mchog gi dbus su zhugs pa de mes mi tshig go //
translated: If this buddha realm were to be consumed by the fire at the end of the eon, and the world of the environment were to be reduced to ashes, the one who has entered the center of the king of mountains would not be burned by the fire.

original: ci'i phyir bsreg bya'i dngos po yin na mi 'tshig ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsreg bya'i dngos po yin na mi 'tshig ce na /
translated: Why is it that if it is something that can be burned, it is not burned?

original: nam mkha' sngon chad nam yang mi 'tshig bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha' sngon chad nam yang mi 'tshig bzhin //
translated: Just as space has never been burned in the past,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This and the following passages show the power of meditative absorption.

original: bskal pa mi nyung bar 'jig pa'i bskal pa'i mes 'jig rten gyis khams 'di bsregs kyang nam mkha' ni tshig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bskal pa mi nyung bar 'jig pa'i bskal pa'i mes 'jig rten gyis khams 'di bsregs kyang nam mkha' ni tshig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: For countless eons, the fire of the eon of destruction burns this world system, but space is not burned,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has no intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa yang nam mkha' bzhin dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba la yang bsregs par bya ba'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i phyir de tshig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa yang nam mkha' bzhin dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba la yang bsregs par bya ba'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i phyir de tshig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, one who enters the meditative absorption equal to space, like space, is free from all reference points and is not burned, because the essence of what is to be burned is not observed.

original: gal te sangs rgyas zhing 'di 'bar gyur kyang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas zhing 'di 'bar gyur kyang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if this buddha field were to burn,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di bskal ba'i mes sreg par byed pa na ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas bskal pa'i me rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir yid kyis sam tshig gis kyang rung /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di bskal ba'i mes sreg par byed pa na ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas bskal pa'i me rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir yid kyis sam tshig gis kyang rung /
translated: When this buddha field is burned by the fire of the eon, one who abides in meditative absorption, either mentally or verbally, in order to extinguish the fire of the eon,

original: bskal pa bsreg pa'i me rab tu zhi bar gyur cig / ces bya ba brjod pa na skad cig de nyid la ma lus par rab tu zhi bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa bsreg pa'i me rab tu zhi bar gyur cig / ces bya ba brjod pa na skad cig de nyid la ma lus par rab tu zhi bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: May the fire of the eon's conflagration be pacified! and at that very moment, without exception, it is pacified, not otherwise.

original: sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni gzhan du 'gyur yang srid de /🔽de'i gnyen @60a * //🔽po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽stong pa nyid la ni gnyen po'i phyogs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni gzhan du 'gyur yang srid de / de'i gnyen @60a * // po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro // stong pa nyid la ni gnyen po'i phyogs med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is possible that the four great elements are transformed by the power of spells and so on, but not by the power of emptiness.🔽Because it is the antidote to that, but emptiness has no antidote.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Because it is the antidote to that, but emptiness has no antidote.

original: de yi rdzu 'phrul stobs kyang mtha' yas 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi rdzu 'phrul stobs kyang mtha' yas 'gyur //
translated: And his magical power will be infinite.

original: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs la byang chub sems dpa' de mngon sum du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs la byang chub sems dpa' de mngon sum du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of concentration, the bodhisattva becomes directly aware of various kinds of magical power, such as going and coming in immeasurable buddha-fields.

original: spobs pa mtha' yas pas chos mtha' yas pa nyan pa dang / sprul pa mtha' yas pa spro bar byed pa dang / yon tan gyi tshogs mtha' yas pa nges par bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spobs pa mtha' yas pas chos mtha' yas pa nyan pa dang / sprul pa mtha' yas pa spro bar byed pa dang / yon tan gyi tshogs mtha' yas pa nges par bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
translated: because of listening to infinite Dharma with infinite eloquence, because of emanating infinite emanations, and because of definitely accomplishing infinite collections of good qualities.

original: de tshe rdzu 'phrul khyad par thob //
analyzed: de tshe rdzu 'phrul khyad par thob //
translated: Then one attains the special power of superknowledge.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the rest,

original: nam zhig nyon mongs med gyur pa //
analyzed: nam zhig nyon mongs med gyur pa //
translated: when one is free from afflictions,

original: de tshe rdzu 'phrul thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: de tshe rdzu 'phrul thob 'gyur te //
translated: then one attains the power of superknowledge.🔽When one has abandoned the afflictions that are the discordant class with meditative concentration, then one attains the power of superknowledge.

original: gang gi tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa nyon mongs pa rnam par spangs par gyur pa de'i tshe rdzu 'phrul la dbang thob par gyur pa na ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ston par 'gyur bas brtags pa'i dri
analyzed: gang gi tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa nyon mongs pa rnam par spangs par gyur pa de'i tshe rdzu 'phrul la dbang thob par gyur pa na ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ston par 'gyur bas brtags pa'i dri
translated: When one has attained the power of superknowledge, one can display the supernormal power of miracles just as one wishes.

original: ma thams cad spangs par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: ma thams cad spangs par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should train in meditative concentration, which is free from all the stains of conceptual thought.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs pa //
translated: The various worlds of the environment

original: 'jig pa'i dus kyi mes bcom phyir byas kyang /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus kyi mes bcom phyir byas kyang /
translated: Even if the fire at the time of destruction were to destroy it,

original: nam mkha' bcom zhing phye mar byed mi nus //
analyzed: nam mkha' bcom zhing phye mar byed mi nus //
translated: it would not be able to destroy or pulverize space.

original: de bzhin ting 'dzin brtan thob rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: de bzhin ting 'dzin brtan thob rnal 'byor pa //
translated: Similarly, a yogi who has attained stable concentration

original: ting nge 'dzin nges par bstan pa'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nges par bstan pa'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the thirteenth chapter on demonstrating meditative concentration is complete.

original: // / da ni lung bstan pa'i mtshan ma 'dzum pa yang dag par bstan pa'i le'u rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni lung bstan pa'i mtshan ma 'dzum pa yang dag par bstan pa'i le'u rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to fully demonstrate the sign of the prophecy, the smile,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: it is said thereupon and so forth.

original: de nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pas bstod pa ni yang dag pa'i yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas 'dzum pa mdzad pa yongs su zhu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pas bstod pa ni yang dag pa'i yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas 'dzum pa mdzad pa yongs su zhu ba'i phyir /
translated: Thereupon, when the youthful Candraprabha was given the opportunity by the Blessed One, he praised the Blessed One with verses, and in order to fully inquire about the smiling that preceded the expression of true qualities,

original: sdug bsngal gtses pa'i sems can gzigs nas ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gtses pa'i sems can gzigs nas ni //
translated: having seen sentient beings afflicted by suffering,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyis kun nas dkrugs pa'i sems can rnams la gzigs nas de dag nye bar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub tu thugs bskyed par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyis kun nas dkrugs pa'i sems can rnams la gzigs nas de dag nye bar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub tu thugs bskyed par mdzad de /
translated: Having seen sentient beings disturbed by desire, hatred, and ignorance, he generated the Mind of Enlightenment in order to take them up.

original: sangs rgyas su gyur @60b nas sems can ma lus pa rab tu dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya'o //🔽dpa' bos bskal pa bye ba mang spyad de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su gyur @60b nas sems can ma lus pa rab tu dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya'o // dpa' bos bskal pa bye ba mang spyad de //
translated: Having become a Buddha, he said, “I will liberate all sentient beings without exception.”

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The hero practiced for many millions of eons.🔽Here, generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom are cultivated for many eons, not few.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab rnams bskal pa mi nyung bar goms par mdzad pa'i sbyin pa re zhig gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab rnams bskal pa mi nyung bar goms par mdzad pa'i sbyin pa re zhig gsungs pa /
translated: First, generosity is taught:

original: glang po dang / mgyogs 'gro dang / shing rta'i mchog dang / grong khyer gyi mchog dang / rgyal srid kyis mchog dang / khyim dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / yan lag gi mchog la sogs pa yang byang chub kyi phyir sbyin pa btang ngo //
analyzed: glang po dang / mgyogs 'gro dang / shing rta'i mchog dang / grong khyer gyi mchog dang / rgyal srid kyis mchog dang / khyim dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / yan lag gi mchog la sogs pa yang byang chub kyi phyir sbyin pa btang ngo //
translated: He gave away elephants, horses, chariots, the best of cities, the best of kingdoms, houses, wives, sons, hands, feet, the best of limbs, and so on, for the sake of enlightenment.

original: khyed kyi tshul khrims dri med rnam dag ste //
analyzed: khyed kyi tshul khrims dri med rnam dag ste //
translated: Your morality is stainless and pure.

original: zhes bya ba la tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dri ma spangs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dri ma spangs pas /
translated: Here, by abandoning the stain of immorality,

original: bdag nyid gtong zhing tshul khrims yongs mi nyams //
analyzed: bdag nyid gtong zhing tshul khrims yongs mi nyams //
translated: he gives himself away and does not violate morality.

original: zhes pa ni skyes pa'i rabs bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni skyes pa'i rabs bzhin no //
translated: This is like the Jātakamālā.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyang rab tu bsdams //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyang rab tu bsdams //
translated: He is restrained in body, speech, and mind.

original: bde gshegs sems dul khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bde gshegs sems dul khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to you, Sugata, whose mind is disciplined.

original: bzod la dgyes shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: bzod la dgyes shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: He delights in patience, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / chos la nges pa'i bzod pa rnams la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir lus du ma bur byas kyang khro ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / chos la nges pa'i bzod pa rnams la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir lus du ma bur byas kyang khro ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: Because he is well established in the acceptance of suffering, in the acceptance of the harm inflicted by others, and in the acceptance of the certainty of the Dharma, he does not become angry even when his body is cut into many pieces.

original: bdag tu 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has no notion of self.

original: snying rje chen pos yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir bcad cing bcad pa nas 'o ma'i rgyun 'dzag par gyur pa'i ngo mtshar che ba khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir bcad cing bcad pa nas 'o ma'i rgyun 'dzag par gyur pa'i ngo mtshar che ba khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Homage to you who are wonderful, your body a stream of milk flowing from the cuts inflicted by the saw, because your mind is steeped in great compassion!

original: stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs na yang thugs rje chen pos bskul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs na yang thugs rje chen pos bskul ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he possesses the ten powers, he has unobstructed knowledge. He knows that all things are essenceless. But because he is urged on by great compassion,

original: sems can 'di dag ni phyin ci log tu zhugs pa'o zhes rjes su brtse ba'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni phyin ci log tu zhugs pa'o zhes rjes su brtse ba'o //
translated: he feels pity for these beings who are deluded.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral bas stong pa'o zhes rab tu shes na yang 'jig rten rnams de kho na nyid kyi lam las nyams par gzigs nas de dag gi phyin ci log spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos rnams rang bzhin gyis bdag
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral bas stong pa'o zhes rab tu shes na yang 'jig rten rnams de kho na nyid kyi lam las nyams par gzigs nas de dag gi phyin ci log spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos rnams rang bzhin gyis bdag
translated: If one understands that all phenomena are empty, because they are devoid of self and being mine, still, seeing that worldly people have fallen from the path of reality, in order to abandon their misconceptions, the Buddha taught the path of the intrinsic realitylessness of things,

original: med pa'i lam rab tu bstan nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu 'god par byed do zhes pa ni snying rje'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes @61a * //
analyzed: med pa'i lam rab tu bstan nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu 'god par byed do zhes pa ni snying rje'i thabs la mkhas pa zhes @61a * //
translated: and he established them in the enlightenment of buddhahood. This is called “the skill in means of compassion.”

original: gsungs so // zla ba skar mar bcas pa'i mkha' ltung zhing //
analyzed: gsungs so // zla ba skar mar bcas pa'i mkha' ltung zhing //
translated: The verse, “The sky with its moon and stars might fall, the earth with its mountains and forests might go elsewhere,

original: zhes bya bas ni phyin ci ma log pa gsungs pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni phyin ci ma log pa gsungs pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: shows that the Buddha’s speech is nonerroneous.

original: gal te nam mkha' ltung ba 'am sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba ni srid kyi bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ni gzhan du gsung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' ltung ba 'am sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba ni srid kyi bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ni gzhan du gsung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is possible that the sky might fall, or that the elements such as earth might change into something else, but the speech of the Lord Buddha will never be otherwise.

original: de'i rgyu rmongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu rmongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is not confused about the reasons.

original: dmigs pa'i lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gzigs nas de dag gi rmongs pa'i mun pa bsal ba'i phyir zab mo rang bzhin gyis zhi ba stong pa nyid ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gzigs nas de dag gi rmongs pa'i mun pa bsal ba'i phyir zab mo rang bzhin gyis zhi ba stong pa nyid ston par mdzad de /
translated: Having seen sentient beings who are attached to the view of an object, in order to dispel the darkness of their delusion, he teaches the profound emptiness, which is peace by nature.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i bslab pa la legs par bslabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i bslab pa la legs par bslabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is well trained in the training that is without an object.

original: khyod la 'khrul pa yod mi mnga' //
analyzed: khyod la 'khrul pa yod mi mnga' //
translated: You are without error.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to this,

original: phyin ci log tu ston pa'i 'khrul pa mi mnga' bar gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu ston pa'i 'khrul pa mi mnga' bar gsungs pa ni /
translated: it is said that he is without the error of teaching in a distorted way.

original: bdag tu 'du shes gang gnas pa //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes gang gnas pa //
translated: Those who abide in the notion of a self

original: de dag 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: will be in error.

original: mi mkhas pa zhes pa rmongs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa zhes pa rmongs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “the unwise” is that they have delusion.

original: bdag med pa shes pa rnams ni bdag med pa nyid ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: bdag med pa shes pa rnams ni bdag med pa nyid ston par mdzad de /
translated: Those who know selflessness teach selflessness.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, he is the one who speaks correctly.

original: yang dag pa'i chos la rab tu gnas pa yang dag par bden pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos la rab tu gnas pa yang dag par bden pa la gnas pa /
translated: He is the one who abides in the correct Dharma, who abides in the correct truth,

original: yang dag par spyod pa ;
analyzed: yang dag par spyod pa ;
translated: who practices correctly,

original: yang dag par smon pa /
analyzed: yang dag par smon pa /
translated: who aspires correctly,

original: yang dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa /

original: yang dag pa'i tshig smra ba /🔽yang dag spyod pa phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshig smra ba / yang dag spyod pa phun sum tshogs //
translated: the one who speaks the right words,🔽the one who has perfect right conduct,

original: yang dag mtha' la shin tu bslabs //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' la shin tu bslabs //
translated: the one who is well trained in the right limits.

original: yang dag bsam pa yang dag spyod //
analyzed: yang dag bsam pa yang dag spyod //
translated: 2. You have the right thoughts, the right conduct,

original: yang dag mkhyen la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: yang dag mkhyen la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and the right knowledge. Homage to you!

original: zhes bya bas yang dag pa gsungs par bstod nas ye shes gsungs pa nyid du bstod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya bas yang dag pa gsungs par bstod nas ye shes gsungs pa nyid du bstod pa'i phyir /
