analyzed: khyod kyi shes rab mnyam pa med //
translated: 3. Your wisdom is unequaled,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par gsung pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par gsung pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Since he speaks the special knowledge of the knowledge of all aspects,🔽he says,

original: ye shes gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: ye shes gsung la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: Homage to you who speak knowledge.

original: / byams pa gtso bor gyur ba nyid du bstod ba //
analyzed: / byams pa gtso bor gyur ba nyid du bstod ba //
translated: He praises him as the one who is foremost in love,🔽saying,

original: sems can kun gyi bshes gnyen khyod //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi bshes gnyen khyod //
translated: You are the friend of all living beings,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin shin tu goms par byas pas 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don bya ba'i phyir rab tu gnas pa'i ri rab @61b bzhin du mi g-yo ba /🔽'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad zil gyis mnan nas bdag med pa'i seng ge'i sgra nges par bsgrags pas mu stegs pa rnams seng ges wa ji lta ba bzhin du gdug pa'i sems dang ldan pa gdul dka' ba drag po chen po yang thabs kyi stobs kyis khyod
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin shin tu goms par byas pas 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don bya ba'i phyir rab tu gnas pa'i ri rab @61b bzhin du mi g-yo ba / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad zil gyis mnan nas bdag med pa'i seng ge'i sgra nges par bsgrags pas mu stegs pa rnams seng ges wa ji lta ba bzhin du gdug pa'i sems dang ldan pa gdul dka' ba drag po chen po yang thabs kyi stobs kyis khyod
translated: By thoroughly cultivating the nature of non-referential great compassion, one remains immovable like Mount Meru in order to benefit all beings without exception.🔽Having outshone all the assemblies of the retinue, by definitely proclaiming the lion's roar of selflessness, even the fierce and difficult-to-tame non-Buddhists with malicious intentions are tamed by you,

original: kyis 'dul zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: kyis 'dul zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: O Great One, through the power of skillful means.

original: sngar bstan pa'i don nyid sdud par byed pas tshigs su bcad pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i don nyid sdud par byed pas tshigs su bcad pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the very meaning that was taught earlier and to teach it through verse,

original: 'khrul ba med pa'i chos tshig khyod ston te //
analyzed: 'khrul ba med pa'i chos tshig khyod ston te //
translated: it is said: You teach the Dharma of non-error, the words...

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and so forth.

original: de ltar stobs bcu bden pa gsung la bstod nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar stobs bcu bden pa gsung la bstod nas ni //
translated: Having thus praised the one with the speech of the ten powers and the truth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and other verses.

original: stobs bcu dang ldan pa la bdag gis bstod pa bgyid pa'i bsod nams nye bar bsags pa des sh'akya seng ge ji lta ba bzhin du bdag kyang sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces zla 'od kyis smon lam btab pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang ldan pa la bdag gis bstod pa bgyid pa'i bsod nams nye bar bsags pa des sh'akya seng ge ji lta ba bzhin du bdag kyang sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces zla 'od kyis smon lam btab pa'o //
translated: By the merit of this praise of the one who possesses the ten powers, just as the Lion of the Shakyas, may I too become a Buddha. This is the aspiration of Candraprabha.

original: de nas zla 'od kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zla 'od kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, knowing the thoughts of Candraprabha, the Blessed One smiled. In this and other verses, it is said:

original: stobs bcu'i sras kyi thu bo byams pas de zhus te //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i sras kyi thu bo byams pas de zhus te //
translated: The eldest son of the one with ten powers, Maitreya, asked about it.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this and other verses, it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po byams pas 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu zhus pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po byams pas 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu zhus pa ni /
translated: The great bodhisattva Maitreya asked about the cause of the smile.

original: 'dren pas gang gi slad du 'di ltar 'jum pa mdzad //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dren pas gang gi slad du 'di ltar 'jum pa mdzad // ces bya ba la /
translated: Why did the Leader smile like this?

original: 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu sa chen po yang g-yos so //
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu sa chen po yang g-yos so //
translated: Immediately after the smile, the great earth shook.

original: lha la sogs pa nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor na gnas pa rnams kyang dga' ba'i sems kyis bcom ldan 'das la blta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor na gnas pa rnams kyang dga' ba'i sems kyis bcom ldan 'das la blta zhing gnas so //
translated: The gods and so on, dwelling in the sphere of the sky, also watch the Blessed One with a joyful mind.

original: bde gshegs zil gyis ma non de lung bstan du gsol //
analyzed: bde gshegs zil gyis ma non de lung bstan du gsol //
translated: The Sugata, who is not overwhelmed, should prophesy!

original: zhes bya bas ni zhus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni zhus pa'o //
translated: Thus he requests.

original: bskal pa mi nyung bar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byas pas sems can thams cad kyis sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa la bcom ldan 'das thogs pa med par 'jug pas de'i phyir lung bstan du gsol /
analyzed: bskal pa mi nyung bar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byas pas sems can thams cad kyis sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa la bcom ldan 'das thogs pa med par 'jug pas de'i phyir lung bstan du gsol /
translated: Since he has practiced the perfections such as generosity for many eons, the Blessed One, unobstructed, knows the mental behavior of all sentient beings. Therefore, prophesy!

original: mi yi gtso bo la ni gang gis mchod //
analyzed: mi yi gtso bo la ni gang gis mchod //
translated: To the chief of men, by whom offerings are made,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: bsod nams nye bar bsags pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams nye bar bsags pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: By whom offerings are made is requested because merit is accumulated.

original: padma bye ba 'dab ma bye bar ldan //
analyzed: padma bye ba 'dab ma bye bar ldan //
translated: Lotus with ten million petals,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i gdan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i gdan te /
translated: and so on is the seat of the bodhisattva.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba mang po mchis @62a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba mang po mchis @62a * //
translated: There, many bodhisattvas, dharma teachers, are seated.

original: pas mgon po la de'i slad du zhu'o //
analyzed: pas mgon po la de'i slad du zhu'o //
translated: Therefore, I ask the Lord.

original: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa la rab tu mchod na su zhig gis mchod par bgyis bas /
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa la rab tu mchod na su zhig gis mchod par bgyis bas /
translated: By whom, having made offerings to the Tathagata,

original: sangs rgyas byang chub ji ltar thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub ji ltar thob par 'gyur //
translated: will they attain the enlightenment of the Buddha?

original: zhes bya ba dang / gang gis phra zhing shin tu blta dka'i chos //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gang gis phra zhing shin tu blta dka'i chos //
translated: And, By whom, having seen the Dharma which is subtle and very difficult to see,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang chos shin tu phra ba stong pa zhi ba'o zhes rig nas bsgom pa de dag gi slad du bdag zhu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang chos shin tu phra ba stong pa zhi ba'o zhes rig nas bsgom pa de dag gi slad du bdag zhu'o //
translated: and so on. Those who, having understood that the Dharma is very subtle, empty, and peaceful, cultivate it, for their sake I ask.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la 'khrul pa'am bsnyel ba khyod la mi mnga' bas 'dzum pa mdzad pa ci'i phyir gsungs shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la 'khrul pa'am bsnyel ba khyod la mi mnga' bas 'dzum pa mdzad pa ci'i phyir gsungs shig pa'o //
translated: Since you are not confused or forgetful about the mental activity of all sentient beings of the past, future, and present, please explain why you smiled.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs nas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad gus pa dang bcas par 'ongs pa la spos kyi glang po ni sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa'i zhing nas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs nas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad gus pa dang bcas par 'ongs pa la spos kyi glang po ni sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa'i zhing nas so //
translated: The elephant Fragrant came from the realm of the Buddha Akshobhya, and all the bodhisattvas who came with him from various world systems came with respect.

original: bde ba can nas ni mthu chen thob dang spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
analyzed: bde ba can nas ni mthu chen thob dang spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
translated: From the Land of Bliss, Mahāmati and Avalokiteśvara.

original: rje btsun 'jam dpal la ni yul nges pa bstan pa med de sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyan snga na chos nyan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi lus rab tu ston pas so zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: rje btsun 'jam dpal la ni yul nges pa bstan pa med de sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyan snga na chos nyan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi lus rab tu ston pas so zhes bya bas so //
translated: For the venerable Mañjuśrī, there is no specific country shown, because he manifests his own body in the presence of all Tathāgatas in all Buddha-fields in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' che ba'i bdag nyid can rnams 'dir 'dus pa la snod ma yin pa ni gang yang ma mchis pas rgyu ma mchis par de bzhin gshegs pa 'dzum pa mi mdzad na 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i dgos pa bcom ldan 'das bshad du
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' che ba'i bdag nyid can rnams 'dir 'dus pa la snod ma yin pa ni gang yang ma mchis pas rgyu ma mchis par de bzhin gshegs pa 'dzum pa mi mdzad na 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i dgos pa bcom ldan 'das bshad du
translated: Thus, since there is no one here who is not a suitable vessel for the assembly of great bodhisattvas, if the Tathāgata does not smile without a cause, Blessed One, please explain the reason for the smile.

original: gsol / byams pa bskyed cing dga' ba 'phel bar bgyid //
analyzed: gsol / byams pa bskyed cing dga' ba 'phel bar bgyid //
translated: Generate love and increase joy.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and so on,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' ni nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa yon tan thams cad skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' ni nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa yon tan thams cad skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The speech of the Tathagata pacifies all afflictions and generates all good qualities.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i gsung gi dbyangs kyis thugs rje can gyis seng ge'i sgra bsgrag tu gsol /🔽'jig rten phan pa khyod kyi gsung gcig las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i gsung gi dbyangs kyis thugs rje can gyis seng ge'i sgra bsgrag tu gsol / 'jig rten phan pa khyod kyi gsung gcig las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With such a melodious voice, O Compassionate One, please roar your lion's roar!

original: gcig cig bstan pa'i sgra las mos pa sna tshogs can rnams la skad sna tshogs kyis sems can thams cad bdag la ston to snyam du rang rang gi bsam pas rtogs so //
analyzed: gcig cig bstan pa'i sgra las mos pa sna tshogs can rnams la skad sna tshogs kyis sems can thams cad bdag la ston to snyam du rang rang gi bsam pas rtogs so //
translated: Your speech, O Benefactor of the World, is one, yet from that one sound, those with various aspirations understand according to their own thoughts, He is teaching me!

original: de lta bus na gang gis 'dzum pa mdzad pa khyod kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bus na gang gis 'dzum pa mdzad pa khyod kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, you who smile, you have spoken.

original: @62b sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i gsung ni dga' ba skyed par byed kyi 'dod chags ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @62b sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i gsung ni dga' ba skyed par byed kyi 'dod chags ni ma yin no //
translated: The speech that pacifies the afflictions of all sentient beings generates joy, not attachment.

original: byams pa skyed par byed kyi zhe sdang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byams pa skyed par byed kyi zhe sdang ni ma yin no //
translated: It generates love, not hatred.

original: shes rab skyed par byed kyi gti mug ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab skyed par byed kyi gti mug ni ma yin no //
translated: It produces wisdom, not delusion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor las phyi rol du mi 'da' zhing thams cad kyi the tshom gcod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor las phyi rol du mi 'da' zhing thams cad kyi the tshom gcod pa'o //
translated: The Buddha’s speech does not go beyond the circle of the assembly, and it resolves everyone’s doubts.

original: sa 'di gas par 'gyur yang srid /
analyzed: sa 'di gas par 'gyur yang srid /
translated: The earth may split open,

original: rgya mtsho skems par 'gyur yang srid /
analyzed: rgya mtsho skems par 'gyur yang srid /
translated: the ocean may dry up,

original: zla ba dang nyi ma ni ltung yang srid kyi yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni gzhan du 'gyur zhing gsung pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma ni ltung yang srid kyi yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni gzhan du 'gyur zhing gsung pa ma yin no //
translated: the moon and the sun may fall, but the Tathāgata’s speech does not change or speak otherwise.

original: bskal pa bye ba brgya stong dpag tu med par sangs rgyas nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brjod kyang mthar thug par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba brgya stong dpag tu med par sangs rgyas nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brjod kyang mthar thug par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Even if the Buddha were to describe the Tathāgata’s qualities for countless hundreds of thousands of millions of eons, it would not come to an end.

original: gang gi don du 'dzum pa mdzad par gyur //
analyzed: gang gi don du 'dzum pa mdzad par gyur //
translated: For whose sake did you smile?

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dzum pas phye ba'i zhal mdzes rgyas pa don gyi dgongs pa can //
analyzed: 'dzum pas phye ba'i zhal mdzes rgyas pa don gyi dgongs pa can //
translated: The beautiful face opened by the smile, with a meaningful intention,

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam mi g-yo stong pa gcig tu zhi ba nyid //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam mi g-yo stong pa gcig tu zhi ba nyid //
translated: equal to space, immovable, one emptiness, completely peaceful.

original: su yi sems kyis rnam bsgoms thub pa'i dbang pos bstan du gsol //
analyzed: su yi sems kyis rnam bsgoms thub pa'i dbang pos bstan du gsol //
translated: The Lord of Sages has taught that it is the mind that imagines all things.

original: sna tshogs kyis stong khyod ni sna tshogs nyid du mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyis stong khyod ni sna tshogs nyid du mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: You are empty of multiplicity, yet you are seen as multiplicity itself.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad pa bstan pa'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad pa bstan pa'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of Chapter XIV, on the display of the smile.

original: // / 'dzum pa'i rgyu zla 'od lung ston pa gsol ba ni de nas de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / 'dzum pa'i rgyu zla 'od lung ston pa gsol ba ni de nas de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The request for the prediction of Candraprabhakumāra, the cause of the smile, is stated from “Then at that time” and so forth.

original: zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa 'di nyid kyis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa 'di ni dri ma med pa'i 'dod ces bya ba'i rgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par bstod pas 'jig rten thams cad
analyzed: zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa 'di nyid kyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa 'di ni dri ma med pa'i 'dod ces bya ba'i rgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par bstod pas 'jig rten thams cad
translated: This very Candraprabhakumāra

original: kyis rab tu bsngags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis rab tu bsngags par 'gyur ro //
translated: and so forth. This Candraprabhakumāra will become the Victor called Vimalakāma. By perfectly praising the Blessed One with pure qualities, he will be highly praised by all worlds.

original: bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri 'di nyid du sngon sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong mang po la ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo rab tu shes par bya ba'i phyir bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri 'di nyid du sngon sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong mang po la ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo rab tu shes par bya ba'i phyir bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: Here on Vulture Peak, in the past, he served many hundreds of thousands of millions of buddhas in order to understand the nature of samadhi.

original: de ni phyi ma'i dus na ;
analyzed: de ni phyi ma'i dus na ;
translated: In the future,

original: ting 'dzin 'di ni shin tu rgyas byed 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting 'dzin 'di ni shin tu rgyas byed 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: he will spread this samadhi.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid do //
translated: Here, the phrase this samadhi refers to the samadhi itself.

original: rgyas byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyas byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase he will spread means

original: rgyas par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that he will cause it to spread.

original: sangs rgyas bye ba mang pos yongs bzung ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba mang pos yongs bzung ste //
translated: He will be sustained by many millions of buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis @63a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis @63a * //
translated: Here, the phrase he will be sustained

original: rjes su bzung bas nye bar bsags pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su bzung bas nye bar bsags pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs nyid bstan to //
translated: indicates that he will accumulate the collections of merit and wisdom that are sustained by all the tathagatas.

original: 'dren pa rnams la mchod pa mchog byed 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams la mchod pa mchog byed 'gyur //
translated: He will make the highest offerings to the guides.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the phrase highest offerings

original: mchod pa khyad par du 'phags pa byed bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa khyad par du 'phags pa byed bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means that he will make the most exalted offerings.

original: lag mthil sgyu ru 'bru lnga bzhag pa bzhin ;🔽/ zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag mthil sgyu ru 'bru lnga bzhag pa bzhin ; / zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand.

original: lag mthil na 'dug pa'i skyu ru ra'i 'brus bu bzhag pa dang 'dra bar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i shes bya'i dkyil 'khor la phyin ci ma log par lta bar byed do //
analyzed: lag mthil na 'dug pa'i skyu ru ra'i 'brus bu bzhag pa dang 'dra bar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i shes bya'i dkyil 'khor la phyin ci ma log par lta bar byed do //
translated: He sees the entire domain of objects of knowledge, past, future, and present, without error, as if it were a myrobalan fruit in the palm of his hand.

original: zla 'od gzhon nus ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas bye ba phrag stong dang / de'i phyi nas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bde bar gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni mchod pa byas nas bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob nas /
analyzed: zla 'od gzhon nus ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas bye ba phrag stong dang / de'i phyi nas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bde bar gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni mchod pa byas nas bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob nas /
translated: The youth Candraprabha, having made offerings to ten thousand million buddhas in the future, and then to as many Sugatas as there are sands in the Ganges River, having attained unsurpassed omniscient knowledge through making offerings,

original: dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: will become the Tathagata known as Vimalaprabha.

original: bdag nyid lung bstan pa thob nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid lung bstan pa thob nas /
translated: Having received the prediction,

original: shing ta la bdun tsam du 'phags nas nam mkha' la 'dug ste /
analyzed: shing ta la bdun tsam du 'phags nas nam mkha' la 'dug ste /
translated: he rose up into the sky to the height of seven palm trees and remained there.

original: ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do //🔽ae ma rgyal ba chos mchog ston mdzad pa //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do // ae ma rgyal ba chos mchog ston mdzad pa //
translated: This is the declaration of the purpose.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The declaration of the purpose is: Oh, the Victorious One, the teacher of the supreme Dharma! and so forth.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir dang / ye shes brten pa'i phyir dang ; nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / bdud kyi phyogs las rgyal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la bstod pas bdag nyid rab tu dga' ba bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽gter mchog dam pa bdag gis deng thob ste //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir dang / ye shes brten pa'i phyir dang ; nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / bdud kyi phyogs las rgyal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la bstod pas bdag nyid rab tu dga' ba bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa / gter mchog dam pa bdag gis deng thob ste //
translated: The praise of the Blessed One is stated in order to demonstrate the joy of the author himself, because he teaches the inconceivable Dharma, because he is the support of wisdom, because he has abandoned the afflictions along with their traces, and because he is victorious over the side of Mara.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The declaration of the purpose is: Today, I have obtained the supreme treasure.

original: gter gyi mchog ni chos kyi gter te mi zad pa'i ye shes kyi gter ro //
analyzed: gter gyi mchog ni chos kyi gter te mi zad pa'i ye shes kyi gter ro //
translated: The supreme treasure is the treasure of the Dharma, the inexhaustible treasure of wisdom.

original: de bdag gis rnyed pas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bdag gis rnyed pas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: Since I have obtained that, I have abandoned all bad rebirths and falls.

original: the tsom gyi yid bdag la ma mchis so //
analyzed: the tsom gyi yid bdag la ma mchis so //
translated: I have no doubts.

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ram mi 'gyur snyam pa yang ma mchis kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ram mi 'gyur snyam pa yang ma mchis kyi /
translated: I have no doubts about whether or not I will become a Buddha.

original: nges par sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: will certainly become a Buddha.

original: gser gyi kha dog ltar mdzes shing mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i phyag bdag gi spyi bor rab tu bzhag nas sangs rgyas nyid du bdag dbang bskur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gser gyi kha dog ltar mdzes shing mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i phyag bdag gi spyi bor rab tu bzhag nas sangs rgyas nyid du bdag dbang bskur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having placed his hand, beautiful as burnished gold, adorned with all the major marks, on my head, he has consecrated me as a Buddha.

original: gang la ri bong 'dzin 'dra'i dri ma med pa'i mdangs mnga' ba //
analyzed: gang la ri bong 'dzin 'dra'i dri ma med pa'i mdangs mnga' ba //
translated: To whom, the one with a stainless radiance like the moon,

original: gcig tu dri ma rab tu zhi bar byed pas @63b mdzes gyur cing //
analyzed: gcig tu dri ma rab tu zhi bar byed pas @63b mdzes gyur cing //
translated: the one who is beautiful by being the sole pacifier of all defilements,

original: chos la bdag med rtogs pa'i blo ni dri ma med zhugs phyir //
analyzed: chos la bdag med rtogs pa'i blo ni dri ma med zhugs phyir //
translated: the one who has entered the stainless understanding that realizes the selflessness of phenomena,

original: de nyid ma lus rig pa sangs rgyas byang chub tu lung bstan //
analyzed: de nyid ma lus rig pa sangs rgyas byang chub tu lung bstan //
translated: he has given the prophecy of Buddhahood, of enlightenment, knowing all that exists.

original: 'dzum pa lung bstan pa'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'i 'grel ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dzum pa lung bstan pa'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'i 'grel ba rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fifteenth chapter, the chapter on the prophecy of the smile.

original: // /'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i nang rab tu zhi bar bya ba nyid la ting nge 'dzin bla na med pa'i sman pa chen po yin no zhes bya bar sngon byung ba'i le'u bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // /'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i nang rab tu zhi bar bya ba nyid la ting nge 'dzin bla na med pa'i sman pa chen po yin no zhes bya bar sngon byung ba'i le'u bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The chapter on the past explains that the supreme medicine for the complete pacification of the afflictions of cyclic existence is the unsurpassed concentration.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Then again, the Lord said:

original: sems can thams cad srid pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad las thar bar bya bar 'dod pas chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di mnyan par bya zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad srid pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad las thar bar bya bar 'dod pas chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di mnyan par bya zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Those who wish to liberate all sentient beings from all the sufferings of cyclic existence should listen to this king of samādhis, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, and so on up to

original: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: should also teach it extensively to others.”🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin thos pa la sogs pas srid pa'i sdug bsngal las grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i som nyi bsal ba /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin thos pa la sogs pas srid pa'i sdug bsngal las grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i som nyi bsal ba /
translated: This is the question. The answer is:

original: gzhon nu ting nge 'dzin 'di ni ngan song thams cad las 'da' bar byed pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu ting nge 'dzin 'di ni ngan song thams cad las 'da' bar byed pa /
translated: “Young man, this samādhi transcends all lower existences,

original: nad thams cad las rab tu thar bar byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: nad thams cad las rab tu thar bar byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: and it liberates from all illnesses.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis sngon byung ba'i gtam bstan pa 'di yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba'i gtam gsungs pa ste /🔽sngon chad spyad pa spyod pa dran pa ni //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis sngon byung ba'i gtam bstan pa 'di yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba'i gtam gsungs pa ste / sngon chad spyad pa spyod pa dran pa ni //
translated: This is the discourse on the past event.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa nyams su myong ba de nyid dran pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa nyams su myong ba de nyid dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of the practice of the perfections in the past is expressed in the words: I remember the practice of the perfections in the past.

original: de dag nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: de dag nyid bstan pa /
translated: The teaching of that is as follows.

original: seng ge rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la /
analyzed: seng ge rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la /
translated: In the teaching of the Tathagata called Simhadhvaja,

original: tshangs pas byin zhes bya ba'i dge slong mkhas pa chos smra ba chen po byung ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pas byin zhes bya ba'i dge slong mkhas pa chos smra ba chen po byung ngo //
translated: there appeared a monk called Brahmadatta, who was wise and a great expounder of the Dharma.

original: nga ni de'i tshe blo gros rgyal po zhes bya ba'i rgyal po'i bur gyur pa la gso bar dka' ba'i nad kyis yongs su sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nga ni de'i tshe blo gros rgyal po zhes bya ba'i rgyal po'i bur gyur pa la gso bar dka' ba'i nad kyis yongs su sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ste /
translated: At that time, I was the son of a king called Matimant, and was afflicted with a difficult-to-cure illness.

original: sman pa lnga brgya kun kyang nad dang rgyu dang gso ba la mkhas pa thams cad kyis de'i nad gso ba'i phyir brtson pa'i yid kyis gso bar byed kyang gso bar ma nus so //
analyzed: sman pa lnga brgya kun kyang nad dang rgyu dang gso ba la mkhas pa thams cad kyis de'i nad gso ba'i phyir brtson pa'i yid kyis gso bar byed kyang gso bar ma nus so //
translated: Five hundred physicians, all of them skilled in the causes, symptoms, and treatment of disease, did their utmost to cure him, but they were unable to do so.

original: de nas chos smra ba'i dge slong des nga nad chen pos nyam thag pa thos nas nad 'dri ba'i phyir nga'i drung du 'ongs pa dang / nad 'di ni shin tu mi bzad pa ste sman gyis gso bar mi nus so @64a * //
analyzed: de nas chos smra ba'i dge slong des nga nad chen pos nyam thag pa thos nas nad 'dri ba'i phyir nga'i drung du 'ongs pa dang / nad 'di ni shin tu mi bzad pa ste sman gyis gso bar mi nus so @64a * //
translated: Then the monk who was a Dharma teacher, hearing that I was afflicted with a serious illness, came to me to inquire about my illness.

original: snyam du rig nas ting nge 'dzin 'ding la bshad par gyur to //
analyzed: snyam du rig nas ting nge 'dzin 'ding la bshad par gyur to //
translated: Knowing that this illness was very serious and could not be cured by medicine, he taught me this samādhi.

original: de nas ting nge 'dzin thos pa dang nga chos smra ba dang / chos la dga' ba skyes par gyur pas nam mkha' dri ma med pa lta bu chos nyid kyi ngo bo rtogs nas /
analyzed: de nas ting nge 'dzin thos pa dang nga chos smra ba dang / chos la dga' ba skyes par gyur pas nam mkha' dri ma med pa lta bu chos nyid kyi ngo bo rtogs nas /
translated: Then, having heard this samādhi, I, the Dharma teacher, gave rise to joy in the Dharma, and through the realization of the nature of reality, which is like a stainless sky,

original: sprin dang khug sna la sogs pa dang bral ba ltar nad thams cad dang bral bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la rnal 'byor du bya'o //
analyzed: sprin dang khug sna la sogs pa dang bral ba ltar nad thams cad dang bral bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la rnal 'byor du bya'o //
translated: One should practice yoga in the samadhi called Free from all diseases, like the sky free from clouds, fog, and so on.

original: de'i tshe tshes smra bar gyur pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshes smra bar gyur pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad yin no //
translated: At that time, the one who became a fortune-teller was the Tathagata Arhat Samyak-sambuddha Dipankara.

original: rgyal po'i bu blo gros rgyal por gyur pa de ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu blo gros rgyal por gyur pa de ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa yin no //
translated: The prince Matiraja became the Bhagavat Shakyamuni.

original: ting nge 'dzin nyams su myong ba'i mthu gsungs pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyams su myong ba'i mthu gsungs pa /
translated: The power of experiencing samadhi is taught:

original: de bas gzhon nu khyod kyis phyi dus na //
analyzed: de bas gzhon nu khyod kyis phyi dus na //
translated: Therefore, young man, in future times,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi spyod pa rab tu mthong nas bag yod pa'i gnas pas gnas par bya'o zhes slob par byed do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi spyod pa rab tu mthong nas bag yod pa'i gnas pas gnas par bya'o zhes slob par byed do //
translated: Having seen the conduct of future sentient beings, one should train in abiding in heedfulness.

analyzed: nye bar song nas sngon bzhin du nye bar mkho ba'i mchod pa thams cad kyis brgyan cing sprul nas /

analyzed: skad cig de la zla 'od kyi khyim du zhugs par gyur to //

analyzed: zhugs nas bcom ldan 'das la yid kyis bskor ba byas nas rang gi stan la nye bar 'dug nas rig par byed pa ni /
translated: Having entered, he mentally circumambulated the Blessed One and sat down on his own seat. He made known:

original: ri yang lha rdzas yangs shing rgya che ba //
analyzed: ri yang lha rdzas yangs shing rgya che ba //
translated: The mountain is vast and extensive,

original: ri yang rin chen sna tshogs rnam par bkram //
analyzed: ri yang rin chen sna tshogs rnam par bkram //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ri brgyan pa yang bgyis so // dbus su rin chen seng ge'i khri yang btsugs //
translated: This means I have also adorned the mountain.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the center, a jeweled lion throne is also established.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with a discourse on the Dharma,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He was perfectly satisfied,

original: yang dag par sbyar nas gdan las bzhengs te rdzu 'phrul gang gis gshegs pa de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis rgyal po'i khab nas byung ste ;
analyzed: yang dag par sbyar nas gdan las bzhengs te rdzu 'phrul gang gis gshegs pa de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis rgyal po'i khab nas byung ste ;
translated: and after rising from his seat, he left Rājagṛha by means of the miraculous power of the Buddha,

original: chu dron can gyi sgo nas bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri ga la bder gshegs nas byams pas sprul pa'i seng ge'i khri la bzhugs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis yongs su bskor te 'khor rgya mtsho lta bu la chos ston to //
analyzed: chu dron can gyi sgo nas bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri ga la bder gshegs nas byams pas sprul pa'i seng ge'i khri la bzhugs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis yongs su bskor te 'khor rgya mtsho lta bu la chos ston to //
translated: and having gone to Vulture Peak Mountain through the gate of Hot Spring, he sat on a lion throne emanated by Maitreya, surrounded by the saṅgha of monks, and taught the Dharma to an ocean-like assembly.

original: de nas zla 'od bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to /
analyzed: de nas zla 'od bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to /
translated: Then Candraprabha, having bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, said this to the Blessed One:

original: gal te zhus nas zhu ba lung bstan pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te zhus nas zhu ba lung bstan pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If I may ask, for the sake of answering my questions... and so on.

original: gzhon nu de bzhin gshegs pas khyod la rtag tu skabs phye yis ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig ces bya ba ni skabs sbyin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gzhon nu de bzhin gshegs pas khyod la rtag tu skabs phye yis ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig ces bya ba ni skabs sbyin pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase the Tathāgata, young man, has always given you an opportunity. Ask whatever you wish! is the statement of the opportunity.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chos du dang ldan na ting nge 'dzin 'di thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chos du dang ldan na ting nge 'dzin 'di thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Lord, how many dharmas must a bodhisattva possess in order to attain this samādhi? and so on.

original: chos mang po la the tshom za ba bzlog pa'i phyir zhus so //
analyzed: chos mang po la the tshom za ba bzlog pa'i phyir zhus so //
translated: He asked in order to stop doubting many dharmas.

original: gzhon nu chos bzhi dang ldan na zhes bya bas ni grangs nges pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhon nu chos bzhi dang ldan na zhes bya bas ni grangs nges pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase young man, endowed with four dharmas teaches the definite number.

original: de lta na yang ma shes nas ;
analyzed: de lta na yang ma shes nas ;
translated: Even so, not understanding,

original: bzhi gang zhe na zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: he asked, What are the four?

original: gzhon nu 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan yin te /
analyzed: gzhon nu 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan yin te /
translated: The phrase here, young man and so on is the answer.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don dang / de bzhin nyid la shin tu dga' bas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don dang / de bzhin nyid la shin tu dga' bas zhes byas nas so //
translated: And that means for the sake of sentient beings and by delighting in suchness and so on.

original: 'grogs na bde ba ni bde ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'grogs na bde ba ni bde ba nyid do //
translated: Agreeable to be with means pleasant.

original: dul zhing dul ba'i sa thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyis spyos sam spyos pa'i tshig nyes par smra zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dul zhing dul ba'i sa thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyis spyos sam spyos pa'i tshig nyes par smra zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad bzod pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is disciplined and has attained the stage of discipline refers to the patience that is, the tolerance of all the insults and false accusations that others may hurl at him.

original: rang gi las la lta ba nga rgyal bcom pas chos 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba rnams bsdoms nas chos gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi las la lta ba nga rgyal bcom pas chos 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba rnams bsdoms nas chos gcig ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase he is devoted to the Dharma because he has conquered pride and is intent on his own duties refers to the single Dharma that is, the single quality that is essential.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya bas ni chos gnyis pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya bas ni chos gnyis pa ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase and also indicates a second Dharma.

original: tshul @65b khrims dang ldan pa yin zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims spyir bstan pa yin la /🔽dbye ba khyad par du bstan pa ni /🔽tshul khrims yongs su dag cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshul @65b khrims dang ldan pa yin zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims spyir bstan pa yin la / dbye ba khyad par du bstan pa ni / tshul khrims yongs su dag cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase he is endowed with morality is a general reference to morality.🔽The phrase his morality is pure is a specific reference to morality.

original: tshul khrims dang mi mthun pa med pa rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //🔽blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gnas rnams ma nyams pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang mi mthun pa med pa rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so // blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gnas rnams ma nyams pas /
translated: The phrase he is endowed with morality that is pure refers to morality that is free of any opposition.🔽The phrase he is endowed with morality that is unbroken refers to morality that is not impaired by a transgression of any of the precepts.

original: tshul khrims ma zhig pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma zhig pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is endowed with morality that is unflawed refers to morality that is not defiled by a root downfall.

original: ltung ba phra mo yang mi 'byung bas tshul khrims la skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba phra mo yang mi 'byung bas tshul khrims la skyon med pa'o //
translated: Since even the slightest downfall is not committed, there is no fault in ethical discipline.

original: dmigs pa'i lta ba dang bral ba dang khams gsum la rten pa med pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i lta ba dang bral ba dang khams gsum la rten pa med pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is free from the view of reference points and does not rely on the three realms, it is called “the ethical discipline of nonabiding.”

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir mchog tu mi 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir mchog tu mi 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Since it does not grasp at the extreme of ethical discipline and ritual, it is the ethical discipline of nonapprehending.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Since it is completely pure of the three spheres,

original: tshul khrims mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: it is the nonapprehension of ethical discipline.

original: de ltar gzhon nur gyur pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de ltar gzhon nur gyur pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: Thus, the ethical discipline of the youthful

original: 'phags pas bstod pa'i tshul khrims dang / mkhas pas bstod pa'i tshul khrims zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'phags pas bstod pa'i tshul khrims dang / mkhas pas bstod pa'i tshul khrims zhes brjod do //
translated: is called “the ethical discipline praised by the noble ones” and “the ethical discipline praised by the wise.”

original: chos gnyis po 'di dang ldan na ting nge 'dzin 'di 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gnyis po 'di dang ldan na ting nge 'dzin 'di 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one possesses these two qualities, one will attain this samādhi.

original: gsum pa ni gzhan yang gzhon nu zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gzhan yang gzhon nu zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: The third is also stated by “Moreover, young man, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have four qualities…” and so forth.

original: khams gsum la sems skrag pa dang sems dngangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams gsum la sems skrag pa dang sems dngangs par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind is frightened and terrified of the three realms.

original: de la zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to turn away from attachment to that.

original: sems skyo ba ni de'i phyir don du mi gnyer ro ;
analyzed: sems skyo ba ni de'i phyir don du mi gnyer ro ;
translated: Discouragement of mind is not striving for that.

original: / don du mi gnyer bas mngon par mi dga'o //
analyzed: / don du mi gnyer bas mngon par mi dga'o //
translated: Not striving, one does not delight.

original: mngon par mi dga' bas ma chags ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mi dga' bas ma chags ma zhen pa'o //
translated: Not delighting, one is not attached or clinging.

original: ma chags ma zhen pas khams gsum la yid skyo na yang snying rje chen po yongs su bzung bas khams gsum gyi sems can sdug bsngal can rnams dgrol bar bya'o zhes spro ba bskyed de ;
analyzed: ma chags ma zhen pas khams gsum la yid skyo na yang snying rje chen po yongs su bzung bas khams gsum gyi sems can sdug bsngal can rnams dgrol bar bya'o zhes spro ba bskyed de ;
translated: Not attached or clinging, one is discouraged with the three realms. However, one generates enthusiasm, thinking, “I will liberate the suffering sentient beings of the three realms” because one is fully engaged in great compassion.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro ba yang byang chub sems dpa' 'dod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro ba yang byang chub sems dpa' 'dod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Even going to the lower realms is something that a bodhisattva should desire.

original: bzhi pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The fourth is “Moreover, the bodhisattva who is skilled in means, having entered the mother, should practice the perfection of giving with four ideas in mind. ”

original: dad pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: One becomes faithful.

original: bden pa dang dkon mchog la sems rab tu dad pa'o //🔽dad pa dang ldan pas chos yongs su tshol bas mi ngoms pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa dang dkon mchog la sems rab tu dad pa'o // dad pa dang ldan pas chos yongs su tshol bas mi ngoms pa yin te /
translated: One’s mind has faith in the truths and the jewels.🔽Having faith, one is insatiable in seeking the Dharma.

original: dad ldan yin phyir chos la brten //
analyzed: dad ldan yin phyir chos la brten //
translated: Because one has faith, one relies on the Dharma.

original: zhes pas mang du thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pas mang du thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one becomes learned.

original: shes rab ldan phyir de nyid rig / ces bya bas ci ltar thos pa'i chos rnams gzhan dag la yang dag par rab tu ston to //🔽sems can 'di dag gis chos 'di thos na phyir mi ldog par gyur nas bla na med pa yang @66a * //
analyzed: shes rab ldan phyir de nyid rig / ces bya bas ci ltar thos pa'i chos rnams gzhan dag la yang dag par rab tu ston to // sems can 'di dag gis chos 'di thos na phyir mi ldog par gyur nas bla na med pa yang @66a * //
translated: Thus, he teaches to others the Dharma as he has heard it.

original: dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: He thinks, If these sentient beings hear this Dharma, they will become irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas ting nge 'dzin 'di thob par 'gyur ro //🔽myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas ting nge 'dzin 'di thob par 'gyur ro // myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses these four dharmas attains this samādhi.🔽He quickly fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu gsungs so //
translated: Here, the cause of approaching unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is stated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos bshad pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is explained by many Tathāgatas.

original: ngas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa mang po'i thad nas thos nas gzhan la rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes bya ba la /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas mang po nges par brjod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sngon byung ba'i gtam bstan pa 'di zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis mnyes par byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tshigs su bcad pas bstod pa ni /
analyzed: ngas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa mang po'i thad nas thos nas gzhan la rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes bya ba la / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas mang po nges par brjod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sngon byung ba'i gtam bstan pa 'di zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis mnyes par byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tshigs su bcad pas bstod pa ni /
translated: I also heard it from many Tathagatas and taught it extensively and correctly to others.

original: dran pa bskal pa gzhal med dpag yas na //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dran pa bskal pa gzhal med dpag yas na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then the Blessed One taught this discourse on the past events of the samadhi of proclaiming many Buddhas, which is as follows: He praised the Tathagatas whom he himself pleased with verses beginning with:🔽I remember countless eons ago,

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi bskal pa grangs med pa 'das pa na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi bskal pa grangs med pa 'das pa na /
translated: in the past,

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag sgra zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa byung ste /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag sgra zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa byung ste /
translated: there was a Tathagata named Gho~a-anga.

original: de'i sku tshe'i tshad brgya phrag drug cur gyur to //
analyzed: de'i sku tshe'i tshad brgya phrag drug cur gyur to //
translated: His lifespan was six hundred years.

original: zhes bya ba ni grangs nges par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grangs nges par bstan te /
translated: This shows the definite number.

original: skyo ba med par bstan pa'i dus bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyo ba med par bstan pa'i dus bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To show the time of teaching without weariness.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis kyang grangs nges par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis kyang grangs nges par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the others.

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag sgra dang por byas pa nas /🔽tshangs pa'i snyan pa bskal pa gcig la sangs rgyas nyis brgya byung ngo //
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag sgra dang por byas pa nas / tshangs pa'i snyan pa bskal pa gcig la sangs rgyas nyis brgya byung ngo //
translated: The first Buddha of this cycle was Vipaśyin,🔽whose voice was melodious, whose life lasted for 80,000 years, and whose two disciples were the Śrāvakas Ta-ch’eng and Ta-hui.🔽Then there were 19 Buddhas in succession, the last of whom was Śikhin.🔽Then there were 20 Buddhas in succession, the last of whom was Viśvabhū.🔽Then there were 21 Buddhas in succession, the last of whom was Krakucchanda.🔽Then there were 22 Buddhas in succession, the last of whom was Kanakamuni.🔽Then there were 23 Buddhas in succession, the last of whom was Kāśyapa.🔽Then there was one Buddha, Śākyamuni.🔽Thus there were 1000 Buddhas in the Bhadrakalpa.

original: yang mtha' yas dbyangs nas brtsams nas chos kyi rang bzhin 'phags kyi bar du sangs rgyas brgya rtsa brgyad byung ste /
analyzed: yang mtha' yas dbyangs nas brtsams nas chos kyi rang bzhin 'phags kyi bar du sangs rgyas brgya rtsa brgyad byung ste /
translated: The Buddhas are equal in their persons, in their dharmakāya, in their abandonment, in their actions for the living, and in their gnosis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku tshe'i tshad ma bstan yang /🔽tshogs dang chos kyi sku dang ni //🔽'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku tshe'i tshad ma bstan yang / tshogs dang chos kyi sku dang ni // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
translated: They are not equal in their lifespans, in their castes, or in their clans.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa ste //
translated: The Buddhas are equal in their persons, in their dharmakāya, in their abandonment, in their actions for the living, and in their gnosis.

original: sku tshe rigs dang tshad kyis min //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig gis yon tan dman par the tshom mi bya'o ;🔽/ byang chub phyir ni 'di dag ngas mchod de //
analyzed: sku tshe rigs dang tshad kyis min //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig gis yon tan dman par the tshom mi bya'o ;🔽/ byang chub phyir ni 'di dag ngas mchod de //
translated: They are not equal in their lifespans, in their castes, or in their clans.

original: zhes bya ba ni bla ma bsten pa dang / chos nyan pa la lhod pa med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bla ma bsten pa dang / chos nyan pa la lhod pa med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that one should cultivate the Dharma by means of the diligence of not being lax in attending to the guru and listening to the Dharma.

original: dgos pa gzhan yang bstan ma thag pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin sangs rgyas 'phags kyi mtshan gang nyan pa de ni @66b myur du ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan yang bstan ma thag pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin sangs rgyas 'phags kyi mtshan gang nyan pa de ni @66b myur du ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the purpose is that whoever listens to the name of the noble Buddha, the nature of the Dharma that was just taught, will quickly attain meditative concentration.

original: 'di ni mtshan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan pa yin te /
translated: This is the sign:

original: sangs rgyas gzhan rnams kyi mtshan bsgrags pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan rnams kyi mtshan bsgrags pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The proclamation of the names of other buddhas will also be like that.

original: sangs rgyas 'di dag gi yang pha rol na //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'di dag gi yang pha rol na // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And beyond those buddhas,

original: mi dbang dbyangs zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa byung ste de bzhin gshegs pa de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni bye ba brgya phrag gsum mo //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun ni /
analyzed: mi dbang dbyangs zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa byung ste de bzhin gshegs pa de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni bye ba brgya phrag gsum mo // byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun ni /
translated: there will be a tathagata named Manidhvaja. The shravaka sangha of that tathagata will be three hundred times ten million.

original: bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag brgyad cu yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa byung ngo //
analyzed: bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag brgyad cu yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa byung ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva sangha will be eighty thousand times ten million trillion, endowed with immeasurable qualities.

original: nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha la sogs pa'i 'khor la de bzhin gshegs pa mi dbang dbyangs zhes bya ba de chos ston to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha la sogs pa'i 'khor la de bzhin gshegs pa mi dbang dbyangs zhes bya ba de chos ston to //
translated: He taught the Dharma to an assembly of hearers, bodhisattvas, gods, and so forth.

original: de'i chos bstan pa thos pa rnams phyir mi ldog par gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i chos bstan pa thos pa rnams phyir mi ldog par gnas par gyur to //
translated: Those who heard his teaching of the Dharma attained the stage of nonregression.

original: der rgyal po dpal gyi stobs zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: der rgyal po dpal gyi stobs zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: “At that time there was a king named Śrīsena.

original: de la bu ni lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: de la bu ni lnga brgya'o //
translated: He had five hundred sons,

original: btsun mo'i 'khor ni bye ba brgya phrag brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor ni bye ba brgya phrag brgyad cu'o //
translated: eighty billion queens,

original: bu mo ni bye ba stong phrag bcu bzhi'o ;
analyzed: bu mo ni bye ba stong phrag bcu bzhi'o ;
translated: and fourteen thousand daughters.

original: / rgyal po de ston zla tha chungs kyi nya la yan lag brgyad pa'i gso sbyong dang ldan pas bu dang btsun mo dang bu mo dang / de las gzhan pa'i 'khor bye ba khrag khrig bcu dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ngo //
analyzed: / rgyal po de ston zla tha chungs kyi nya la yan lag brgyad pa'i gso sbyong dang ldan pas bu dang btsun mo dang bu mo dang / de las gzhan pa'i 'khor bye ba khrag khrig bcu dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ngo //
translated: On the full moon of the last month of autumn, the king, together with his sons, queens, daughters, and a retinue of a hundred thousand million, observed the eightfold precepts of purification and went to where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar phyin pa dang thal mo sbyar ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'dug pa dang / de'i bsam pa mkhyen nas ting nge 'dzin 'di ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: nye bar phyin pa dang thal mo sbyar ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'dug pa dang / de'i bsam pa mkhyen nas ting nge 'dzin 'di ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One, knowing his thoughts, taught this samādhi.

original: rgyal po des ting nge 'dzin 'di thos pa dang rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug spangs nas ji ltar 'ongs pa'i 'khor rnams dang bcas par rab tu byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal po des ting nge 'dzin 'di thos pa dang rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug spangs nas ji ltar 'ongs pa'i 'khor rnams dang bcas par rab tu byung bar gyur to //
translated: When the king heard this samādhi, he abandoned his kingdom and power and went forth together with his retinue, just as they had come.

original: de rab tu byung nas kyang lo brgyad kyi bar du 'chag pa la mngon par brten nas /
analyzed: de rab tu byung nas kyang lo brgyad kyi bar du 'chag pa la mngon par brten nas /
translated: After going forth, for eight years he relied on walking meditation.

original: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i sems dang mnyam bar gzhag pa nyid kyis dus byas par gyur to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i sems dang mnyam bar gzhag pa nyid kyis dus byas par gyur to //
translated: He passed away with his mind in equipoise, with samādhi and so on.

original: rgyal po de'i rigs su byung ba rdzus te skyes pa bzhin du mngal gyi dri mas mgos pa gcig skyes te /
analyzed: rgyal po de'i rigs su byung ba rdzus te skyes pa bzhin du mngal gyi dri mas mgos pa gcig skyes te /
translated: One was born miraculously, like a god, unstained by the impurities of the womb.

original: de'i pha ni brtan pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i pha ni brtan pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: His father was called Stable Strength.

original: ma ni blo gros chen mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma ni blo gros chen mo zhes bya'o //
translated: His mother was called Great Intellect.

original: rgyal bu gzhon nu de skyes ba tsam nyid na tshig 'di skad ces rgyal ba de chos 'chad dam ci bzhugs sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'tsho 'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal bu gzhon nu de skyes ba tsam nyid na tshig 'di skad ces rgyal ba de chos 'chad dam ci bzhugs sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'tsho 'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The moment that prince was born, he spoke these words: Is the Victor explaining the Dharma? Is he dwelling? means Is he living?

original: ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'chad dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'chad dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In Is he explaining the meditative stabilization? and so forth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag gi bsam pa @67a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag gi bsam pa @67a * //
translated: the Tathāgata, knowing their thoughts,

original: mkhyen nas ting nge 'dzin 'chad dam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen nas ting nge 'dzin 'chad dam zhes pa'o //
translated: explains the meditative stabilization.

original: rkyen rnams med pa ni rkyen rnams dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnams med pa ni rkyen rnams dang bral ba ste /
translated: The absence of conditions is being free from conditions.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas ni rkyen dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas ni rkyen dang bral ba'o //
translated: Origination in dependence is being free from conditions.

original: chos rnams kun zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgyas btab pa nyid de chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi g-yo bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kun zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgyas btab pa nyid de chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi g-yo bar byas pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are the sameness of the nature of all phenomena. The meditative stabilization called the seal of the expansion of phenomena is the immobility of the essence of reality.

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de rgyal bas 'chad dam ci zhes thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de rgyal bas 'chad dam ci zhes thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This kind of concentration is explained by the Victorious One.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nor bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nor bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is the unsurpassed treasure of the bodhisattvas.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid dang lta ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid dang lta ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: It is the purity of body, speech, mind, and view.

original: dmigs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'o //
translated: It is the transcendence of all reference points.

original: skye ba med pa mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the engagement in the direct realization of non-arising.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the wisdom that engages in the correct discriminations.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mkhas pa'o //
translated: It is the expertise in the aggregates, elements, and sense sources.

original: yi ge rab tu dbye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge rab tu dbye ba shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the differentiation of syllables.

original: rdzas su mngon par zhen pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas su mngon par zhen pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'o //
translated: It is the transcendence of clinging to substances.🔽It is the attainment of joy and delight.

original: dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba 'thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mang ngo //
analyzed: dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba 'thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mang ngo //
translated: And so on. There are many other qualities of the Thus Gone One.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa de dag thams cad ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa de dag thams cad ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: All of those knowledges of the Tathāgata that arise from the cultivation of samādhi are the power of samādhi.

original: gzhon nu de'i tshigs bcad de thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhon nu de'i tshigs bcad de thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having heard those verses, the prince said, Your Majesty, it is like this.

original: gzhon nu des de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan ji lta ba brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa thos nas khrag khrig stong phrag brgyad kyis ni sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: gzhon nu des de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan ji lta ba brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa thos nas khrag khrig stong phrag brgyad kyis ni sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Having heard the verses that describe the Tathāgata's true qualities, the prince attained the acceptance that follows sound with eight trillion.

original: de nas rgyal po stobs brtan gyis gzhon nu de la smras pa de bzhin gshegs pa de da ltar yang bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po stobs brtan gyis gzhon nu de la smras pa de bzhin gshegs pa de da ltar yang bzhugs so //
translated: Then King Dṛdhabala said to the prince, That Tathāgata still exists.

original: 'on kyang khyod la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyod la dri bar bya'o //
translated: However, I will ask you.

original: su las khyod kyis ting nge 'dzin 'di thos //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽gzhon nus gang las thos pa gzhon nus smras pa /
analyzed: su las khyod kyis ting nge 'dzin 'di thos // zhes bya ba la / gzhon nus gang las thos pa gzhon nus smras pa /
translated: From whom did you hear this samādhi?🔽The prince said, Your Majesty, listen.

original: rgyal po gsan du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyal po gsan du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The prince said, Your Majesty, listen.

original: bskal pa gcig la yang de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa mthong ste de dag la bdag gis bsnyen bkur byas shing ting nge 'dzin yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su zhus so //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig la yang de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa mthong ste de dag la bdag gis bsnyen bkur byas shing ting nge 'dzin yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su zhus so //
translated: In a single eon, he sees countless Tathagatas, and he serves them. In order to cultivate samadhi, he asks about the essence of samadhi.

original: de nas bzung nas bskal pa bye ba brgya @67b stong du yang skyes so cog tu skye ba dran zhing mngal gyi dri mas mgos par rdzus te skya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bzung nas bskal pa bye ba brgya @67b stong du yang skyes so cog tu skye ba dran zhing mngal gyi dri mas mgos par rdzus te skya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From then on, for a hundred thousand kotis of eons, in every life he remembers his past lives, and is born miraculously, untainted by the womb.

original: de'i phyir ma rmongs shing dran pa 'dus byas pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang nam yang ma bral lo //🔽chos dang chos smra ba la gus pa dang bcas pa dang ri mo dang bcas par byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rmongs shing dran pa 'dus byas pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang nam yang ma bral lo // chos dang chos smra ba la gus pa dang bcas pa dang ri mo dang bcas par byas so //
translated: Therefore, being undeluded and mindful, he is never separated from the cultivation of samadhi.🔽He becomes respectful and reverent towards the Dharma and the expounder of the Dharma.

original: gus pa dang bcas pa dang ri mo dang bcas pas gus pa dang ri mor brgyas pas bdag gi snyan pa dang / grags pa dang / yon tan 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pa dang ri mo dang bcas pas gus pa dang ri mor brgyas pas bdag gi snyan pa dang / grags pa dang / yon tan 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through respect and reverence, his fame, renown, and good qualities increase.

original: 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / mi mthun pa la yang sems kyi rgyud ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su bsgos par gyur pas khro ba la sogs pa dang bral nas sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / mi mthun pa la yang sems kyi rgyud ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su bsgos par gyur pas khro ba la sogs pa dang bral nas sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang /
translated: Even when there is fighting, quarreling, and disagreement, because the mind-stream is thoroughly imbued with samādhi, one is free from anger and so forth, and one is not separated from generosity, moral discipline, patience, perseverance,🔽meditative stabilization, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba nyid du bzod pa rab tu gnas nas de bzhin gshegs pa sgra'i yan lag dbyangs kyi spyan sngar bdag gis bzod pa'i stobs kyis rtag tu gnas par bgyi'o zhes dam bcas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba nyid du bzod pa rab tu gnas nas de bzhin gshegs pa sgra'i yan lag dbyangs kyi spyan sngar bdag gis bzod pa'i stobs kyis rtag tu gnas par bgyi'o zhes dam bcas so //
translated: Having well-ascended patience, one should make the vow in the presence of the Tathāgata Ghoṣānana: ‘I will always abide by the power of patience.’🔽‘Always’ means at all times. ‘

original: rtag tu ni dus thams cad du bzod pa'i stobs kyis gnas par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni dus thams cad du bzod pa'i stobs kyis gnas par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: I will abide by the power of patience.’

original: bdag bzod pa'i stobs da la gnas pa na bdud kyis bdag la gtse ba rnam pa sna tshogs byas na yang bdag gi sems 'khrugs bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: bdag bzod pa'i stobs da la gnas pa na bdud kyis bdag la gtse ba rnam pa sna tshogs byas na yang bdag gi sems 'khrugs bar ma gyur to //
translated: When I abide in the power of patience, even if Māra creates various disturbances for me, my mind will not be disturbed.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dpag tu med pa bsgrags pa yang byang chub 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dpag tu med pa bsgrags pa yang byang chub 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The proclamation of such immeasurable qualities is for the sake of the bodhisattva who desires enlightenment, and is for the purpose of teaching that he should train in that way.

original: sngon gyi bskal pa du mar 'di bas ches mang ba'i dka' ba spyad pa ngas dran te /
analyzed: sngon gyi bskal pa du mar 'di bas ches mang ba'i dka' ba spyad pa ngas dran te /
translated: I remember undergoing austerities even greater than this in many previous eons,

original: de dang de brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de dang de brjod par mi nus so //
translated: but I am unable to describe them all.🔽Now I will go to the presence of the Sugata.

original: da ni bdag bde bar gshegs pa'i drung du mchi'o zhes bya ba la des dus de nyid kyi tshe mngon par shes pa lnga bsgrubs nas rdzu 'phrul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i thad du song ste /
analyzed: da ni bdag bde bar gshegs pa'i drung du mchi'o zhes bya ba la des dus de nyid kyi tshe mngon par shes pa lnga bsgrubs nas rdzu 'phrul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i thad du song ste /
translated: At that very time, he attained the five higher knowledges and through his miraculous powers went into the presence of the Tathagata.

original: phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byas nas mdun du 'dug par gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byas nas mdun du 'dug par gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat in front.

original: nga ni rgyal po dpal gyi stobs su gyur /
analyzed: nga ni rgyal po dpal gyi stobs su gyur /
translated: I was King Shri-bala.

original: nga'i bu rnams ni chos skyong bar gyur pa de dag go //
analyzed: nga'i bu rnams ni chos skyong bar gyur pa de dag go //
translated: My sons were those who protected the Dharma.

original: bu mo gang yin pa de dag ni mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: bu mo gang yin pa de dag ni mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: Those daughters of mine have passed into nirvana.

original: rgyal po stobs brtan ni zas gtsang ma'o //
analyzed: rgyal po stobs brtan ni zas gtsang ma'o //
translated: King Dṛḍhabala is Śuddhodana.

original: skyed pa'i ma gang yin pa de ni lha mo sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: skyed pa'i ma gang yin pa de ni lha mo sgyu ma'o //
translated: The mother who gave birth to him is Māyādevī.

original: de ltar smon lam gyi stobs kyis de @68a * //
analyzed: de ltar smon lam gyi stobs kyis de @68a * //
translated: Thus, by the power of his prayers,

original: dang der skye ba bzung ngo //
analyzed: dang der skye ba bzung ngo //
translated: he took birth here and there.

original: ngas de ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pas ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs so //
analyzed: ngas de ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pas ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs so //
translated: I attained this samādhi through the practice of diligence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du brtson 'grub brtsams la ting nge 'dzin 'di bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du brtson 'grub brtsams la ting nge 'dzin 'di bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Bodhisattvas should also attain this samādhi through the practice of diligence.”

original: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa nyer bsten nas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa nyer bsten nas //
translated: “Having attended to countless buddhas,

original: ting 'dzin rgyal po nga yis bde bar thob //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rgyal po nga yis bde bar thob //
translated: I attained this king of samādhis with ease.

original: ma bslabs pa dag bslab phyir rab bstan te //
analyzed: ma bslabs pa dag bslab phyir rab bstan te //
translated: I taught it to train those who were untrained,

original: de nas nga ni bde gshegs thub dbang gyur //
analyzed: de nas nga ni bde gshegs thub dbang gyur //
translated: and then I became a sugata, a lord of sages.

original: sangs rgyas mang po las ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nges par bsgrubs pa'i le'u ste bcu bdun pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po las ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nges par bsgrubs pa'i le'u ste bcu bdun pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary to the seventeenth chapter, on the attainment of the gateway to the samādhi through the practice of many buddhas.

original: // / ting nge 'dzin rjes su yongs su gtang pa'i le'u bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: // / ting nge 'dzin rjes su yongs su gtang pa'i le'u bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, intending to teach the chapter on the relinquishment of meditative concentration,

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Buddha] declares, Then again the Lord, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The bodhisattva who upholds this meditative concentration, and so on up to

original: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu ston pa zhes bya ba'i bar na gnas pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu ston pa zhes bya ba'i bar na gnas pa /
translated: teaches it extensively to others, is the one who abides.

original: de la yon tan gyi phan yon bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la bsod nams zil gyis mi non par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsod nams pas bsod nams lhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yon tan gyi phan yon bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la bsod nams zil gyis mi non par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsod nams pas bsod nams lhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, four benefits of the qualities should be known, and so on. His merit becomes invincible because his merit surpasses the merit of all beings who experience the three realms.

original: bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi rdzi ba'i ye shes kun tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi rdzi ba'i ye shes kun tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He attains the wisdom that is not overwhelmed by all adversaries such as Mara, tirthikas, and so on.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir ye shes dpag tu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir ye shes dpag tu med par 'gyur /
translated: For this very reason, his wisdom becomes immeasurable.

original: spobs pa mtha' yas par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spobs pa mtha' yas par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One will have infinite eloquence.

original: tshigs su bcad pas phan yon rgyas par bstan pa bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /🔽bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas dpag tu med ;
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pas phan yon rgyas par bstan pa bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni / bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas dpag tu med ;
translated: The verse teaches the extensive explanation of the benefits.

original: / stobs bcus de yi phan yon brjod na yang //
analyzed: / stobs bcus de yi phan yon brjod na yang //
translated: The ten powers could not fully describe the benefits🔽of even a single particle of the bodhisattva deeds.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis thams cad mkhyen par spyod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du ste / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis thams cad mkhyen par spyod kyi /
translated: The verse continues up to:

original: phan yon mthar thug par brjod pa lta zhog cha tsam bgrang bar yang mi nus te /
analyzed: phan yon mthar thug par brjod pa lta zhog cha tsam bgrang bar yang mi nus te /
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata himself, the knowledge of all aspects, could not fully describe the benefits of even a single particle of the bodhisattva deeds.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po las chu thigs pa gcig blangs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po las chu thigs pa gcig blangs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: How much less could one like me, who is like a single drop of water from the great ocean?
