original: zla 'od kyis phan yon shin tu rgya che ba thob pas sems shin tu dga' nas thos pa yang shin tu rnyed par dka'o snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: zla 'od kyis phan yon shin tu rgya che ba thob pas sems shin tu dga' nas thos pa yang shin tu rnyed par dka'o snyam du bsams te /
translated: Candraprabha, having attained such vast benefits, his mind extremely joyful, thought that it was very difficult to obtain such teachings.

original: bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa ni //
translated: He asked the Bhagavan:

original: phyi ma'i dus na su dag ni //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na su dag ni //
translated: In the future, who will

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: bcom @68b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @68b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gzhon nu bshad kyis mnyan par gyis //
analyzed: gzhon nu bshad kyis mnyan par gyis //
translated: “Listen, young man, I will explain

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: gang dag chos nyid la nan tan gyis zhugs pa de de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa yin /
analyzed: gang dag chos nyid la nan tan gyis zhugs pa de de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa yin /
translated: Those who are diligent in the nature of phenomena, they are making offerings to the Tathagata.

original: byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have a loving mind.

original: bslab pa la gus pa yin te mdo 'di nyid nyan par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: bslab pa la gus pa yin te mdo 'di nyid nyan par 'gyur ro ;
translated: They have respect for the training, and they will listen to this very sutra.

original: / gang dag sngon de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa de dag nyan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gang dag sngon de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa de dag nyan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have made offerings to the Tathagata in the past, they will listen.

original: gang yang sngon gyi tshe rabs su mu stegs can du gyur pa de dag ma dad nas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang sngon gyi tshe rabs su mu stegs can du gyur pa de dag ma dad nas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who in past lives became non-Buddhists, they will become faithless and abandon it.

original: nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa de dag kyang rab tu spong bar byed do //
analyzed: nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa de dag kyang rab tu spong bar byed do //
translated: Those who have gone forth in my teachings, desiring gain and honor, they too will abandon it.

original: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi mchod rten thams cad bshig pa bas yang gzhan zhig gis mdo sde 'di spangs na /
analyzed: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi mchod rten thams cad bshig pa bas yang gzhan zhig gis mdo sde 'di spangs na /
translated: If one were to destroy all the stupas in Jambudvipa, and if another were to abandon this sutra,

original: 'di'i sdig khyad par du 'phags shing che'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sdig khyad par du 'phags shing che'o //
translated: The sin of the latter is especially exalted and great.

original: de bzhin du gang gis gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi dgra bcom pa bsad pa bas gang mdo sde 'di spong bar byed pa de'i sdig pa shin tu che ba yin no ;
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gis gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi dgra bcom pa bsad pa bas gang mdo sde 'di spong bar byed pa de'i sdig pa shin tu che ba yin no ;
translated: In the same way, the sin of one who rejects this Sutra is much greater than that of one who kills as many Arhats as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: / khyed la su dag spro ba yod //🔽ces bya ba la /🔽phyi ma'i dus mi bzad pa na dam pa'i chos 'jig pa'i tshe mdo sde 'di 'chad par spro ba khyed las su yod ces bka' stsal ba dang / zla 'od kyis zhus pa de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas bdag gi lus dang srog la yang ltos pa med par gcig tu chos la dga' bas /
analyzed: / khyed la su dag spro ba yod // ces bya ba la / phyi ma'i dus mi bzad pa na dam pa'i chos 'jig pa'i tshe mdo sde 'di 'chad par spro ba khyed las su yod ces bka' stsal ba dang / zla 'od kyis zhus pa de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas bdag gi lus dang srog la yang ltos pa med par gcig tu chos la dga' bas /
translated: Who among you is enthusiastic?🔽In the future, in the terrible time when the holy Dharma is being destroyed, who among you is enthusiastic about explaining this Sutra?

original: mdo sde 'di rgya cher rgyas par bgyi'o zhes zhus so //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di rgya cher rgyas par bgyi'o zhes zhus so //
translated: Candraprabha replied, After the Tathagata has passed into Nirvana, without regard for my own body and life, I will delight only in the Dharma and will spread this Sutra far and wide.

original: gzhan byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba brgyad brgya yang stan las langs te bdag cag gis kyang phyi ma'i dus na mdo sde rin po che 'di gzung bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba brgyad brgya yang stan las langs te bdag cag gis kyang phyi ma'i dus na mdo sde rin po che 'di gzung bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another eight hundred bodhisattvas, Dharma teachers, rose from their seats and said, “We too will uphold this precious sūtra in the future.”

original: lha la sogs pa rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das la thal mo sbyar nas bdag cag gis kyang chos 'dzin pa bsrung bar bgyi'o zhes gsol to //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das la thal mo sbyar nas bdag cag gis kyang chos 'dzin pa bsrung bar bgyi'o zhes gsol to //
translated: The gods and so forth, with palms joined, requested the Blessed One, “We too will protect those who uphold the Dharma.”

original: mdo sde 'di rab tu bshad pa na gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi grangs dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab tu g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di rab tu bshad pa na gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi grangs dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab tu g-yos par gyur to //
translated: When this sūtra was fully explained, the buddhafields equal in number to the sands of the Ganges River shook.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag nas 'ongs pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis chos 'di lta bu thos nas sems can bye ba dpag tu med pa sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rab tu gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag nas 'ongs pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis chos 'di lta bu thos nas sems can bye ba dpag tu med pa sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rab tu gnas par gyur to //
translated: Those who came from those buddhafields, through the blessing of the Tathāgata, heard this Dharma and countless millions of beings were established in the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gnas pa mang po yang byang chub tu sems bskyed de de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas nas sangs rgyas nyid du @69a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gnas pa mang po yang byang chub tu sems bskyed de de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas nas sangs rgyas nyid du @69a * //
translated: Many who were present in this buddha field generated the mind of awakening, made offerings to the Thus-Gone One, and attained buddhahood.🔽

original: lung bstan pa nges par thob par gyur to //
analyzed: lung bstan pa nges par thob par gyur to //
translated: Many who were present in this buddha-field, having generated the mind of awakening and made offerings to the Tathāgata, have received the prophecy of their buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams kyis kyang mdo sde rin po che 'di thos nas nges par sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu lung bstan to zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams kyis kyang mdo sde rin po che 'di thos nas nges par sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu lung bstan to zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen have received the prophecy of their buddhahood after hearing this precious sūtra.

original: gang su dag phyi ma'i dus na mdo sde 'di nyan pa de dag kyang nges par sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang su dag phyi ma'i dus na mdo sde 'di nyan pa de dag kyang nges par sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Those who in the future will listen to this sūtra will certainly become buddhas.

original: ting 'dzin rgyal po ma lus don ldan pa //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rgyal po ma lus don ldan pa //
translated: The king of samādhis, which is endowed with the complete meaning,

original: byang chub mchog gtso'i rgyur gyur ba brtan pas //
analyzed: byang chub mchog gtso'i rgyur gyur ba brtan pas //
translated: is the cause of the supreme awakening of the steadfast.

original: rgyal ba kun gyis rjes gdams rab gtad de //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyis rjes gdams rab gtad de //
translated: It is entrusted by all the victors,

original: 'gro ba kun gyi dngos grub cher 'byung shog //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun gyi dngos grub cher 'byung shog //
translated: may it be the great attainment of all beings.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su gtad pa'i le'u ste bco brgyad pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /🔽// / sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nges par bstan pa bshad par bzhed nas /🔽de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su gtad pa'i le'u ste bco brgyad pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so / // / sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nges par bstan pa bshad par bzhed nas / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: gzhon nu de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan gyi rjes su bsngags pa thos nas mi skrag par 'dod pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams🔽la mkhas par bya'o//🔽gzhan du na shin tu zab pa'i chos thos na kun du rmongs par 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa thos na mi skrag / mi dngang /
analyzed: gzhon nu de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan gyi rjes su bsngags pa thos nas mi skrag par 'dod pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams🔽la mkhas par bya'o//🔽gzhan du na shin tu zab pa'i chos thos na kun du rmongs par 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa thos na mi skrag / mi dngang /
translated: This completes the explanation of the eighteenth chapter of the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, the chapter on the entrustment of the meditative absorption.

original: dngang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas mi skrag pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum gyi don blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas mi skrag pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum gyi don blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the passage beginning one should not be afraid, etc., the three words not afraid, etc., should be understood as referring to the small, medium, and great divisions.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni zla 'od kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni zla 'od kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'o //
translated: Kausika, how should a Bodhisattva become skilled in the inconceivable Dharma of the Buddha?

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di nyan cing thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston na zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di nyan cing thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston na zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Having heard this Samadhi of the Full Attainment of the Equality of the Nature of all Dharmas, having heard it, etc., up to having taught it extensively to others,

original: gzhon nu byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nges par bstan pa la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nges par bstan pa la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: O Prince, that Bodhisattva should become skilled in the teaching of the inconceivable Dharma of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bsdus pa'i ngo bo chos thams @69b cad kya rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i mchog tu gyur pa'i phan yon zla 'od kyis thos pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bsdus pa'i ngo bo chos thams @69b cad kya rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i mchog tu gyur pa'i phan yon zla 'od kyis thos pas /
translated: The moon-light heard this kind of supreme benefit, which is the essence of all the Buddha-dharmas, the samādhi called the equality of the nature of all dharmas, and

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di rab tu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di rab tu thob par gyur to //
translated: he attained this king of samādhis.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rab tu mang pos kyang mngon par shes pa'i shes pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rab tu mang pos kyang mngon par shes pa'i shes pa thob par gyur to //
translated: And many other bodhisattva mahāsattvas attained the knowledge of the higher perceptions.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ting nge 'dzin 'di'i mthu lhag par gyur pa'i dbang gis sa g-yo ba dang / lha la sogs pas me tog gi char 'bebs pa la sogs pa'i ngo mtshar ni sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byed par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ting nge 'dzin 'di'i mthu lhag par gyur pa'i dbang gis sa g-yo ba dang / lha la sogs pas me tog gi char 'bebs pa la sogs pa'i ngo mtshar ni sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byed par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this way, by the power of this samādhi, the earth shook, and the gods and so forth caused a rain of flowers to fall, and so forth. The marvel should be understood to benefit countless beings.

original: de nas de nyid du dri za'i bu gtsug phud lnga pa zhes bya ba sil snyan lnga brgya dang bcas par nam mkha'i dkyil nas babs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug par gyur te bsnyen bkur dang g-yog byed do //
analyzed: de nas de nyid du dri za'i bu gtsug phud lnga pa zhes bya ba sil snyan lnga brgya dang bcas par nam mkha'i dkyil nas babs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug par gyur te bsnyen bkur dang g-yog byed do //
translated: Then, in that very place, the gandharva son Pañcaśikha, together with five hundred musical instruments, descended from the middle of the sky and sat in the presence of the Blessed One, and served and attended to him.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba bstan pa nyid kyis zla 'od kyi sems sangs rgyas kyi chos la gcig tu gzhol bar nges par bstan pa la mkhas pa thob bar bya ba dang gtsug phud lnga pa can yang rgyud la mkhas pa thob🔽par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba bstan pa nyid kyis zla 'od kyi sems sangs rgyas kyi chos la gcig tu gzhol bar nges par bstan pa la mkhas pa thob bar bya ba dang gtsug phud lnga pa can yang rgyud la mkhas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One, by displaying his miraculous powers, taught that Candraprabha's mind was definitely focused on the Buddha's teachings, and in order to make him attain skill in teaching, and also Pañcaśikha, in order to make him attain skill in the continuum.

original: de nas pi wang dang sil snyan rnams las bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di la nges par gzhol bar 'gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i sgra sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas pi wang dang sil snyan rnams las bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di la nges par gzhol bar 'gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i sgra sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byung bar gyur te /
translated: Then, by the blessing of the Buddha, the sound of verses that definitely lead to this inconceivable Buddha's teaching arose from the lutes and musical instruments:

original: skra gcig khyon la sangs rgyas mang po ni //
analyzed: skra gcig khyon la sangs rgyas mang po ni //
translated: Many buddhas in the space of a single hair.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rmi lam gyi nang du lha la sogs pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba dang / bzhon pa sna tshogs dang / gzhal yas khang la sogs pa mthong yang khyim der de dag zhugs pa yang ma yin de nas phyir byung ba yang med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rmi lam gyi nang du lha la sogs pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba dang / bzhon pa sna tshogs dang / gzhal yas khang la sogs pa mthong yang khyim der de dag zhugs pa yang ma yin de nas phyir byung ba yang med do //
translated: In a dream, one experiences the bliss of gods and so forth, and sees various vehicles, palaces, and so on, but they do not enter that house, nor do they come out of it.

original: de bzhin du rang gi sems tsam las tha mi dad pa'i dngos po don gyis stong pa dmigs su med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi sems tsam las tha mi dad pa'i dngos po don gyis stong pa dmigs su med pa /
translated: In the same way, things that are not different from mind only, empty of meaning, and unobservable,

original: rmi lam du snang ba ltar ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i sems nyid phyin ci log tu dmyal ba la sogs par rab tu snang ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam du snang ba ltar ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i sems nyid phyin ci log tu dmyal ba la sogs par rab tu snang ngo //
translated: appear as the opposite, as hells and so on, in the mind itself, tainted by the latent tendencies of ignorance, like appearances in a dream.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i sems la ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i sems la ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: In the mind tainted by the latent tendencies of the thought of awakening and the perfections, the appearances of tathāgatas and so on occur.

original: skra gcig khyon la ste /
analyzed: skra gcig khyon la ste /
translated: In the space of a single hair.

original: spu'i khung bur sangs rgyas mang po gangg'a'i klung gi @70a * //
analyzed: spu'i khung bur sangs rgyas mang po gangg'a'i klung gi @70a * //
translated: Many buddhas are present in the pores of his body.🔽

original: bye ma'i grangs dang mnyam par rab tu snang ngo //
analyzed: bye ma'i grangs dang mnyam par rab tu snang ngo //
translated: Many buddhas, equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges river, appear in each pore.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang de snyed nyid de phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang de snyed nyid de phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid du gnas so //
translated: And there are that many buddha-fields, existing without mutual interference.

original: 'gro ba lngar skyes par gyur pa'i dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang / mi rnams kyang ngo //🔽'dres pa med cing gnod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'dres shing 'dus pa yang med /
analyzed: 'gro ba lngar skyes par gyur pa'i dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang / mi rnams kyang ngo // 'dres pa med cing gnod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'dres shing 'dus pa yang med /
translated: The beings born in the five destinies are the hell-beings, animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans.🔽They are not mixed up and do not harm each other.

original: gcig la gcig gnod pa yang med de /
analyzed: gcig la gcig gnod pa yang med de /
translated: They are not mixed up and do not harm each other,

original: rang rang gi dbang du snang ba tsam gyis mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi dbang du snang ba tsam gyis mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are limited to the mere appearance of their own individual [worlds].

original: ri dang / chu klung dang / nags tshang tshing la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig la gcig dogs pa med par shes so ;
analyzed: ri dang / chu klung dang / nags tshang tshing la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig la gcig dogs pa med par shes so ;
translated: One should understand that the mountains, rivers, forests, and so forth are also without mutual interference.

original: /'gro ba lngar snang ba spyir bstan nas rgyas par so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: /'gro ba lngar snang ba spyir bstan nas rgyas par so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having generally taught the appearance of the five destinies, in order to teach them individually in detail, [the next verse] is stated.

original: de yi gnas su ri bo du ma ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yi gnas su ri bo du ma ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In its place are many mountains.

original: khor yug dang / khor yug chen po dang / ri dang / ri rab dang / btang bzung dang / btang bzung chen po dang / 'bigs byed dang ; bya rgod kyi phung po la sogs pa'i ri rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: khor yug dang / khor yug chen po dang / ri dang / ri rab dang / btang bzung dang / btang bzung chen po dang / 'bigs byed dang ; bya rgod kyi phung po la sogs pa'i ri rnams kyang ngo //
translated: In this verse, the following are mentioned: the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains, the Sumeru mountain, the Yugandhara, Īṣādhara, Khadiraka, Mount Sudarśana, Aśvakarṇa, Vinataka, Mount Nimindhara, and the Gandhamādana mountain.

original: de bzhin du dmyal ba tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / thig nag la sogs pa rnams dang / der skyes pa rnams la sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa rab tu snang zhing sdug bsngal nyams su myong ngo //🔽de yi gnas na lha yi gzhal med khang ;
analyzed: de bzhin du dmyal ba tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / thig nag la sogs pa rnams dang / der skyes pa rnams la sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa rab tu snang zhing sdug bsngal nyams su myong ngo // de yi gnas na lha yi gzhal med khang ;
translated: Similarly, the hot hells, the extremely hot hells, the black lines hell, and so on, appear to those born there as forms of suffering and they experience suffering.

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /
translated: In its place are the celestial palaces of the gods.

original: lha rnams gzhal med khang na gnas shing bde ba nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: lha rnams gzhal med khang na gnas shing bde ba nyams su myong ngo //
translated: The gods live in the celestial palaces and experience pleasure.

original: de yi gnas su sangs rgyas rnams skye zhing //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yi gnas su sangs rgyas rnams skye zhing // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In its place the Buddhas are born.

original: sangs rgyas rnams skye zhing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams skye zhing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas are born, turn the wheel of Dharma, and so on.

original: ye shes bral bdag gis de mi mthong //
analyzed: ye shes bral bdag gis de mi mthong //
translated: The one who is devoid of the root of merit for seeing the Buddha does not see him.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bral ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bral ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The one who is devoid of the root of merit for seeing the Buddha does not see him.

original: de'i gnas nyid na dam pa'i chos nub cing de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das par yang thos so //
analyzed: de'i gnas nyid na dam pa'i chos nub cing de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das par yang thos so //
translated: And he hears that the holy Dharma has disappeared and the Tathagata has entered Nirvana.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And so on, up to:

original: 'dren pa bzhugs te chos kyang ston zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dren pa bzhugs te chos kyang ston zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Guide is present and teaches the Dharma.

original: de la kha cig ni dpag tu med par che 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni dpag tu med par che 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Some of them think that the assembly is very large, immeasurable.

original: kha cig ni thung ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni thung ba nyid du'o //
translated: Some think that it is small.

original: gnas der la la 'di snyam du 'du shes te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas der la la 'di snyam du 'du shes te zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that place, some have this thought.

original: kha cig ni 'di snyam du bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa byas so zhes 'du shes shing /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di snyam du bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa byas so zhes 'du shes shing /
translated: Some think: “I have made offerings to the Tathagata.”

original: 'du shes su 'dzin pas dga' ba'i 'du shes 'jug par gyur kyang ma skyes pa la @70b mchod bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes su 'dzin pas dga' ba'i 'du shes 'jug par gyur kyang ma skyes pa la @70b mchod bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And they are filled with the perception of joy. But it is not possible to make offerings to the unborn.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad rnams ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad rnams ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there are conventions such as seeing?

original: rmi lam gyi dpes thams cad grub bo zhes bya bar /🔽mi dag bdag gi khyim na rmi lam bzhin //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dpes thams cad grub bo zhes bya bar / mi dag bdag gi khyim na rmi lam bzhin //
translated: By the example of a dream, it is said: Everything is established.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The non-Buddhists say: In my house, like in a dream,

original: rang gi khyim na nyal ba zhig gis rmi lam du lha la sogs pa'i bde ba nyams su myong zhing 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas ngoms pa med pa nyid las sad par gyur na 'dong ba'i yon tan lnga mthong ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi khyim na nyal ba zhig gis rmi lam du lha la sogs pa'i bde ba nyams su myong zhing 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas ngoms pa med pa nyid las sad par gyur na 'dong ba'i yon tan lnga mthong ba med do //
translated: Here, someone sleeping in their own house experiences the bliss of gods, etc., and is not satisfied with the five sense objects. When they wake up, they do not see the five sense objects of the dream.

original: rmi lam du mthong ba de nyid ma skyes pa mi bden pa'o zhes shes so //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba de nyid ma skyes pa mi bden pa'o zhes shes so //
translated: They know that what was seen in the dream is unborn and untrue.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba dang / nyams su myong ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad rnams kyang brdzun pa'i bag chags kyis sprul pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nges par rtogs nas chos nyid de kho na nyid la g-yo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba dang / nyams su myong ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad rnams kyang brdzun pa'i bag chags kyis sprul pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nges par rtogs nas chos nyid de kho na nyid la g-yo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes
translated: In the same way, the conventions of seeing, experiencing, and consciousness are also emanations of false habitual tendencies, not ultimate reality. Having ascertained the nature of samadhi, one does not waver from that reality, thatness.

original: bya ba'o // yul rnams la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i char 'byed pa dang bral ba de ni 'dzin pa dang / dor ba med pas bse ru bzhin du the tshom med par lam gang yin pa de rnam par sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'o // yul rnams la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i char 'byed pa dang bral ba de ni 'dzin pa dang / dor ba med pas bse ru bzhin du the tshom med par lam gang yin pa de rnam par sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: He who is free from the discrimination of the objects into the agreeable and the disagreeable, he who is without grasping and without rejecting, he who is without doubt like a rhinoceros, he cultivates the path.

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes ye shes nges par bsgrub pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes ye shes nges par bsgrub pa /
translated: The ascertainment of the knowledge that all dharmas are empty.

original: de yi spobs pa dag ni mtha' yas 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi spobs pa dag ni mtha' yas 'gyur //
translated: His eloquence will be infinite.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug par kun du chags pa med pa de la ni sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mthar byas 'di gnyis rab tu spangs nas ni chos nyid gcig pu la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug par kun du chags pa med pa de la ni sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mthar byas 'di gnyis rab tu spangs nas ni chos nyid gcig pu la brten par bya'o //
translated: He who is free from attachment to the agreeable and the disagreeable, having abandoned these two, the suffering of separation from the agreeable and the suffering of encountering the disagreeable, he should rely on the one reality.

original: gang zhig chos 'di thos nas chags byed cing //
analyzed: gang zhig chos 'di thos nas chags byed cing //
translated: He who, having heard this Dharma, becomes attached,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni chos nyid yin no zhes thos na rjes su chags pa'i dbang gis mngon par zhen no ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni chos nyid yin no zhes thos na rjes su chags pa'i dbang gis mngon par zhen no ;
translated: The nature of things is in accord with nirvana. They become attached to this through their attachment to the doctrine of the aggregates.

original: / chos ma yin pa ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes khong khro ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: / chos ma yin pa ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes khong khro ba skyed par byed do //
translated: They become angry, thinking, Non-Dharma is the cause of hell and so on.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid du ma rtogs pas nga rgyal dang rgyags pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid du ma rtogs pas nga rgyal dang rgyags pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: They experience suffering through the power of pride and conceit, because they have not realized the equality of Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa rnams ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa las grol ba nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa rnams ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa las grol ba nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: Those who abide in equality abide in freedom from the agreeable and disagreeable.

original: de dag ni tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to abide in the perfection of morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom.

original: gang dag phyin ci log gi lam la zhugs pa de dag ni bdud kyi zhags pas @71a * //🔽bzung ba zhes ba lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag phyin ci log gi lam la zhugs pa de dag ni bdud kyi zhags pas @71a * //🔽bzung ba zhes ba lta bar bya'o //
translated: Those who have entered the path of error are said to be seized by the snares of Mara.

original: zla 'od gzhon nus tshigs su bcad pa'i don khong du chud bas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo rnams la gcig tu nges par nges par brten pa la mkhas pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: zla 'od gzhon nus tshigs su bcad pa'i don khong du chud bas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo rnams la gcig tu nges par nges par brten pa la mkhas pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Candraprabha Kumāra, having understood the meaning of the verses, attained expertise in the inconceivable profound dharmas of the Buddha, being certain in one-pointed focus.

original: dri za'i bu gtsug phud lnga pa can gyis kyang sgra'i rjes su 'jug pa'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: dri za'i bu gtsug phud lnga pa can gyis kyang sgra'i rjes su 'jug pa'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Pañcaśikha, the Gandharva, also attained the acceptance that follows sound.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis chos nyid rab tu rtogs par gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis chos nyid rab tu rtogs par gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that through the blessings of the Tathāgata, he realized the true nature of reality.

original: ri bong 'dzin pa'i 'od ltar dkar ba'i dka' 'grel grags pa'i mdangs ldan pa //
analyzed: ri bong 'dzin pa'i 'od ltar dkar ba'i dka' 'grel grags pa'i mdangs ldan pa //
translated: The commentary, radiant with fame, white like the light of Śaśibhūṣaṇa,

original: 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi zhabs kyi padma la gus tsam gyis rab bsgrubs la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi zhabs kyi padma la gus tsam gyis rab bsgrubs la /
translated: is accomplished merely by devotion to the lotus feet of Mañjughosa.

original: mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las skyes skye bo ma lus phan don du //
analyzed: mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las skyes skye bo ma lus phan don du //
translated: For the benefit of all beings born from the King of the Lords of Sūtras,

original: gal te legs par mthong na ye shes pa la brten pa'i don /
analyzed: gal te legs par mthong na ye shes pa la brten pa'i don /
translated: if seen well, the meaning based on the wisdom being,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nges par bstan pa'i le'u ste bcu dgu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nges par bstan pa'i le'u ste bcu dgu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the nineteenth chapter of the Lotus Sutra, the chapter on the teaching of the inconceivable qualities of the Buddha.

original: // / dbang po tog gi rgyal mtshan rgyal po'i le'u nges par bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: // / dbang po tog gi rgyal mtshan rgyal po'i le'u nges par bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: The chapter on the king of the banner of the crest jewel, intending to teach,

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Bhagavat spoke thus and so forth.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bslab pa dang / yon tan gyi chos gdon mi za zhing tshul khrims shin tu yongs su dag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bslab pa dang / yon tan gyi chos gdon mi za zhing tshul khrims shin tu yongs su dag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The roots of virtue, the training, and the qualities of the Dharma are without doubt, and one should make the morality completely pure.

original: tshul khrims la rab tu gnas nas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad mchog tu mthar thug par nges par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims la rab tu gnas nas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad mchog tu mthar thug par nges par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Having been established in morality, one will definitely accomplish the supreme perfection of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: tshul khrims kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions of morality,

original: 'du 'dzi med pa mang zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pa mang zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is said, “having much solitude.”

original: dben pa la dga' ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dben pa la dga' ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of delighting in solitude will be pure.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spangs pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / mngon par dga' bas snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad nges par gzung ba'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa thams cad tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spangs pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / mngon par dga' bas snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad nges par gzung ba'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa thams cad tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Abandoning evil friends, relying on spiritual friends, listening to the holy Dharma, holding it, keeping it, and delighting in it, one should arouse the thought of enlightenment out of great compassion in order to take hold of all sentient beings. All of these are branches of morality.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams shing lus dang srog la mi lta bas rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i ba shes gnyen btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams shing lus dang srog la mi lta bas rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i ba shes gnyen btsal bar bya'o //
translated: One should seek spiritual friends uninterruptedly, with energetic effort, without regard for one’s body or life.

original: g-yo med pa ni bcos ma @71b ma yin pa'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen las snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mnyan par bya /
analyzed: g-yo med pa ni bcos ma @71b ma yin pa'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen las snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mnyan par bya /
translated: One should listen to this Dharma teaching on entering great compassion from a spiritual friend with an uncontrived mind.

original: gzung bar bya zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzung bar bya zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One should hold it, keep it, and so on.

original: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: and should also be taught extensively to others.

original: gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshol ba dang / sri zhu bya ba dang / g-yog bya ba la yid mi skyo bar gyur pa de'i tshe bde bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshol ba dang / sri zhu bya ba dang / g-yog bya ba la yid mi skyo bar gyur pa de'i tshe bde bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one is not discouraged in seeking the spiritual friend, in serving him, and in attending on him, then one will easily attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa nyid yin na snying rje chen po la 'dug pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa nyid yin na snying rje chen po la 'dug pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If even unsurpassed perfect enlightenment depends on the spiritual friend, what need is there to mention the Dharma discourse called The Abode of Great Compassion?

original: sngon byung ba bstan pa tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yang dag par rab tu bstan zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sngon byung ba bstan pa tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yang dag par rab tu bstan zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the past is explained in verse:

original: 'das pa'i bskal ba bye ba mang po ste //
analyzed: 'das pa'i bskal ba bye ba mang po ste //
translated: Many millions of eons ago,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: 'das pa'i bskal pa dpag tu med pa na de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po tog gi rgyal mtshan rgyal po zhes bya ba nges ting nge 'dzin bshad de /
analyzed: 'das pa'i bskal pa dpag tu med pa na de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po tog gi rgyal mtshan rgyal po zhes bya ba nges ting nge 'dzin bshad de /
translated: In the past, innumerable eons ago, the Tathagata Indracoudrapradarshana-raja explained this samadhi.

original: chos thams cad bdag dang / srog dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shad bu la sogs pa'i byed pa pos stong pa sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu'i zla ba dang 'dra ba la 'chi ba'i dus byed pa na sems can dang srog la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba yang med la las dang 'bras bu rnam par nyams pa yang med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag dang / srog dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shad bu la sogs pa'i byed pa pos stong pa sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu'i zla ba dang 'dra ba la 'chi ba'i dus byed pa na sems can dang srog la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba yang med la las dang 'bras bu rnam par nyams pa yang med de /
translated: All dharmas are empty of a self, a life-force, a person, a human, a human being, and so forth, the creator. They are like an illusion, a mirage, a reflection, and the moon in water. When the time of death comes, there is no sentient being or life-force that goes to the next world, and there is no degeneration of karma and its result.

original: ji ltar me long gi dkyil du bzhin gyi kha dog nag po dang / dkar po dang ; thig le dang / 'dab ris la sogs pa mthong ba dang 'dra bas las dang 'bras bu'i snang ba yang sems gyi rgyud la de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar me long gi dkyil du bzhin gyi kha dog nag po dang / dkar po dang ; thig le dang / 'dab ris la sogs pa mthong ba dang 'dra bas las dang 'bras bu'i snang ba yang sems gyi rgyud la de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as the color of the face, the bindu, the lines, and so forth are seen in the center of a mirror, the appearance of karma and its result is like that in the continuum of the mind.

original: rigs pa'i tshul gyis sgo ste khyab byed du khas blangs pas skye ba dang / 'chi ba dang / 'jig rten pha rol du 'go ba dang ; byed pa po dang / spyod pa po la sogs pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i tshul gyis sgo ste khyab byed du khas blangs pas skye ba dang / 'chi ba dang / 'jig rten pha rol du 'go ba dang ; byed pa po dang / spyod pa po la sogs pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: By the method of reasoning, it is said that birth, death, transmigration to another world, the agent, the experiencer, and so on are not reasonable, because they are accepted as pervaded by the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: gang la yi ge'i tshig kyang mi dmigs pas stong pa nyid gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la yi ge'i tshig kyang mi dmigs pas stong pa nyid gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because even the words of the letters are not observed, they are empty.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub nyid na bcom ldan mkhyen //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub nyid na bcom ldan mkhyen //
translated: When the Buddha attained enlightenment, the Blessed One knew.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //🔽de lta bu'i ting nge @72a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to // de lta bu'i ting nge @72a * //
translated: This is the samādhi of suchness.

original: 'dzin bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'o //
translated: Such a samādhi was explained by the Blessed One.

original: de nas bdag gis ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas nyon mongs pa'i nad ma lus pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag gis ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas nyon mongs pa'i nad ma lus pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Then, having heard this samādhi, all the sicknesses of afflictions are completely pacified.

original: byang chub sems dpas bsgrubs pa'i nor yin te //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bsgrubs pa'i nor yin te //
translated: This is the wealth accomplished by the bodhisattvas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pas 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pas 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, by teaching the special qualities of meditative concentration, he causes those who desire the special results to engage in it.

original: de na dge slong chos smra 'dug pa dag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de na dge slong chos smra 'dug pa dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: There, the monk who was the Dharma teacher

original: der chos 'chad pa'i tshe tshul khrims kyi spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas chos 'di thos nas sangs rgyas nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: der chos 'chad pa'i tshe tshul khrims kyi spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas chos 'di thos nas sangs rgyas nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: When he was teaching the Dharma, he had perfect conduct in terms of morality. Having heard this Dharma, he generated the thought of awakening that is in accord with buddhahood.

original: de'i bsam pa mkhyen nas khyod byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa mkhyen nas khyod byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: Knowing his intention, the Dharma teacher monk made this prediction: “You should generate the thought of awakening.

original: rim gyis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas nyid du nges par 'gyur ro zhes chos smra ba'i dge slong lung bstan pa de ni gzhan ma yin gyi da nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni thams cad du ting nge
analyzed: rim gyis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas nyid du nges par 'gyur ro zhes chos smra ba'i dge slong lung bstan pa de ni gzhan ma yin gyi da nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni thams cad du ting nge
translated: Gradually, having perfected all the perfections, you will certainly attain buddhahood.” That Dharma teacher monk who made the prediction is none other than I myself. Thus, by teaching the special qualities of meditative concentration, he causes those who desire the special results to engage in it.

original: 'dzin btsal ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gcig tu brten par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽gus pas ting 'dzin thos nas rnam par bsgoms //
analyzed: 'dzin btsal ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gcig tu brten par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // gus pas ting 'dzin thos nas rnam par bsgoms //
translated: and to seek out the spiritual friend.

original: sangs rgyas gyur nas 'gro ba'i don bya zhes //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gyur nas 'gro ba'i don bya zhes //
translated: With devotion, having heard the samadhi, one should meditate on it, thinking, Having become a Buddha, I will work for the welfare of the world.

original: de ltar ba sems nas bdag gzhan don gyi blos //
analyzed: de ltar ba sems nas bdag gzhan don gyi blos //
translated: Thus, with the thought of working for the welfare of oneself and others,

original: de yi dga' 'grel don byed grags pas byas //
analyzed: de yi dga' 'grel don byed grags pas byas //
translated: the commentary on this was composed by the one known as the one who works for the welfare of others.

original: dbang po tog gi rgyal mtshan gyi rgyal po'i le'u ste nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dbang po tog gi rgyal mtshan gyi rgyal po'i le'u ste nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the twentieth chapter of the Root Tantra of Manjushri, the chapter on the king of the banner of the crest-jewel.

original: // / dmigs pa'i lta ba can gyi sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spang bar bya ba'i ched du sngon byung ba nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir//
analyzed: // / dmigs pa'i lta ba can gyi sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spang bar bya ba'i ched du sngon byung ba nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir//
translated: In order to teach the abandonment of sinful friends who have the view of objectification, the previous occurrence is taught:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One said, Young man, listen to me!

original: gzhon nu de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brel bar /
analyzed: gzhon nu de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brel bar /
translated: From Therefore, young man, up to the continuation of the previous teaching,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe sngon byung ba'i gtam gyi rgyud tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yang dag par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe sngon byung ba'i gtam gyi rgyud tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yang dag par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, spoke this verse in a melodious voice, the story of the past:

original: de dag nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just those,

original: sngon byung 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba 'dir //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sngon byung 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba 'dir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the past, in this world called Jambudvīpa,

original: sngon byung ba 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir tshong dpon gyi khye'u gnyis byung ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir tshong dpon gyi khye'u gnyis byung ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the past, in this Jambudvīpa, two sons of a merchant appeared.

original: tshong dpon gyi khye'u gnyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi khye'u gnyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung bar gyur to //
translated: The two sons of the merchant went forth in the doctrine of the Tathāgata.

original: rab tu byung @72b nas kyang 'dzin pa thams cad rnam par spangs nas bse ru ltar bsam gtan dang rjes su mthun pa'i nags su gnas nas bsam gtan gyi dga' ba dang / bde ba nyams su myong nas rdzu 'phrul dang ldan zhing bsam gtan thob par gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu byung @72b nas kyang 'dzin pa thams cad rnam par spangs nas bse ru ltar bsam gtan dang rjes su mthun pa'i nags su gnas nas bsam gtan gyi dga' ba dang / bde ba nyams su myong nas rdzu 'phrul dang ldan zhing bsam gtan thob par gyur te /
translated: Having gone forth, having abandoned all grasping, like rhinoceroses, they dwelt in forests suitable for concentration, experienced the joy and bliss of concentration, and became endowed with miraculous powers and attained concentration.

original: sems can rnams kyi dbang po dang bsam ba rnam par shes nas phan tshun chos kyi 'brel pa'i gtam byed cing gnas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbang po dang bsam ba rnam par shes nas phan tshun chos kyi 'brel pa'i gtam byed cing gnas so //
translated: Having understood the faculties and thoughts of sentient beings, they converse with each other about the Dharma and abide.

original: de nas rgyal po stobs dang bcas pa ri dags shor du song ba las /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po stobs dang bcas pa ri dags shor du song ba las /
translated: Then, the king, together with his army, went hunting.

original: de dag dang nye ba'i dgon par song ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang nye ba'i dgon par song ngo //
translated: They went to a nearby forest.

original: mi'i bdag pos de dag mthong nas rab tu dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: mi'i bdag pos de dag mthong nas rab tu dga' ba skyes so //
translated: The lord of men, having seen them, gave rise to great joy.

original: mngon par phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug pa dang / de'i bsam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtam rgyal po de la smras pa rgyal rigs nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon par phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug pa dang / de'i bsam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtam rgyal po de la smras pa rgyal rigs nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: After prostrating, he sat in front of them, and they spoke to the king in a way that was in accord with his thoughts. They said, Listen, Kshatriya! and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mchog tu rnyed par dka'i //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mchog tu rnyed par dka'i //
translated: The arising of the Buddha is extremely difficult to find.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni shin tu dkon pa yin pas de'i phyir bag yod par gyur pas chos bsrung ba la 'bad par gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni shin tu dkon pa yin pas de'i phyir bag yod par gyur pas chos bsrung ba la 'bad par gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: the arising of the Buddha is extremely rare, therefore, through becoming heedful, strive to protect the Dharma.

original: tshe 'di ri'i chu bo bzhin du myur du 'gro zhing mi gnas pa bzhin du na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde bas nye bar gtses pa de'i tshe chos ma gtogs pa'i skyabs gzhan med do //
analyzed: tshe 'di ri'i chu bo bzhin du myur du 'gro zhing mi gnas pa bzhin du na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde bas nye bar gtses pa de'i tshe chos ma gtogs pa'i skyabs gzhan med do //
translated: When you are afflicted by sickness, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and despair, there is no refuge other than the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir chos skyong bar gyur pas phyi ma'i dus shin du 'jigs su rung ba de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'jig pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos skyong bar gyur pas phyi ma'i dus shin du 'jigs su rung ba de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'jig pa na /
translated: Therefore, you who are the protectors of the Dharma, at that time in the future, when the teachings of the Tathāgata are being destroyed,🔽you must do whatever you can to prevent their destruction.”

original: ji ltar 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ltar mdzod cig / ces de dag gi rnam pa mang pos mi'i bdag po la gdams so ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ltar mdzod cig / ces de dag gi rnam pa mang pos mi'i bdag po la gdams so ;
translated: In this way, they gave him much advice.

original: / de nas gdams ngag thos pas dga' ba dang yid bde ba skyes nas de dag gi rkang pa la mngon par phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: / de nas gdams ngag thos pas dga' ba dang yid bde ba skyes nas de dag gi rkang pa la mngon par phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: Then, having heard this advice, the king was filled with joy and happiness. He bowed down at their feet

original: rang gi pho brang du song ngo //
analyzed: rang gi pho brang du song ngo //
translated: and returned to his palace.

original: gzhan dmigs ba'i lta bas shin tu g-yen spyo ba'i dge slong mang po //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs ba'i lta bas shin tu g-yen spyo ba'i dge slong mang po //
translated: and many monks who were very much despised by the view of others.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa rnams /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa rnams /
translated: They were greedy for gain and honor.

original: de'i khab tu zhugs pa dang ; de dag gi dbang po ma bsdams par mthong nas /
analyzed: de'i khab tu zhugs pa dang ; de dag gi dbang po ma bsdams par mthong nas /
translated: When they entered the king’s palace, he saw that their senses were uncontrolled.

analyzed: mi'i bdag po des de dag la gus par ma byas so //
translated: So the king did not respect them.

original: de nas dge slong mang po brkam zhing chags //
analyzed: de nas dge slong mang po brkam zhing chags //
translated: Then many greedy and attached monks

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: said this:

analyzed: shin tu brkam pa chags pa can /
translated: “These greedy and attached

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las nyams pa de dag gis mi'i bdag po de @73a * //
translated: ones, who have fallen from the teachings of the Tathāgata, have made the king

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: have a wrong view.

original: chos smra ba gnyis po 'di ni chad par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: chos smra ba gnyis po 'di ni chad par lta ba yin te /
translated: These two Dharma teachers have a view of annihilation,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston pa yang ma yin la /
translated: and they do not teach the path to nirvāṇa.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ston par 'dod pas /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ston par 'dod pas /
translated: They want to teach the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang med la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang med la /
translated: and they say that there is no virtuous or nonvirtuous karma.

original: de med pas ;
analyzed: de med pas ;
translated: Since that does not exist,

original: mtho ris dang / ngan song la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyang ring ba nyid du spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtho ris dang / ngan song la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyang ring ba nyid du spangs pa yin no //
translated: The result of the deed, whether it be heaven or a bad destiny, is far away.

original: gal te ma bsad na yang yul gzhan du spangs shig //
analyzed: gal te ma bsad na yang yul gzhan du spangs shig //
translated: If you do not kill your mother, you will be banished to another country.

original: de ltar gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ring du gnas par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ring du gnas par 'gyur ro // zhes zer ro //
translated: In this way, the teaching of the Tathāgata will last a long time.”

original: de dag gi tshig gis mi'i bdag po the tshom skyes shing bsad pa'i bsam pa yang byung ba dang mi'i bdag po de la rtag tu rjes su 'brel ba'i lha zhig yod pas mi'i bdag po 'di lta bu'i sems ma skyed cig / sdig pa'i grogs po'i tshig
analyzed: de dag gi tshig gis mi'i bdag po the tshom skyes shing bsad pa'i bsam pa yang byung ba dang mi'i bdag po de la rtag tu rjes su 'brel ba'i lha zhig yod pas mi'i bdag po 'di lta bu'i sems ma skyed cig / sdig pa'i grogs po'i tshig
translated: The king was torn by these words. He was ready to kill his mother, when a god who was bound to him by a vow of friendship said to him, “Do not give in to the words of these evil friends.

original: gis sdig pa'i sems ma skyed cing //
analyzed: gis sdig pa'i sems ma skyed cing //
translated: Do not give in to this evil thought.

original: ces bskul ba dang / rgyal po de lha'i tshig gis bskul bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las mi g-yo ba'i dran pa yang byung ngo //
analyzed: ces bskul ba dang / rgyal po de lha'i tshig gis bskul bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las mi g-yo ba'i dran pa yang byung ngo //
translated: ” The king, urged by the god, remembered the teaching of the Tathāgata and did not waver.

original: de'i spun zla dge slong de dag gis log par 'dzin du bcug pas bsad par bya'o snyam nas de stobs dang bzhon pa dang bcas par gang na chos smra ba gnyis gnas pa der phyin pa dang / nags de na rtag tu gnas pa'i lha dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa rnams kyis so phag gi char phab pas so phag gi char gyis phye mar byas nas mnar med par song bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i spun zla dge slong de dag gis log par 'dzin du bcug pas bsad par bya'o snyam nas de stobs dang bzhon pa dang bcas par gang na chos smra ba gnyis gnas pa der phyin pa dang / nags de na rtag tu gnas pa'i lha dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa rnams kyis so phag gi char phab pas so phag gi char gyis phye mar byas nas mnar med par song bar gyur to //
translated: The gods, yakshas, and so forth who always lived in that forest caused a rain of bricks to fall, and the two Dharma teachers were ground to dust by the rain of bricks and went to Avici Hell.

original: dge slong mang po de dag kyang dmyal bar song bar gyur to //
analyzed: dge slong mang po de dag kyang dmyal bar song bar gyur to //
translated: Those many monks also went to hell.

original: de lta bas na chos zab mo spang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos zab mo spang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the profound Dharma should not be abandoned.

original: dmyal bar 'gro bas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dmyal bar 'gro bas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of the fear of going to hell.

original: gzhon nu khye'u mchog gnyis po byung ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid ston to //
analyzed: gzhon nu khye'u mchog gnyis po byung ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid ston to //
translated: This is also taught by the two youths, the best of men, who appeared, and so on.

original: chos smra ba gnyis po de gzhan yin par mi ba lta ste /
analyzed: chos smra ba gnyis po de gzhan yin par mi ba lta ste /
translated: Those two Dharma teachers were not others.

original: 'on kyang gcig ni de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig ni de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad yin no //
translated: But the first was the Tathagata Dipankara.

original: gnyis pa ni nga yin no ;
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nga yin no ;
translated: The second was myself.

original: / rgyal po de ni byams pa yin no //
analyzed: / rgyal po de ni byams pa yin no //
translated: The king was Maitreya.

original: lha mo de ni zla 'od yin no //
analyzed: lha mo de ni zla 'od yin no //
translated: The goddess was Candraprabha.

original: de'i nu bo de ni lha sbyin yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nu bo de ni lha sbyin yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: His younger brother was Devadatta.

original: rmongs pa'i dra ba ma lus nyes pa'i gzhi //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i dra ba ma lus nyes pa'i gzhi //
translated: The entire net of delusion is the basis of faults.

original: bdag med rdo rjes rnam par brtags pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag med rdo rjes rnam par brtags pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the analysis with the vajra of selflessness,

original: 'jig rten bde gshegs sras su 'gro gyis la //
analyzed: 'jig rten bde gshegs sras su 'gro gyis la //
translated: the world becomes a son of the Sugata.

original: de nas nyes @73b bral thub pa'i dbang por gyur //
analyzed: de nas nyes @73b bral thub pa'i dbang por gyur //
translated: Then, free of faults, he becomes the Lord of Sages.

original: sngon byung ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sngon byung ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the twenty-first chapter is finished.

original: // / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku'o zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku'o zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that the Tathagata is the Dharma Body,

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Then the Blessed One... and so on.

original: byis ba rnams ni rtag tu chags byed de //
analyzed: byis ba rnams ni rtag tu chags byed de //
translated: The childish are always attached...

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: phyi dang nang rang gi rang bzhin can gyi lus la mngon par zhen par byas nas byis pa rnams phan pa dang / mi phan pa la yongs su rtog par mi bzod pa g-yo ba'i srog dang bde ba la mngon par zhen pas sdig pa byas nas dmyal bar nges par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽gang yang mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba de dag ni bdud dag las rgyal nas byang chub kyi shing chen po'i rtsa bar /
analyzed: phyi dang nang rang gi rang bzhin can gyi lus la mngon par zhen par byas nas byis pa rnams phan pa dang / mi phan pa la yongs su rtog par mi bzod pa g-yo ba'i srog dang bde ba la mngon par zhen pas sdig pa byas nas dmyal bar nges par 'gro bar 'gyur ro // gang yang mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba de dag ni bdud dag las rgyal nas byang chub kyi shing chen po'i rtsa bar /
translated: Having conceived of the body as having an inner and outer nature, the childish are unable to investigate what is beneficial and what is not. They commit evil deeds out of attachment to the fickle life force and happiness, and are certain to go to hell.

original: rab tu sad pas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu sad pas byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those who are free from attachment conquer the demons and awaken to perfect buddhahood at the foot of the great tree of awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs kyi skur mi blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs kyi skur mi blta'o //
translated: One should not view the Tathāgata as a form body.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs kyi skus mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skus mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin la /
translated: He is fully awakened as a form body,

original: de'i phyir sku gang gis mngon par sangs rgyas pa de nyid skur blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i the tshom yongs su spong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sku gang gis mngon par sangs rgyas pa de nyid skur blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i the tshom yongs su spong bar byed pa ste /
translated: Therefore, one should view that very body by which he manifestly became a Buddha as the body of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi skus bsgos pa ni gzugs kyi sku yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi skus bsgos pa ni gzugs kyi sku yin la /
translated: The body of form is imbued with the body of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sku ni gzugs kyi skus bsgos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni gzugs kyi skus bsgos pa ma yin te /
translated: The body of the Dharma is not imbued with the body of form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung /
translated: Whether the Tathagatas arise or do not arise,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas so //
translated: the reality of dharmas remains just as it is.

original: gzhon du de la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la smon par 'dod pa dang shes par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gzhon du de la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la smon par 'dod pa dang shes par 'dod pas /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva who wishes to aspire to and understand the body of the Tathagata🔽should take up this very meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid gzung bar bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid ting nge 'dzin 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid gzung bar bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid ting nge 'dzin 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that this meditative concentration is the essence of the body of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni bsod nams brgyas bsgrubs pa'o zhes bstan pa ni gzugs kyi sku zhal gyis bzhes nas gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni bsod nams brgyas bsgrubs pa'o zhes bstan pa ni gzugs kyi sku zhal gyis bzhes nas gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar /
translated: The statement “the body of the Tathāgata is established by a hundred merits” is said by accepting the form body.

original: bsod nams brgya pa las skyes pa'i blo dang don gcig tu bstan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsod nams brgya pa las skyes pa'i blo dang don gcig tu bstan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said that “the meaning is taught as being the same as the mind born from a hundred merits.”

original: bsod nams brgya pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu las byung ba'i chos kyi skus bskyed pas na bsod nams brgyas bsgrubs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bsod nams brgya pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu las byung ba'i chos kyi skus bskyed pas na bsod nams brgyas bsgrubs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The Dharma body that arises from the cause characterized by a hundred merits is called “established by a hundred merits.”

original: don dam @74a * //
analyzed: don dam @74a * //
translated: The ultimate

original: pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: is free from all characteristics because it is without signs.

original: zab pa ni dmigs pa'i lta ba can rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab pa ni dmigs pa'i lta ba can rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is profound because it is difficult to realize for those who have the view of an object.

original: tshad med pa ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshad mas rtogs par byar med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: tshad med pa ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshad mas rtogs par byar med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It is immeasurable because it is not realized by the valid cognitions of direct perception, inference, and scripture.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang gi mtshan ma yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang gi mtshan ma yang med pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of signlessness is the absence of its own sign.

original: mtshan ma thams cad rnam par bsgom pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thams cad rab tu bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad rnam par bsgom pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thams cad rab tu bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: The thorough cultivation of all signs is the thorough cultivation of all perfections and so forth.

original: mi g-yo ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis thams cad du nges par gnas pa nyid dang / shin tu nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis thams cad du nges par gnas pa nyid dang / shin tu nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Immobility is the thorough stability of all through the nature of nonabiding nirvana and the nature of space.

original: mig lnga'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa ni mthong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mig lnga'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa ni mthong ba med pa'o //
translated: The transcendence of the domain of the five eyes is nonseeing.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid ni chos kyi skur rab tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid ni chos kyi skur rab tu shes par bya ste /
translated: The nature of suchness and the perfect end should be known as the dharma body,

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
translated: through the yoga of nonattachment.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni sems kyi sa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang / rnam par spros pa thams cad nges par bral ba'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pas mngon par mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni sems kyi sa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang / rnam par spros pa thams cad nges par bral ba'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pas mngon par mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Inconceivable means that it is not moved by pleasure, pain, etc. because it is beyond the stage of mind and is definitely free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: gnas med pa ni gzung ba'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas med pa ni gzung ba'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Without abode means that it is not the abode of the apprehended.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la smon par 'dod pa rnams kyi sgra las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab la zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la smon par 'dod pa rnams kyi sgra las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab la zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: For those who wish to aspire to the wisdom of the Buddha, it is said to be beyond sound, one should not cling to wisdom that follows after sound.

original: so sor rang gi rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rang gi rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is individually self cognized.

original: snying po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: snying po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: The essence is free from the nature of the stains of desire and so on.

original: dbyer mi phyed pa ni zhe sdang gi mtshon chas so //
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa ni zhe sdang gi mtshon chas so //
translated: It is indivisible by the weapon of hatred.

original: brtan pa ni gti mug gi rlung gi sa mi bskyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtan pa ni gti mug gi rlung gi sa mi bskyod pa nyid do //
translated: It is stable because it is unshaken by the wind of delusion.

original: 'o na ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it to be accomplished?

original: stong pa nyid du bstan pas nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du bstan pas nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of emptiness is called the definitive teaching.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i sgras ni chos kyi sku ston par byed pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i sgras ni chos kyi sku ston par byed pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The term “emptiness” should be understood to teach the Dharma Body.

original: ma skyes pas ni chos kyi sku skyed par byed pa'i rgyu med pas skye ba las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pas ni chos kyi sku skyed par byed pa'i rgyu med pas skye ba las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
translated: Since it is unborn, it is beyond origination, because there is no cause for the origination of the Dharma Body.

original: rtag pa ni tha snyad tsam du mi 'gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa ni tha snyad tsam du mi 'gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid do //
translated: It is permanent, because it is permanent in the sense of not changing, even conventionally.

original: bye brag med pa ni 'jig rten la bsgrub pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes sgra'i sbyor ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bye brag med pa ni 'jig rten la bsgrub pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes sgra'i sbyor ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is undifferentiated, because the term “nirvana” is used to indicate that it is not differentiated in the world.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i bye brag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i bye brag med pa nyid do //
translated: It is undifferentiated in nirvana, because there is no differentiation of the nirvana of the Buddhas, the nirvana of the Disciples, and the nirvana of the Solitary Sages.

original: sgras mya ngan las 'das @74b pa ni sgras brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: sgras mya ngan las 'das @74b pa ni sgras brjod du med pa'o //
translated: It is inexpressible, because it is inexpressible by speech.

original: dbyangs kyis zhi ba ni brag ca'i sgra dang dra bar brjod pa dang / brjod bya'i rnam par rtog pa zhi bas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dbyangs kyis zhi ba ni brag ca'i sgra dang dra bar brjod pa dang / brjod bya'i rnam par rtog pa zhi bas zhi ba'o //
translated: The peace of sound is peace because of the pacification of the sound of an echo, of the sound of a stringed instrument, and of the conceptualization of the object.

original: tha mal pa'i sgras ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / gnyi ga yang rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid kyi phyir brda ste /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i sgras ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / gnyi ga yang rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid kyi phyir brda ste /
translated: The ordinary sound is a conventional symbol because of the mere conceptualization of both entity and non-entity.

original: brda de brda tsam gyis thams cad du tha snyad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: brda de brda tsam gyis thams cad du tha snyad du byed pa'o //
translated: That conventional symbol is a conventional symbol in all cases by means of the mere conventional symbol.

original: don dam pa ni ji lta ba'i tshig gis bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni ji lta ba'i tshig gis bstan par bya ste /
translated: The ultimate is to be taught by means of the words of the way things really are.

original: yang dag pa dang / bden pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang / bden pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / don dam pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: It is a synonym for the real, the truth, thusness, and the ultimate.

original: bsil ba dang yongs su gdung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i tsha ba'i yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsil ba dang yongs su gdung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i tsha ba'i yongs su gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The coolth and the absence of burning are because of the absence of the burning of the heat of the afflictions.

original: smad du med pa ni gang gis kyang smad du med pa de'i phyir smad du med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smad du med pa ni gang gis kyang smad du med pa de'i phyir smad du med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of blame is because of the absence of blame by anyone. Therefore, it is called the absence of blame.

original: kha dog bstan pas mu med pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan brjod pa la mtha' med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog bstan pas mu med pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan brjod pa la mtha' med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression the teaching of the color is the infinite means that the praise of the qualities is endless.

original: gzhon nu de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang / ma bcos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhon nu de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang / ma bcos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Young man, that is called the Tathagata's body means the essence and the unfabricated.

original: sku 'di nyid kyi khyad par tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sku 'di nyid kyi khyad par tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the special qualities of this very body through the melody of verse, it is said:

original: 'di 'dra'i 'jig rten mgon po'i sku //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i 'jig rten mgon po'i sku //
translated: The body of such a Lord of the World...
