original: gnyi ga'i 'du shes rab tu spangs pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du chos kyi sku las gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la skal pa ci lta ba bzhin du don sgrub par byed pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma dang las kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di lta bu'o zhes shes par nus pa ma yin no //

translated: The consecration by the analytical knowledges is meditative concentration.🔽The consecration by meditative concentration is Buddha enlightenment.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis yang dag par bsgos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub po zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis yang dag par bsgos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub po zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this,🔽the Bhagavat said,

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then the Bhagavat, having understood the thoughts of those bodhisattvas, etc.

original: gzhon nu @76b de lta bas na bdag gis so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: gzhon nu @76b de lta bas na bdag gis so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la //
translated: Prince, therefore, one who desires to manifest the four right discriminations should...

original: gzhon nu byang chub sems dpa' des ting nge 'dzin 'di gzung bar bya zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhon nu byang chub sems dpa' des ting nge 'dzin 'di gzung bar bya zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Prince, that bodhisattva should take up this meditative absorption.

original: gang gi phyir nye bar bstan par bya ba nyid ni don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar bstan par bya ba nyid ni don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Because the very thing that is to be taught is the right discrimination of meaning, the right discrimination of phenomena, the right discrimination of eloquence, and the right discrimination of expression.

original: gzhon nu de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhon nu de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: Prince, what is the right discrimination of phenomena?

original: mdor ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du ma bshad kyi chos la don nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du ma bshad kyi chos la don nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not explained in detail just as it is taught in brief, in order to accomplish the meaning of the Dharma through practice.🔽 🔽Prince, what is the right discrimination of meaning?

original: ji srid gzugs kyi tha snyad yod pa de srid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa yang de snyed do zhes bya ba la ming dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad dang / sgra 'jug pa zhes bya ba bye brag go zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid gzugs kyi tha snyad yod pa de srid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa yang de snyed do zhes bya ba la ming dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad dang / sgra 'jug pa zhes bya ba bye brag go zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The distinctions are called name, designation, convention, and verbal expression.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, with regard to feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: the conventions of feeling, etc., are also inconceivable.🔽Similarly, the convention of praising the Tathāgata is also like that.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa'i tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni ngag gi brjod pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa'i tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni ngag gi brjod pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The body of the Tathāgata is beyond the domain of verbal expression.

original: gzhon nu de ltar 'dus byas la yang nyes pa grangs med /
analyzed: gzhon nu de ltar 'dus byas la yang nyes pa grangs med /
translated: Young man, in that way, there are countless faults in conditioned things.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang phan yon grangs med de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang phan yon grangs med de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And also the benefits of nirvana are innumerable. This is the meaning of the expression “praise of the Tathagata.”

original: gang gi phyir 'du byed brjod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'du byed brjod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the expression of compounded things is inconceivable.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa'i bsam pa yongs su shes pas 'dus byas pa'i 'du byed kyi brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa'i bsam pa yongs su shes pas 'dus byas pa'i 'du byed kyi brjod pa nyid do //
translated: The expression of compounded things is the knowledge of the thoughts of innumerable sentient beings.

original: dbyangs brjod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i gsung ni bsam du mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: dbyangs brjod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i gsung ni bsam du mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes byas nas so //
translated: The expression of melody is inconceivable because the voice endowed with sixty aspects is inconceivable.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni kun nas nyon mongs bsgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sgra bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni kun nas nyon mongs bsgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sgra bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do //
translated: The expression of defilement is inconceivable because the expression of the sound that arises from the application that accomplishes defilement is inconceivable.

original: rnam par byang ba brjod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba brjod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The expression of purification is inconceivable.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa bshad pa yang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa bshad pa yang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The causes of defilement, such as passion, are also the causes of purification,

original: thabs kyi khyad par la 'jug pa'o zhes brjod pas rnam par byang @77a * //
analyzed: thabs kyi khyad par la 'jug pa'o zhes brjod pas rnam par byang @77a * //
translated: because they are engaged in the special method.

original: pa'i dgongs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu ston to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i dgongs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu ston to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it shows the inconceivable intention of purification.

original: gzhon nu de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa brjod pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa brjod pa bzhi'o //
translated: Prince, these are the four inconceivable praises of the Tathagata.

original: zhes bya ba ni yon tan ston pa'i rnam pa grangs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yon tan ston pa'i rnam pa grangs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the aspects of teaching the qualities are enumerated.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab par bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught as inconceivable.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid bzhi pa sgrub pa lnga bcu rtsa bdun gyis rgya cher bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid bzhi pa sgrub pa lnga bcu rtsa bdun gyis rgya cher bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that those very four are to be taught extensively by the fifty-seven practices.

original: da ni rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the divisions, it says:

original: gzhon nu 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhon nu 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Prince, these are the four modes of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'du byed kyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'du byed yongs su shes pa sngon du 'gro bas sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das par 'khrid par byed pas 'du byed kyi tshul gyi lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'du byed yongs su shes pa sngon du 'gro bas sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das par 'khrid par byed pas 'du byed kyi tshul gyi lam zhes bya ste /
translated: The inconceivable mode of compositional activity is called the path of the mode of compositional activity because it leads sentient beings to nirvana through the prior understanding of compositional activity.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan gyis bsam par mi nus pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan gyis bsam par mi nus pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Since no one but a tathagata can conceive of it, it is inconceivable.

original: 'du byed yongs su bshad pa'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed yongs su bshad pa'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la /
translated: The inconceivable mode of teaching compositional activity.

original: chos bstan pa'i tshul ni yongs su bshad pa'i tshul te /
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i tshul ni yongs su bshad pa'i tshul te /
translated: The mode of teaching the Dharma is the mode of teaching.

original: 'du byed ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yongs su bstan pas khyad par gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir chos ston pa ni yongs su bshad pa'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yongs su bstan pas khyad par gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir chos ston pa ni yongs su bshad pa'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is taught in accordance with the way compositional activity exists, the teaching of the Dharma is called the inconceivable mode of teaching because it is established by its special qualities.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is like the previous one.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pas spang bar bya ba ci lta ba bzhin du spong bar byed pa de rab tu ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par gyi tshul lo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pas spang bar bya ba ci lta ba bzhin du spong bar byed pa de rab tu ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par gyi tshul lo //
translated: The inconceivable method of defilement refers to the method of the special means for demonstrating the abandonment of the defilements of moral defilement, action and rebirth, just as they are, by means of correct view etc.

original: rnam par byang ba'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i tshul ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i tshul ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
translated: The inconceivable method of purification refers to the method of the path of liberation.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du mnyam par rtogs pa nyid ni grol ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du mnyam par rtogs pa nyid ni grol ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the realization of the sameness of all dharmas in their selflessness.

original: der thabs du mas 'dren cing khyer bar byed pas na tshul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der thabs du mas 'dren cing khyer bar byed pas na tshul zhes bya'o //
translated: It is described as a method since it leads to and conveys one to that.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni snga ma bzhin no ;
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni snga ma bzhin no ;
translated: Inconceivable is as before.

original: / rigs pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / rigs pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are four kinds of reasoning.

original: rigs pa ni rjes su dpag ba ste 'dus byas kyi dngos po la rigs pa 'jug gi /'dus ma byas la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ni rjes su dpag ba ste 'dus byas kyi dngos po la rigs pa 'jug gi /'dus ma byas la ni ma yin no //
translated: Reasoning is inference. It is applied to conditioned things, but not to the unconditioned.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bsam pa dang yongs su bshad pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bsam pa dang yongs su bshad pa 'jug ste /
translated: In this regard, the intention of defilement and purification is applied,

original: rjes su dpag pa dang / @77b mngon sum dang / lung la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug gi 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang / @77b mngon sum dang / lung la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug gi 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no //
translated: as well as the intention of inference, direct perception, scriptural tradition, etc. But the unconditioned is not so.

original: thams cad du 'du byed kyi yon tan dang / skyon bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir rgol ba la sogs pa'i tshig nas nye bar bzung nas sgor 'jug pa'i thabs ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'du byed kyi yon tan dang / skyon bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir rgol ba la sogs pa'i tshig nas nye bar bzung nas sgor 'jug pa'i thabs ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: In all cases, the four methods of entry into the gateway are established in order to demonstrate the inconceivable qualities and faults of the conditioned.

original: nges par bstan pa ni bshad pa'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: nges par bstan pa ni bshad pa'i bye brag yin te /
translated: The teaching is a particular kind of explanation.

original: 'du byed dang / yongs su bshad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang bzhi po thams cad du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / yongs su bshad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang bzhi po thams cad du bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained in all four parts: the conditioned, the explanation, defilement and purification.

original: sgra ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ni brjod pa'o //
translated: Sound is expression.

original: tshig gi lam ni dgongs pa can gyi tshig go //
analyzed: tshig gi lam ni dgongs pa can gyi tshig go //
translated: The path of words is the words of the intention.

original: dgongs te bshad pa bzhi ni sems can la dgongs pa dang / chos nyid la dgongs pa dang / bstan pa la dgongs pa dang / dus la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs te bshad pa bzhi ni sems can la dgongs pa dang / chos nyid la dgongs pa dang / bstan pa la dgongs pa dang / dus la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of intentional hints are: hints concerning the disciples, hints concerning the nature of things, hints concerning another point, and hints concerning another time.

original: lha la nges par rtog pa bzhi la ni /
analyzed: lha la nges par rtog pa bzhi la ni /
translated: The four kinds of discernment are:

original: rnam par dag pa'i lha la rtog pa dang / zag pa med pa'i lha la rtog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lha la rtog pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lha la rtog pa dang / zag pa med pa'i lha la rtog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lha la rtog pa'o ;
translated: discernment of the pure deity, discernment of the immaculate deity, and discernment of the bodhisattva deity.

original: / nges par bsams nas rtog pa ni nges par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: / nges par bsams nas rtog pa ni nges par rtog pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the discernment of the deity that is to be meditated upon.

original: mi'i lus thob pa la dmigs nas khyad par can gyi dge ba'i las la kun tu spyod pa ni mi la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi'i lus thob pa la dmigs nas khyad par can gyi dge ba'i las la kun tu spyod pa ni mi la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Discernment of the human refers to the practice of special virtuous actions by one who has obtained a human body.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni ming tsam mo zhes rtog pa ni ming la nges par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni ming tsam mo zhes rtog pa ni ming la nges par rtog pa'o //
translated: Discernment of the name is the discernment that all these are mere names.

original: rtog pa'i bye brag gis 'jug par bya ba la zhugs pas gong nas gong du shin tu 'das pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'i bye brag gis 'jug par bya ba la zhugs pas gong nas gong du shin tu 'das pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Discernment of the object refers to the discernment of the object of engagement, which is engaged through the distinctions of discernment, and which is distinguished as superior and more superior.

original: rdo rje'i tshig ni mi phyed pa'i gnas la rab tu gnas pas na rdo rje'i tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig ni mi phyed pa'i gnas la rab tu gnas pas na rdo rje'i tshig go //
translated: The vajra words are the vajra words because they are well-established in the indestructible stage.

original: yi ge aom dang sv'a h'a la sogs pa gang dag gis gros su byed cing rab tu sad par byed pas lha mngon du phyogs par byed pas sngags kyi tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge aom dang sv'a h'a la sogs pa gang dag gis gros su byed cing rab tu sad par byed pas lha mngon du phyogs par byed pas sngags kyi tshig ces bya'o //
translated: The mantra words are so called because they are the words by which the gods are made to face, i.e. are summoned and awakened, by means of the syllables Om, Svâhâ, etc.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa ni sdud pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa ni sdud pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: The Vinaya is the establishment of the collection, i.e. of generosity, etc.

original: sdig pa ni spong ste rims nad byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sdig pa ni spong ste rims nad byang ba bzhin no //
translated: The Abhidharma is the abandonment of evil, like the healing of an illness.

original: mdor bstan pas na mdo sde ste /
analyzed: mdor bstan pas na mdo sde ste /
translated: The Sûtras are so called because they are taught in brief.

original: bsdus te bshad pas don rgyas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus te bshad pas don rgyas par ston pa'o //
translated: The Abhidharmas are so called because they teach the meaning extensively by means of a detailed explanation.

original: mdo sde'i mtha' ni mdo sde ma lus pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdo sde'i mtha' ni mdo sde ma lus pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The limit of the Sûtras is the final limit of all the Sûtras.

original: mdo sde mthar thug pa'i gnas ni thabs zab mo zab mo'i gnas su gyur pa'am don yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo sde mthar thug pa'i gnas ni thabs zab mo zab mo'i gnas su gyur pa'am don yang rung ba'o //
translated: The abode of the limit of the Sûtras is the abode of the profound, profound means, or the meaning.

original: gdags par bya ba la btags pa ni tha snyad kyis nges par rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: gdags par bya ba la btags pa ni tha snyad kyis nges par rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'o //
translated: The designation of the designable is the establishment of the designation by means of conventional expression.

original: snang ba rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i tshig ni snang ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i tshig ni snang ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: The words that accomplish the manifestation are called the words of manifestation.

original: ye shes gsal bar byed pas ni @78a * //
analyzed: ye shes gsal bar byed pas ni @78a * //
translated: Because it illuminates pristine wisdom,

original: gsal ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: it is called the word of illumination.

original: spyod pa'i khyad par rab tu bsgrub pa'i tshig ni spyod pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i khyad par rab tu bsgrub pa'i tshig ni spyod pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: The words that accomplish the special practice are called the words of practice.

original: spyod pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Practice is the engagement in generosity and so forth.

original: de rab tu sgrub par byed pa ni ngag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rab tu sgrub par byed pa ni ngag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The accomplishment of that is the nature of speech.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni tshig go //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni tshig go //
translated: The collection of letters is the word.

original: tshig gi tshogs ni ngag go zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs ni ngag go zhes bya bas so //
translated: The collection of words is speech.

original: bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshig rnams shes par dka' bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshig rnams shes par dka' bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Because the words of various thoughts are difficult to know, they are called inconceivable words.

original: sngon gyi mtha'i dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus med par rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i tshig ni mtha' yas pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus med par rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i tshig ni mtha' yas pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words that accomplish the infinite, which is without a prior limit, without a later limit, and without a middle, are called the infinite words.

original: su yang gang nas kyang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / rgyu ba med pa ni rgyu ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: su yang gang nas kyang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / rgyu ba med pa ni rgyu ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “No one goes or comes or moves anywhere” means “no movement.”

original: yongs su ni kun du'o //
analyzed: yongs su ni kun du'o //
translated: “Everywhere” means “in every way.”

original: de ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: de ni mtha' ste /
translated: “That” refers to the extreme.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The extreme is characterized by eternalism and nihilism.

original: gang la de dag med pa de ni mtha'o //
analyzed: gang la de dag med pa de ni mtha'o //
translated: That which is free from those is the extreme.

original: de rjod par byed pa'i tshig de dag ni mu med pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa'i tshig de dag ni mu med pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: The words that express that are called “inexpressible words.”

original: 'dra bar gyur pa'i chos med pas na yon tan la sogs pa gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dra bar gyur pa'i chos med pas na yon tan la sogs pa gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Since there are no phenomena that are similar, qualities and so on cannot be measured. Therefore, they are called “immeasurable words.”

original: bgrang bar bya ba med pas grangs kyang med de yul med pa'i phyir des na grangs med pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: bgrang bar bya ba med pas grangs kyang med de yul med pa'i phyir des na grangs med pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Since there is nothing to be counted, there is no number. Since there is no object, they are called “numberless words.”

original: tshad mas yongs su gcad par bya ba ni gzhal bya yin na tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir tshad med pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshad mas yongs su gcad par bya ba ni gzhal bya yin na tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir tshad med pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: Since the object of valid cognition is what is to be measured, and since they are not the object of valid cognition, they are called “incalculable words.”

original: shes pa'i dmigs pa ni shes pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i dmigs pa ni shes pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The object of consciousness is the word of consciousness.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste yul med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste yul med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is non-apprehensible, i.e. because it is non-existent as an object.

original: shes pa bsags pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kun nas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa bsags pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kun nas bsdus pa ste /
translated: The accumulation of cognition is the collection of merit and knowledge.

original: byang chub kyi sems nas brtsams te sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du yang dag par bsags pas na bsags pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nas brtsams te sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du yang dag par bsags pas na bsags pa'o //
translated: It is an accumulation because it is a true accumulation from the generation of the resolve for enlightenment up until Buddhahood.

original: shes pa'i rigs pa ni shes pa skye ba'i gnas te thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i mngon sum du byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rigs pa ni shes pa skye ba'i gnas te thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i mngon sum du byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: The basis of cognition is the cause for the realization of cognition through listening, reflection and meditative development.

original: sngon yongs su myong ba'i dpag tu med pa'i don rnams bsags pa snang ba ni spobs pa bsags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon yongs su myong ba'i dpag tu med pa'i don rnams bsags pa snang ba ni spobs pa bsags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The accumulation of eloquence is the appearance of the accumulation of immeasurable meanings experienced previously.

original: mdo sde ma lus pa bsdus shing bsags pa ni mdo sde'o //
analyzed: mdo sde ma lus pa bsdus shing bsags pa ni mdo sde'o //
translated: The sūtra is the collection and accumulation of all the sūtras.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde dang nges @78b pa'i don gyi mdo sdes bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde dang nges @78b pa'i don gyi mdo sdes bsdus pa dang /
translated: The mundane, the supramundane, the contaminated, the uncontaminated, and the supramundane are also included in the sutras of provisional meaning and the sutras of definitive meaning.

original: bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i gsang sngags thos pa ni mang du thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i gsang sngags thos pa ni mang du thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mantra that is differentiated by the divisions of action, conduct, yoga, and so on, is called the one who hears much.

original: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams ni nor bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams ni nor bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Morality, hearing, wisdom, and samadhi are called the four jewels.

original: bslab pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bslab pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four trainings:

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i shes rab dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / mi dge ba thams cad spangs pa'i sdom pa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i shes rab dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / mi dge ba thams cad spangs pa'i sdom pa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: The training of superior morality, the training of superior wisdom, the training of superior mind, and the training of the vow to abandon all non-virtue.

original: spyod yul bzhi ni sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod yul bzhi ni sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The four domains are called the domain of the bhumi, the domain of the paramita, the domain of omniscience, and the domain of samadhi.

original: las bzhi ni /
analyzed: las bzhi ni /
translated: The four actions are:

original: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las dang bzhi'o //
translated: the action of the body, the action of speech, the action of mind, and the action of perfecting the qualities of all the Buddhas.

original: spobs ba bzhi ni /
analyzed: spobs ba bzhi ni /
translated: The four kinds of eloquence are:

original: myur ba'i spobs pa dang / shin tu myur ba'i spobs pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa'i spobs pa dang / rjes su ma bstan pa'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: myur ba'i spobs pa dang / shin tu myur ba'i spobs pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa'i spobs pa dang / rjes su ma bstan pa'i spobs pa'o //
translated: eloquence that is swift, eloquence that is very swift, eloquence that is uninterrupted, and eloquence that is unhindered.

original: lam bsgom pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four cultivations of the path are:

original: nyan thos kyi lam bsgom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam bsgom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyad par gyi lam bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam bsgom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam bsgom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyad par gyi lam bsgom pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of the Śrāvaka path, the cultivation of the Pratyekabuddha path, the cultivation of the Bodhisattva path, and the cultivation of the special path of the Tathāgatas.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa bzhi ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa dang / 'gro ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa bzhi ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa dang / 'gro ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa'o //
translated: The four knowledges of the thoroughly afflicted are the knowledge of the thoroughly afflicted karma, the knowledge of the thoroughly afflicted birth, the knowledge of the thoroughly afflicted afflictions, and the knowledge of the thoroughly afflicted reincarnating being.

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges of having results are

original: 'chad pa 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa dang / lung bstan pa 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa dang / bag la nyal 'joms pa 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa dang / lung bstan pa 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa dang / bag la nyal 'joms pa 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa 'bras bu yod pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of having the result of explanation, the knowledge of having the result of prophecy, the knowledge of having the result of destroying latent tendencies, and the knowledge of having the result of realizing complete enlightenment.

original: ma rig pa shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges of ignorance are

original: ma rig pa skye ba shes pa dang ; ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'jug pa shes pa dang / ma rig pa 'gag pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa skye ba shes pa dang ; ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'jug pa shes pa dang / ma rig pa 'gag pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the arising of ignorance, the knowledge of the nature of ignorance, the knowledge of the engagement of ignorance, and the knowledge of the cessation of ignorance.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges of suffering are

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal shes pa'i sdug bsngal shes pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal shes @79a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal shes pa'i sdug bsngal shes pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal shes @79a * //
translated: The knowledge of the suffering of suffering is the knowledge of the suffering of suffering.🔽The knowledge of the suffering of change is the knowledge of the suffering of change.🔽

original: pa dang ; 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal shes pa dang / 'khor ba'i phung po lnga'i sdug bsngal shes pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang ; 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal shes pa dang / 'khor ba'i phung po lnga'i sdug bsngal shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the suffering of suffering, the knowledge of the suffering of change, the knowledge of the suffering of the formative forces, and the knowledge of the suffering of the five aggregates in cyclic existence.

original: yid mi bde ba shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges of mental dissatisfaction are:

original: rnyed pa med pa'i yid mi bde ba shes pa dang / mi bsngags pa'i yid mi bde ba shes pa dang / mi shes pa'i yid mi bde ba shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa ma thob pa'i yid mi bde ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa med pa'i yid mi bde ba shes pa dang / mi bsngags pa'i yid mi bde ba shes pa dang / mi shes pa'i yid mi bde ba shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa ma thob pa'i yid mi bde ba shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of mental dissatisfaction due to lack of gain, the knowledge of mental dissatisfaction due to disrepute, the knowledge of mental dissatisfaction due to ignorance, and the knowledge of mental dissatisfaction due to the non-attainment of realization.

original: dbul po shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: dbul po shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges of poverty are:

original: shes pas dbul ba shes pa dang / tshig gis dbul ba shes pa dang / sgrub pas dbul ba shes pa dang / thabs kyis dbul ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pas dbul ba shes pa dang / tshig gis dbul ba shes pa dang / sgrub pas dbul ba shes pa dang / thabs kyis dbul ba shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of poverty of knowledge, the knowledge of poverty of speech, the knowledge of poverty of practice, and the knowledge of poverty of means.

original: skye ba shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: skye ba shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges of birth are:

original: bsams bzhin du skye ba shes pa dang / las kyi skye ba shes pa dang / mngal nas skye ba shes pa dang / mngal ma yin pa nas skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du skye ba shes pa dang / las kyi skye ba shes pa dang / mngal nas skye ba shes pa dang / mngal ma yin pa nas skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of intentional rebirth, knowledge of rebirth through action, knowledge of womb birth, and knowledge of non-womb birth.

original: nang shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: nang shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four internal knowledges are:

original: phung po shes pa dang / skye mched shes pa dang / khams shes pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po shes pa dang / skye mched shes pa dang / khams shes pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of the aggregates, knowledge of the sense bases, knowledge of the elements, and knowledge of the feelings of pleasure and pain.

original: phyi rol shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: phyi rol shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four external knowledges are:

original: phyi rol nyid lta bur de dag nyid sgro btags nas phung po la sogs pa bzhi po shes pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid lta bur de dag nyid sgro btags nas phung po la sogs pa bzhi po shes pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the four, such as the aggregates, that are imputed as if external.

original: ngo tsha shes pa'i shes pa bzhi ni bdag la ltos nas 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa'i shes pa bzhi ni bdag la ltos nas 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
translated: The four knowledges of shame are: shame based on oneself, shame based on the Dharma, shame based on public opinion, and shame based on disgrace.

original: des bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i shes pa dang / bya bar 'os pa rnams mi 'dor ba'i shes pa dang / dam bcas pa des bsgrub pa'i shes pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi slu ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: des bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i shes pa dang / bya bar 'os pa rnams mi 'dor ba'i shes pa dang / dam bcas pa des bsgrub pa'i shes pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi slu ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of not doing what should not be done, the knowledge of not abandoning what should be done, the knowledge of accomplishing what has been undertaken, and the knowledge of not deceiving the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: bden pa shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: bden pa shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: There are four knowledges of truth:

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa mi 'dor ba'i bden pa shes pa dang / tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i bden pa shes pa dang / sems can mi slu ba'i bden pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i bden pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa mi 'dor ba'i bden pa shes pa dang / tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i bden pa shes pa dang / sems can mi slu ba'i bden pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i bden pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of truth of not abandoning the generation of the mind of enlightenment, the knowledge of truth of perfecting the accumulations, the knowledge of truth of not deceiving sentient beings, and the knowledge of truth of actualizing Buddhahood.

original: srid pa shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: srid pa shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: There are four knowledges of existence:

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa shes pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa shes pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i lta ba'i srid pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa shes pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa shes pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i lta ba'i srid pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the existence of desire, the knowledge of the existence of form, the knowledge of the existence of the formless, and the knowledge of the existence of the view of ignorance.

original: dngos po shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: dngos po shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: There are four knowledges of things:

original: 'dus byas kyi dngos po shes pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po shes pa dang / lung du bstan pa'i dngos po shes pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi dngos po shes pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po shes pa dang / lung du bstan pa'i dngos po shes pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of conditioned things, the knowledge of unconditioned things, the knowledge of things that are taught, and the knowledge of things that are not taught.

original: gang @79b zag shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: gang @79b zag shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges of the person are:

original: phung po gang zag tu shes pa dang / brjod du med pa'i gang zag shes pa dang / las 'dzin pa'i gang zag shes pa dang / gang zag 'ba' zhig pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gang zag tu shes pa dang / brjod du med pa'i gang zag shes pa dang / las 'dzin pa'i gang zag shes pa dang / gang zag 'ba' zhig pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the person as a mere collection of aggregates, the knowledge of the inexpressible person, the knowledge of the person as the basis of karma, and the knowledge of the person as a mere convention.

original: dmigs pa shes pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa shes pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four knowledges of objects are:

original: bdag gi dmigs pa shes pa dang / sems can gyi dmigs pa shes pa dang ; sred pa'i dmigs pa shes pa dang / chos kyi dmigs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dmigs pa shes pa dang / sems can gyi dmigs pa shes pa dang ; sred pa'i dmigs pa shes pa dang / chos kyi dmigs pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the object of the self, the knowledge of the object of sentient beings, the knowledge of the object of craving, and the knowledge of the object of the Dharma.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes 'di dag gis bstan pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pas mthar phyin par bstan par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes 'di dag gis bstan pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pas mthar phyin par bstan par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: Since these inconceivable wisdoms are taught in an inconceivable way, it is not easy to teach them in a way that reaches their culmination.

original: gzungs bzhi ni /
analyzed: gzungs bzhi ni /
translated: The four retentions are:

original: 'du byed thams cad mtha' yas par bshad pa brjod pa de la gang shes pa 'di ni gzungs dang po'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mtha' yas par bshad pa brjod pa de la gang shes pa 'di ni gzungs dang po'o //
translated: The first dhāraṇī is the knowledge of the explanation of the infinity of all compounded things.

original: dbyangs mtha' yas par brjod pa de la gang shes pa 'di ni gzungs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs mtha' yas par brjod pa de la gang shes pa 'di ni gzungs gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second dhāraṇī is the knowledge of the explanation of the infinity of sounds.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mtha' yas par bshad pa brjod pa de la gang shes pa 'di ni gzungs gsum pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mtha' yas par bshad pa brjod pa de la gang shes pa 'di ni gzungs gsum pa'o //
translated: The third dhāraṇī is the knowledge of the explanation of the infinity of afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba'i yon tan gyi phan yon mtha' yas par brjod pa de la gang shes pa 'dir gzungs bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i yon tan gyi phan yon mtha' yas par brjod pa de la gang shes pa 'dir gzungs bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth dhāraṇī is the knowledge of the explanation of the infinity of the benefits of the qualities of purification.

original: tshig gi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i gzungs so //
analyzed: tshig gi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i gzungs so //
translated: The dhāraṇī of words, the dhāraṇī of meanings, the dhāraṇī of mantras, and the dhāraṇī of realizations.

original: shes rab dang dran pa gnyis ni gzungs thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzungs zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: shes rab dang dran pa gnyis ni gzungs thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzungs zhes bya'o ;
translated: Because wisdom and mindfulness are the causes of all dhāraṇīs, they are called dhāraṇīs.

original: / tshul bzhi zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas gzungs 'di dag la thug gi bar du 'du byed dang / yongs su bshad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba dag gis thams cad du bstan pa 'di dag ni 'du byed kho na la brten par nges so zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: / tshul bzhi zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas gzungs 'di dag la thug gi bar du 'du byed dang / yongs su bshad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba dag gis thams cad du bstan pa 'di dag ni 'du byed kho na la brten par nges so zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The four modes, beginning with the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the way things are, up to the four summaries of the Dharma, are taught in all these dhāraṇīs, and they are definitely based only on formations, as is indicated by the words “formations,” “explanation,” “affliction,” and “purification.”

original: /'di ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: /'di ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa rnams so //
translated: “Thus” refers to what was taught above.

original: gzungs gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs gang yin pa de ni shes pa'o //
translated: The dhāraṇī is the knowledge.

original: shes pa ni chos so zhes bya ba la /🔽chos shes pas nan gyis yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa de ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni chos so zhes bya ba la / chos shes pas nan gyis yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa de ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the Dharma.🔽The thorough knowledge of the Dharma is the thorough knowledge of the Dharma.

original: don gang zhig chos shes pas ji lta ba bzhin du nges par byas pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don gang zhig chos shes pas ji lta ba bzhin du nges par byas pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the meaning is the thorough knowledge of the meaning.

original: chos shes pas nges par byas pa'i don gang yin pa sems can thams cad dga' bar bya ba'i phyir skad sna tshogs kyis nges pa'i tshig gis chos ston pas so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes skyed pa ni nges pa'i @80a * //
analyzed: chos shes pas nges par byas pa'i don gang yin pa sems can thams cad dga' bar bya ba'i phyir skad sna tshogs kyis nges pa'i tshig gis chos ston pas so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes skyed pa ni nges pa'i @80a * //
translated: The knowledge of language generates the knowledge of the conventional, because it teaches the Dharma with various languages in order to delight all beings.

original: tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of expression generates the knowledge of eloquence, because it generates the knowledge that is individually intuitive.

original: chos shes pas tha snyad kyis ston par byed pa'i dus su rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa nyid dang / tshig 'dres pa med pa nyid dang / tshig zhum pa med pa nyid dang / spobs pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis so so yang dag par rig pa ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos shes pas tha snyad kyis ston par byed pa'i dus su rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa nyid dang / tshig 'dres pa med pa nyid dang / tshig zhum pa med pa nyid dang / spobs pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis so so yang dag par rig pa ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of eloquence generates the knowledge of the inexhaustible, because it is inexhaustible in the assemblies, due to its appropriateness, its freedom, its absence of confusion, its absence of timidity, and its infinity.

original: de ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rgyas par bstan nas bde bar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pas /
analyzed: de ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rgyas par bstan nas bde bar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pas /
translated: Having thus explained the four knowledges in detail, he concludes the explanation of the four knowledges in brief with one verse.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then the Bhagavat spoke thus and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas ye shes ji snyed pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes ji snyed pa //
translated: As much as the wisdom of the Buddha,

original: gzugs su btags pa 'ang de snyed de //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs su btags pa 'ang de snyed de // zhes bya ba la /
translated: so much is the designation of form.

original: de dag thams cad sngar bstan zin pas yang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad sngar bstan zin pas yang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Since all of these have been taught previously, they should not be repeated again.

original: ngo mtshar bsam gyis mi khyab chos //
analyzed: ngo mtshar bsam gyis mi khyab chos //
translated: The Dharma of the inconceivable marvel,

original: so so yang dag rig dbye bas //
analyzed: so so yang dag rig dbye bas //
translated: the divisions of the correct knowledges,

original: 'gro ba'i mgon po rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mgon po rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: the protector of beings, the perfect Buddha,

original: rkang gnyis mchog gis rab tu bstan //
analyzed: rkang gnyis mchog gis rab tu bstan //
translated: the supreme of humans has taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary to the twenty-fourth chapter, teaching the inconceivable tathagatas.

original: // / so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa'i skabs dbye bas so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam par dbye ba rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa'i skabs dbye bas so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam par dbye ba rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach extensively the divisions of the correct knowledges by dividing the section on the correct knowledges,

original: gzhon nu de la byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar chos so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhon nu de la byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar chos so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The question, How does the bodhisattva practice the discernment of phenomena? is asked of the youth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i ngo bos sam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i ngo bos sam /
translated: Is it by the nature of the aggregates such as form,

original: de las gzhan pas sam /
analyzed: de las gzhan pas sam /
translated: or by something other than that,

original: de dag gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis spyod na so so yang dag par rig pa lags /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis spyod na so so yang dag par rig pa lags /
translated: or by the emptiness of their intrinsic nature?

original: zhes zhus pa'i lan du gzhon nu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta bas gzugs las gzhan du byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes zhus pa'i lan du gzhon nu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta bas gzugs las gzhan du byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la /
translated: In response, it is said, Here, youth, the bodhisattva, by observing phenomena as phenomena, does not see awakening as other than form.

original: ma skyes pa'i gzugs la gzugs kyi ngo bo med pas brtags pa'i gzugs la 'am /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i gzugs la gzugs kyi ngo bo med pas brtags pa'i gzugs la 'am /
translated: In unarisen form, since there is no essence of form, he does not see awakening in imagined form,

original: gzugs kyis sam /
analyzed: gzugs kyis sam /
translated: or by form,

original: gzugs las kyang byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gzugs las kyang byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: or even from form.

original: brtags pa'i gzugs ni sgyu ma dang sprul pa'i gzugs dang 'dra bas byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: brtags pa'i gzugs ni sgyu ma dang sprul pa'i gzugs dang 'dra bas byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Since imagined form is like illusory and emanated form, he does not see awakening.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs las gzhan du yang byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs las gzhan du yang byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see awakening as other than the form of reality.

original: sgro btags pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs ni @80b gzugs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgro btags pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs ni @80b gzugs med pa nyid do //
translated: The form of reality is non-form, because it is free from all superimpositions.

original: de'i phyir gzugs nyid byang chub byang chub nyid gzugs so zhes bya bas gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs nyid byang chub byang chub nyid gzugs so zhes bya bas gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Therefore, form itself is awakening, and awakening itself is form. Thus, they are non-dual and indivisible.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nyid gzugs so //
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness itself is form.

original: gzugs nyid rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs nyid rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Form itself is called consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa 'di ni gnyis su med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa 'di ni gnyis su med de /
translated: The essence of form and the Thus-Gone One are non-dual.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs la dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs la dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the form of reality is undifferentiated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar lta na chos so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar lta na chos so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod do //
translated: When bodhisattva mahāsattvas view in this way, they engage in the correct understanding of phenomena.

original: don de dag nyid tshig su bcad pas rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de dag nyid tshig su bcad pas rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach those very topics in detail through verses,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gzugs kyis kyang ni byang chub bstan //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gzugs kyis kyang ni byang chub bstan //
translated: then the Bhagavān said, etc.🔽Form also teaches enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyis kyang gzugs bstan te //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽gzugs kyi chos nyid ni byang chub bo /
analyzed: byang chub kyis kyang gzugs bstan te // zhes bya ba la / gzugs kyi chos nyid ni byang chub bo /
translated: Enlightenment also teaches form.🔽Here, the reality of form is enlightenment.

original: byang chub nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba'o //🔽mi mtshungs pa yi sgra rnams kyis //
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba'o // mi mtshungs pa yi sgra rnams kyis //
translated: Enlightenment itself is form.

original: chos kyi bla ma rab tu bstan //
analyzed: chos kyi bla ma rab tu bstan //
translated: The supreme Dharma is taught

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: through dissimilar terms.

original: gzugs nyid byang chub po zhes bya ba mi 'dra ba'i sgras bstan na yang gzugs la byang chub med de /
analyzed: gzugs nyid byang chub po zhes bya ba mi 'dra ba'i sgras bstan na yang gzugs la byang chub med de /
translated: Here, although it is taught through dissimilar terms, “Form itself is enlightenment,” enlightenment does not exist in form,

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not produced.

original: chos kyi bla ma rab tu bstan zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos ni bstan par bya ba dang / ston pa dang / bstan pa dang / bral ba yin na yang gdul bya'o bsam pa'i dbang gis ston par byed de zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi bla ma rab tu bstan zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos ni bstan par bya ba dang / ston pa dang / bstan pa dang / bral ba yin na yang gdul bya'o bsam pa'i dbang gis ston par byed de zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: The phrase the teacher of the Dharma means that the unborn Dharma is to be taught, is taught, and is taught as free from the taught, the teacher, and the teaching, but it is taught by the power of the intention of those to be trained.

original: gzugs dang byang chub mnyam pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs dang byang chub mnyam pa ste //
translated: Form and enlightenment are the same.

original: tha dad bya ba der mi rnyed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tha dad bya ba der mi rnyed // ces bya ba la /
translated: They are not found to be different.

original: sna tshogs su char dbye ba btags pa ;
analyzed: sna tshogs su char dbye ba btags pa ;
translated: The various divisions of the aggregates are imputed.

original: dmigs pa rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not found as objects.

original: mya ngan 'das pa zab par yang //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa zab par yang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Nirvāṇa is also profound.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas shin tu zab pa nyid do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas shin tu zab pa nyid do //
translated: Since nirvāṇa is the nature free from all objects, it is extremely profound.

original: de lta na yang sgra yis rab tu ston par byed la /
analyzed: de lta na yang sgra yis rab tu ston par byed la /
translated: Even so, it is taught by words.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang sgra yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang sgra yang mi dmigs te /
translated: Neither nirvāṇa nor words are found.

original: sgra dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'di dag gnyis su med cing tha mi dad do //
analyzed: sgra dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'di dag gnyis su med cing tha mi dad do //
translated: Sound and nirvana are not two nor divided.

original: de bzhin stong pa'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: de bzhin stong pa'i chos rnams la //
translated: In the same way, in empty phenomena,

original: mya ngan 'das pa rab tu bstan //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa rab tu bstan //
translated: Nirvana is taught.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na pha rol la rtogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na pha rol la rtogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro // chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis //
translated: This is because otherwise, understanding would not arise in others.🔽All phenomena are equal to nirvana

original: mya ngan 'das @81a * //🔽dang mtshungs mnyam pas //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das @81a * // dang mtshungs mnyam pas //
translated: By nature.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gzod nas zhi zhing ma skyes pa //
analyzed: gzod nas zhi zhing ma skyes pa //
translated: Pacified from the beginning, unborn,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: By nature nirvāṇa.

original: chos rnams thams cad ces bya bas so //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ces bya bas so //
translated: All phenomena are so called.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni sku mthong nas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni sku mthong nas //
translated: Having seen the Buddha’s body,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku mthong ba na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ngo zhes smra na yang de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs kyi skur mthong bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku mthong ba na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ngo zhes smra na yang de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs kyi skur mthong bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: When the form body of the Tathāgata is seen, it is said that the Tathāgata is seen. However, the Tathāgata cannot be seen in the form body,

original: chos kyi skur nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi skur nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is ascertained to be the body of truth.

original: 'o na gzugs kyi skur rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar yin zhe na /🔽gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ci 'dra bar /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs kyi skur rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar yin zhe na / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ci 'dra bar /
translated: Well then, how is the embodiment of form established?🔽The nature of form is known

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid shes te //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid shes te //
translated: as having the characteristic of form.

original: rang bzhin med cing ma skyes pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin med cing ma skyes pa //
translated: It is without intrinsic nature and unarisen,

original: sgyu ma sprul pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma sprul pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: like an illusory emanated form.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma shes pas //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma shes pas //
translated: Not knowing the nature of form,

original: bdag gis lus zhes bdag tu mthong //
analyzed: bdag gis lus zhes bdag tu mthong //
translated: I saw the body as “mine” and as a self.

original: de bzhin du phung po lnga po rnams la /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po lnga po rnams la /
translated: In the same way, with regard to the five aggregates,

original: bdag gis chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig par shes pa ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gis chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig par shes pa ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic is the knowledge that all phenomena, having no characteristic, are of one characteristic.

original: zhes shes nas /
analyzed: zhes shes nas /
translated: Having known that,

original: chos kyi sku la rab tu gnas nas chos ston to //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la rab tu gnas nas chos ston to //
translated: one abides in the embodiment of truth and teaches the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sku la mi brten par de spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas chos nyid de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang tshig gis brjod par mi spyod do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la mi brten par de spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas chos nyid de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang tshig gis brjod par mi spyod do //
translated: Without relying on the embodiment of truth, that reality is not expressed verbally even by the buddhas, because it is by nature the complete pacification of all conceptual elaborations.

original: de bzhin du 'di lta bu'i chos zab mo'i ngo bo mi shes par sangs rgyas kyi sgra thos pas bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo zhes tshig tsam du smra yang sgra tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di lta bu'i chos zab mo'i ngo bo mi shes par sangs rgyas kyi sgra thos pas bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo zhes tshig tsam du smra yang sgra tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, without knowing the nature of such profound Dharma, one may say with mere words, “I have seen the Tathāgata,” upon hearing the word “Buddha.” But the Tathāgata is not seen by mere sound.

original: de tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong na ni sems can thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi sgra thos pas sangs rgyas su 'gyur na de lta bu ni med do //
analyzed: de tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong na ni sems can thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi sgra thos pas sangs rgyas su 'gyur na de lta bu ni med do //
translated: If the Tathāgata were seen by that alone, then all sentient beings would become Buddhas upon hearing the word “Buddha.” But that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi skur mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi skur mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who sees the Tathāgata as the Dharma body is said to “see the Buddha.”

original: de'i phyir chos kyi sku dang / stong pa nyid dang / gzugs thams cad du mtshan nyid gcig pa yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi sku dang / stong pa nyid dang / gzugs thams cad du mtshan nyid gcig pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the Dharma body, emptiness, and the single characteristic of all forms are the same.

original: / des na /
analyzed: / des na /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: gang gis gzugs rnams rab shes pa //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs rnams rab shes pa //
translated: Whoever fully understands forms

original: des ni stong nyid rab tu shes //
analyzed: des ni stong nyid rab tu shes //
translated: Fully understands emptiness.

original: gang gis stong nyid rab shes pa //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid rab shes pa //
translated: Whoever fully understands emptiness

original: des ni 'dres pa rab tu shes //
analyzed: des ni 'dres pa rab tu shes //
translated: Fully understands the mixed.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rnam pa 'di ni mi shes pas //🔽dmigs pa can rnams rab tu brlag /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rnam pa 'di ni mi shes pas // dmigs pa can rnams rab tu brlag /
translated: This aspect is not known by the ignorant,

original: @81b ces bya'o //
analyzed: @81b ces bya'o //
translated: and the objectifiers are utterly destroyed.🔽Those who are attached to the non-existent as existent,

original: bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la dngos por 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa don dam par yod pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs la med par 'du shes pa don ma yin pa la don du mngon par zhen la /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa la dngos por 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa don dam par yod pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs la med par 'du shes pa don ma yin pa la don du mngon par zhen la /
translated: such as the self, and to the non-existent as existent, the form of the ultimate reality of nirvana, are attached to the non-meaning as meaning.

original: shes kyi khe yis bslus pa dag /'bras bu med pa la 'bras bur mngon par zhen pa dag nga'i bstan pa las shin tu 'khyams nas dge sbyong gi nor dang bral ba don dam pas dbul bas /🔽le lo can tshul khrims nyams pas rnam par gnas pa dag 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes kyi khe yis bslus pa dag /'bras bu med pa la 'bras bur mngon par zhen pa dag nga'i bstan pa las shin tu 'khyams nas dge sbyong gi nor dang bral ba don dam pas dbul bas / le lo can tshul khrims nyams pas rnam par gnas pa dag 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: Those deceived by the profit of knowledge, attached to the non-fruit as fruit, utterly stray from my teaching, are devoid of the wealth of asceticism, and are ultimately poor.

original: zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: The lazy, with their degenerate ethics, will say, “This is not the teaching of the Buddha.”

original: la la dag ni 'di skad du //
analyzed: la la dag ni 'di skad du //
translated: Some will say,

original: bdag cag byang chub zhugs zhes zer //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag cag byang chub zhugs zhes zer //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: “We are engaged in enlightenment.”

original: sgra tsam gyis dga' ba yin gyi yang 'di'i chos nyid la rab tu gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra tsam gyis dga' ba yin gyi yang 'di'i chos nyid la rab tu gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are pleased with mere words, but they do not abide in the true nature of phenomena.

original: rnyed pa la dga' bar 'gyur gyi chos 'dod pa ni ma yin no //🔽khengs pa dang bag med pas zil gyis mnan pas mchod rten dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa byed cing /
analyzed: rnyed pa la dga' bar 'gyur gyi chos 'dod pa ni ma yin no // khengs pa dang bag med pas zil gyis mnan pas mchod rten dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa byed cing /
translated: They delight in gain, but not in the Dharma.🔽Overcome by conceit and carelessness, they build stūpas, temples, and so on,

original: grags pa 'dod pa /
analyzed: grags pa 'dod pa /
translated: but they do this for the sake of fame,

original: dmigs pa'i lta ba can lta ba la mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i lta ba can lta ba la mngon par zhen pa /
translated: not out of faith in the view.

original: gzhan gyi bud med la chags shing brgyal ba /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med la chags shing brgyal ba /
translated: They are attached to the wives of others and are intoxicated by their own wives.🔽It is difficult for them to even think of going forth, and yet they teach householders that sense pleasures are like flames of fire.

original: rab tu byung ba'i bsam pa tsam yang rnyed par dka' ba de dag khyim pa rnams la 'dod pa rnams ni me lce lta bu'o zhes ston par byed cing de dag gi bu mo dang chung ma dag la mngon par chags shing rigs sun par byed par 'gyur🔽ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i bsam pa tsam yang rnyed par dka' ba de dag khyim pa rnams la 'dod pa rnams ni me lce lta bu'o zhes ston par byed cing de dag gi bu mo dang chung ma dag la mngon par chags shing rigs sun par byed par 'gyur🔽ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: They become attached to the daughters and wives of others and bring disgrace to their own families.

original: de dag rnga dang / dung dang / rdza rnga la sogs pas nga la mchod par byed cing bsgrub pa'i mchod pa dang bral ba yin no ;
analyzed: de dag rnga dang / dung dang / rdza rnga la sogs pas nga la mchod par byed cing bsgrub pa'i mchod pa dang bral ba yin no ;
translated: They worship me with drums, conches, clay drums, and so on, but they are devoid of the worship of practice.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa la bsgrub pa'i mchod pas mchod na mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa la bsgrub pa'i mchod pas mchod na mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they worship the Tathagata with the worship of practice, then they worship.

original: tshul khrims dang / spyod pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa mthong na bdag cag ji lta ba 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / spyod pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa mthong na bdag cag ji lta ba 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: When they see the perfection of morality, conduct, and domain, they say, “We are just like that.”

original: tshul khrims kyang de lta bu zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang de lta bu zhes zer ro //
translated: They say, “Morality is just like that.”

original: tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod pa thos na 'di dag sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes ngo tsha dang bral bas spong bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod pa thos na 'di dag sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes ngo tsha dang bral bas spong bar byed do //
translated: When they hear the praise of morality, they reject it, saying, “This is not the word of the Buddha,” and they are devoid of shame.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos spangs pas mnar med par mchog tu gzhol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos spangs pas mnar med par mchog tu gzhol bar 'gyur te /
translated: By rejecting the enlightenment of the Buddha and the qualities that are the causes of that, they are headed for the Avici Hell.

original: dmyal ba thob par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de sangs rgyas nyid @82a * //
analyzed: dmyal ba thob par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de sangs rgyas nyid @82a * //
translated: The cause for attaining the hells is the same as for attaining Buddhahood.

original: thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the cause of attaining it.

original: de lta bas na bdag byang chub la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig tsam gyis byang chub sems dpar gyur pa ma yin pa de dag khyed bstan par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag byang chub la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig tsam gyis byang chub sems dpar gyur pa ma yin pa de dag khyed bstan par yang mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not teach those who have not become bodhisattvas merely by the words “I will stand in enlightenment.”

original: gal te phrad par gyur na smra ba dang / gtam dang rim gro gyis la de dag gi sems bsrung ba'i phyir lo grangs du lon pa dris la de dag rgan par gyur na rkang pa la mgo bos phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pas bsnyen bkur bya zhing khong khro ba cung zad kyang mi skyed de /
analyzed: gal te phrad par gyur na smra ba dang / gtam dang rim gro gyis la de dag gi sems bsrung ba'i phyir lo grangs du lon pa dris la de dag rgan par gyur na rkang pa la mgo bos phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pas bsnyen bkur bya zhing khong khro ba cung zad kyang mi skyed de /
translated: If you meet them, speak to them, converse with them, and serve them. In order to protect their minds, ask them how many years they have been in the bodhisattva training. If they are older than you, honor them by bowing your head to their feet, and so on. Do not arouse even the slightest anger.

original: byams pa'i sems kyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems kyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Through a mind of love, you will attain enlightenment.

original: gang yang de dag gi 'khrul pa dpag tu med par snang bar gyur na yang de lta na yang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang de dag gi 'khrul pa dpag tu med par snang bar gyur na yang de lta na yang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Even if their faults are seen to be immeasurable, still you should not speak of them.

original: gang gis las gang ji ltar spyad pa de'i 'bras bu de dang mthun par 'byung ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes shes nas /
analyzed: gang gis las gang ji ltar spyad pa de'i 'bras bu de dang mthun par 'byung ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes shes nas /
translated: One experiences the result of an action in accordance with the way one has performed it.

original: bzhin gyi zla ba 'dzum bzhin du //🔽rgan rabs dang ni gsar bu la ;
analyzed: bzhin gyi zla ba 'dzum bzhin du // rgan rabs dang ni gsar bu la ;
translated: With a smiling face,🔽Always speak pleasantly to the elders and the young,

original: / rtag tu gsong por smra ba dang // des shing nga rgyal bcom par bya //
analyzed: / rtag tu gsong por smra ba dang // des shing nga rgyal bcom par bya //
translated: Be gentle and humble.

original: rab tu dang ba'i sems kyis sems can thams cad rjes su gzung bar zhugs pas chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pas rjes su gzung bar 'tsho pa rnams kyis gyis shig ces slob par byed do ;
analyzed: rab tu dang ba'i sems kyis sems can thams cad rjes su gzung bar zhugs pas chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pas rjes su gzung bar 'tsho pa rnams kyis gyis shig ces slob par byed do ;
translated: Those who live by supporting themselves with Dharma robes, alms-food, and so on, should do this with a mind full of faith, taking on the responsibility of caring for all sentient beings.

original: / khyod la chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gis gsol ba btab na /
analyzed: / khyod la chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gis gsol ba btab na /
translated: If someone asks you to listen to the Dharma,

original: de spro ba bskyed par bya ste khyod nyid mkhas pa chen po yin na khyod kyi drung du bdag gis ji ltar smra bar nus zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de spro ba bskyed par bya ste khyod nyid mkhas pa chen po yin na khyod kyi drung du bdag gis ji ltar smra bar nus zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: you should encourage them, saying, “If you are a great scholar, how can I speak in your presence?”

original: gal te de dag gi nang nas 'ga' zhig snod du gyur pa yod na bdag nyid kyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag gi nang nas 'ga' zhig snod du gyur pa yod na bdag nyid kyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: If there are some among them who are suitable vessels, I will explain it myself.

original: de la tshul khrims 'chal pa mang du gnas par gyur na der tshul khrims kyi gtam mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims 'chal pa mang du gnas par gyur na der tshul khrims kyi gtam mi bya'o //
translated: If there are many there who are immoral, I will not speak about morality there.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam bya'o //
translated: I will speak about generosity.

original: gang gis tshul khrims dang spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa mang du gnas par gyur na de'i tshe tshul khrims kyi gtam bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis tshul khrims dang spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa mang du gnas par gyur na de'i tshe tshul khrims kyi gtam bya'o //
translated: If there are many there who are endowed with morality and conduct, then I will speak about morality there.

original: gal te 'khor yongs su dag par gyur na sbyin pa dang // tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'khor yongs su dag par gyur na sbyin pa dang // tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o //
translated: If the assembly is pure, I will speak about generosity, morality, patience, effort, concentration, wisdom, and so on, about all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gis mgu bar mi 'gyur @82b na byang chub ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la mngon par sbyor bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gis mgu bar mi 'gyur @82b na byang chub ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la mngon par sbyor bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: If one is not satisfied with just generosity and so on, one should train in applying oneself to cultivating meditative concentration, thinking, “Awakening is accomplished through meditative absorption and meditative concentration.”

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir nye bar mkho ba'i mchod pa thams cad kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir nye bar mkho ba'i mchod pa thams cad kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas with all the offerings that are necessary in order to complete the accumulations of goodness and wisdom.

original: de lta bas na byang chub tu sems yang dag par bskyed nas nan tan snying por byed pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nges par bsgrub pa'i phyir mdo sde 'di don dang gzhung dang bcas par gzung bar bya zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub tu sems yang dag par bskyed nas nan tan snying por byed pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nges par bsgrub pa'i phyir mdo sde 'di don dang gzhung dang bcas par gzung bar bya zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, having generated the mind of awakening, and making practice one’s essence, in order to definitely accomplish all the qualities of a buddha, one should retain this discourse together with its content and its text.

original: 'di'i phan yon rgya cher bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
