analyzed: 'di'i phan yon rgya cher bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The benefits of this should be understood in the same way as they are presented in the above passage.

original: sangs rgyas dpag med 'byung ba'i chos nyid nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpag med 'byung ba'i chos nyid nyid //
translated: The nature of the appearance of immeasurable buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bsngags ting 'dzin rgyal po 'dir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bsngags ting 'dzin rgyal po 'dir //
translated: In this King of Samādhis praised by the buddhas,

original: grags pa cung zhig tsam zhig bdag gis bstan //
analyzed: grags pa cung zhig tsam zhig bdag gis bstan //
translated: I have taught just a little bit of fame.

original: shin tu phra ba bdag 'dra sus rtogs nus //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba bdag 'dra sus rtogs nus //
translated: Who like me, so very small, could understand it?

original: so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the twenty-fifth chapter, on the correct understanding of the individual, in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras.

original: // / da ni thabs la mkhas pa bstan par bzhed nas de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / da ni thabs la mkhas pa bstan par bzhed nas de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, intending to teach about skillful means, [the text] says Then again the Blessed One... and so forth.

original: gzhon nu ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gzhon nu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhon nu ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gzhon nu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In response to the question Young man, how are bodhisattvas skilled in means? [the text] says Young man, in this regard, bodhisattvas... and so forth.

original: sems can thams cad la nye du'i sems nye bar bzhag nas sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi phung po ci yod pa sems kyis mngon par brtags nas shin tu legs so bya bas rjes su yi rang bar bya ste nyin lan gsum /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la nye du'i sems nye bar bzhag nas sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi phung po ci yod pa sems kyis mngon par brtags nas shin tu legs so bya bas rjes su yi rang bar bya ste nyin lan gsum /
translated: Having established the attitude of close affinity with all sentient beings, and having mentally examined whatever collections of merit there are of all sentient beings, one should rejoice with the exclamation “Excellent!” three times by day and three times by night.

original: mtshan lan gsum du nyin re bzhin du bsod nams kyi phung po 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas nyid thob par gyur cig / bdag kyang sems can thams cad sgrol bar nus par gyur cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan lan gsum du nyin re bzhin du bsod nams kyi phung po 'dis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas nyid thob par gyur cig / bdag kyang sems can thams cad sgrol bar nus par gyur cig ces bya'o //
translated: “By this collection of merit, may all sentient beings attain buddhahood; and may I also be able to liberate all sentient beings.”

original: thabs mkhas pa 'di dang yang dag par ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par 'gyur zhing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin @83a *
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa 'di dang yang dag par ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par 'gyur zhing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin @83a *
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with this skillful means will quickly attain meditative stabilization and will quickly awaken to highest genuine full Awakening.”

original: // no ; / don 'di dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas rgya cher bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // no ; / don 'di dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas rgya cher bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The same point is taught extensively in the following verse:

original: sems can 'di dag thams cad bdag gi gnyen //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag thams cad bdag gi gnyen // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: All these sentient beings are my relatives.

original: bu gcig pa sdug pa la brtse bas yangs su 'dzin pa bzhin du sems can 'di dag ni bdag gi gnyen du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: bu gcig pa sdug pa la brtse bas yangs su 'dzin pa bzhin du sems can 'di dag ni bdag gi gnyen du gyur pa yin la /
translated: The verse says that just as a loving mother cherishes her child, all sentient beings are my relatives.

original: gnyen rnams la brtse ba btang nas ji ltar nyan thos bzhin du 'khor bas 'jigs shing skrag nas bdag nyid gcig pu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya zhes snying rje chen pos de dag la dmigs nas sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi phung po
analyzed: gnyen rnams la brtse ba btang nas ji ltar nyan thos bzhin du 'khor bas 'jigs shing skrag nas bdag nyid gcig pu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya zhes snying rje chen pos de dag la dmigs nas sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi phung po
translated: How can I, having abandoned my love for my relatives, fear cyclic existence like the śrāvakas and seek my own nirvāṇa alone?🔽With great compassion, I focus on them and rejoice in the entire heap of merit of all sentient beings.

original: thams cad la rjes su yi rang bzhin rjes su yi rang ba la brten pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de yang sems can thams cad la de bzhin du nges par bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la rjes su yi rang bzhin rjes su yi rang ba la brten pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de yang sems can thams cad la de bzhin du nges par bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: I dedicate the heap of merit that is based on rejoicing to all sentient beings in the same way.

original: bdag nyid kyang sems can thams cad bsgral bar dam bcas pa'i phyir lus dang srog gi phyir yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims nyams par mi 'gyur zhing mos pa phun sum tshogs pas sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mngon par rab tu dang ba dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang sems can thams cad bsgral bar dam bcas pa'i phyir lus dang srog gi phyir yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims nyams par mi 'gyur zhing mos pa phun sum tshogs pas sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mngon par rab tu dang ba dang /
translated: Because they have vowed to liberate all sentient beings, they do not let their discipline deteriorate even for the sake of their own life or body. With perfect interest, they have perfect faith in the Buddha, Dharma and Sangha.

original: byang chub 'dod pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa la brtson pas sems can thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i phyir nor dang / 'bru dang / rin po che dang / rgyal srid la sogs pa yongs su gtong bar byed cing sems kyi rgyud shes rab yongs su bsgoms par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid thos pa na sems rab tu dga' ba dang ;
analyzed: byang chub 'dod pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa la brtson pas sems can thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i phyir nor dang / 'bru dang / rin po che dang / rgyal srid la sogs pa yongs su gtong bar byed cing sems kyi rgyud shes rab yongs su bsgoms par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid thos pa na sems rab tu dga' ba dang ;
translated: With the wish for enlightenment, they arouse bodhichitta and, striving to make offerings to the Three Jewels, they give away all their possessions, grain, jewels, kingdoms and so forth in order to look after all sentient beings. And because their mindstreams are thoroughly imbued with wisdom, when they hear about emptiness, their minds are filled with joy.

original: sems can bsdu ba la mkhas pa dang / legs par rab tu byung ba dang / legs par bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / dpen pa dang / dben pa la dga' ba dang / bse ru ltar gnyis su med par spyod pa dang / bag yod pas ni gter rnam pa bzhi rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can bsdu ba la mkhas pa dang / legs par rab tu byung ba dang / legs par bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / dpen pa dang / dben pa la dga' ba dang / bse ru ltar gnyis su med par spyod pa dang / bag yod pas ni gter rnam pa bzhi rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and conscientiousness yield four treasures:🔽the treasure of the Tathāgata’s teachings,🔽the treasure of attaining renunciation,🔽the treasure of attaining unshakable faith,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i gter rab tu rnyed pa dang / rab tu byung ba thob pa dang / mi phyed pa'i dad pa thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa ni gter bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i gter rab tu rnyed pa dang / rab tu byung ba thob pa dang / mi phyed pa'i dad pa thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa ni gter bzhi pa'o //
translated: and the treasure of attaining meditative concentration.🔽Similarly, there is the treasure of learning,🔽the treasure of infinite eloquence,

original: de bzhin du thos pa'i gter dang / spobs pa mtha' yas pa'i gter dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad la bag yod pa'i gter ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thos pa'i gter dang / spobs pa mtha' yas pa'i gter dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad la bag yod pa'i gter ro //
translated: and the treasure of conscientiousness with regard to all virtuous qualities.

original: @83b chos dang chos kyi rjes su nan tan byed pa la //
analyzed: @83b chos dang chos kyi rjes su nan tan byed pa la //
translated: With regard to the Dharma and the practice of the Dharma,🔽they delight in the Great Vehicle,🔽and they enter it in order to benefit beings.

original: rab dga' 'gro la phan gdags phyir ni rab zhugs dang // rdzogs byang chub dang sems can gyi la yi rang bzhin //
analyzed: rab dga' 'gro la phan gdags phyir ni rab zhugs dang // rdzogs byang chub dang sems can gyi la yi rang bzhin //
translated: They rejoice in complete enlightenment and in beings’ abilities.

original: bde gshegs nyid kyi rgyu de dag la yi rang ngo //
analyzed: bde gshegs nyid kyi rgyu de dag la yi rang ngo //
translated: I rejoice in those causes of the Sugatas.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the twenty-sixth chapter, the chapter on rejoicing.

original: // / bag yod pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / bag yod pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the conduct of heedfulness is the conduct of the bodhisattva,

original: gzhon nu de lta bas na bag yod par bya'o zhes gzhon nu khyod kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhon nu de lta bas na bag yod par bya'o zhes gzhon nu khyod kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it says, “Therefore, young man, you should train thinking, ‘I will be heedful.’ ”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin nges par bsgrub par bya ba gzhag nas bag yod pa la nan tan du bya ba gang gi phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin nges par bsgrub par bya ba gzhag nas bag yod pa la nan tan du bya ba gang gi phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Having established the definite accomplishment of samādhi, why is it taught that one should be heedful?

original: gzhon nu bag yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rnyed par mi dka' na ting nge 'dzin lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: gzhon nu bag yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rnyed par mi dka' na ting nge 'dzin lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: “Young man, if the unsurpassable, complete and perfect enlightenment is not difficult for a heedful bodhisattva to attain, what need is there to speak of samādhi?”

original: shin tu rnyed par dka' ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu rnyed par dka' ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not mean that it is not very difficult to obtain.

original: ji ltar na bag yod pa yin zhes dris pa dang / rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na bag yod pa yin zhes dris pa dang / rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: He asks how one is heedful, and the cause is stated:

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: One is completely pure in morality.

original: bag med pa ni tshul khrims yongs su dag par mi 'gyur bas ji ltar na tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin zhes bya bas tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i rim pa dris pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa ni tshul khrims yongs su dag par mi 'gyur bas ji ltar na tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin zhes bya bas tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i rim pa dris pa'o //
translated: Since one who is heedless is not completely pure in morality, he asks how one is completely pure in morality, in the sense of how one is heedful.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang ma bral bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems dang ma bral bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One is heedful who is never without the thought of the knowledge of all modes, and who is always concentrated on the six perfections.🔽The Buddha-enlightenment is from the treasure of giving.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni sbyin pa'i gter las yin no zhes bya ba dang por sbyin pa'i phan yon gsungs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni sbyin pa'i gter las yin no zhes bya ba dang por sbyin pa'i phan yon gsungs pa /
translated: The advantage of giving is stated first:

original: gzhon nu byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la mos pa'i phan yon ni bcu ste zhes bya ba la bcu gang zhe na zhes the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dris pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la mos pa'i phan yon ni bcu ste zhes bya ba la bcu gang zhe na zhes the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dris pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: de'i ser sna'i nyon mongs pa tshar bcad pa yin /
analyzed: de'i ser sna'i nyon mongs pa tshar bcad pa yin /
translated: He has destroyed the affliction of stinginess.

original: de'i sems rtag tu gtong ba'i rjes su spel ba yin ;
analyzed: de'i sems rtag tu gtong ba'i rjes su spel ba yin ;
translated: His mind is always expanded by giving.

original: rgyal po dang / me dang / chom rkun la sogs pa dang / thun mong pa'i longs spyod las snying po len pa yin /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / me dang / chom rkun la sogs pa dang / thun mong pa'i longs spyod las snying po len pa yin /
translated: He takes the essence from his wealth, which is shared with kings, fire, thieves, and so on.

original: sbyin pas longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skye ste /
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skye ste /
translated: Through generosity he is reborn in a family with great wealth.

original: longs spyod chen po 'grub pa phangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽des na 'di la skyes ma thag tu gtong ba'i sems @84a * //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po 'grub pa phangs pa'i phyir ro // des na 'di la skyes ma thag tu gtong ba'i sems @84a * //
translated: Because he has accomplished great wealth.

original: mngon du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, as soon as he is born, the thought of giving arises in him.

original: sngon goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is habituated to it.

original: gtong ba po dang / sbyin bdag yin no //
analyzed: gtong ba po dang / sbyin bdag yin no //
translated: He is a giver and a benefactor.

original: zhes sems can thams cad la phangs shing sdug pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes sems can thams cad la phangs shing sdug pa yin no //
translated: He is dear and beloved to all beings.

original: 'jigs pa med cing zhum pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med cing zhum pa med pa ste /
translated: He is fearless and without timidity.

original: 'khor gyi nang du 'gro ba na sbyin pa'i bdag nyid che ba'i stobs kyis thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du 'gro ba na sbyin pa'i bdag nyid che ba'i stobs kyis thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'o //
translated: When he enters the assembly, he overwhelms everyone with the power of his great generosity.

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su de'i tshigs su bcad pa'i sgra rgya cher brjod pa'i grags pa mngon par 'byung ste /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su de'i tshigs su bcad pa'i sgra rgya cher brjod pa'i grags pa mngon par 'byung ste /
translated: The sound of his verses is proclaimed far and wide in all directions.

original: phyogs thams cad nas 'ongs pa'i sems can thams cad la thun mong du sbyin pas rab tu bsgrags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad nas 'ongs pa'i sems can thams cad la thun mong du sbyin pas rab tu bsgrags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is renowned for his generosity to all beings who come from all directions.

original: rkang lag 'jam zhing gzhon sha can yin te /
analyzed: rkang lag 'jam zhing gzhon sha can yin te /
translated: His hands and feet are soft and youthful.

original: sbyin pa'i rgyu mthun pas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gyis spras pa'i lag pa dang / rkang pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rgyu mthun pas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gyis spras pa'i lag pa dang / rkang pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because he has hands and feet marked with the wheels, which are the natural outcome of generosity.

original: rkang mthil mnyam zhing rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rkang mthil mnyam zhing rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: The soles of his feet are even and well-placed.

original: sbyin pa la yid dam bcas pa brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la yid dam bcas pa brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his vow to be generous is firm.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mi 'bral ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du mi 'bral ba'i legs pa ni 'di bcu'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni 'das pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mi 'bral ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du mi 'bral ba'i legs pa ni 'di bcu'o // zhes bya ba ni 'das pa rnams so //
translated: These are the ten.

original: don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni don lhag pa med pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni don lhag pa med pas ma bshad do //
translated: These same topics are stated in verse, but are not explained in prose, because the meaning is not different.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa bzhi las 'di bstan pa //
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa bzhi las 'di bstan pa //
translated: This is taught from among the four kinds of generosity.

original: ma lus bsdus par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo gcig / sbyin pa rnams kyi gtso bor 'di mthong gi / gzhan don zhugs pa rnams la kun kyang gtso //
analyzed: ma lus bsdus par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo gcig / sbyin pa rnams kyi gtso bor 'di mthong gi / gzhan don zhugs pa rnams la kun kyang gtso //
translated: It is the one with the nature of including all, and is seen as the best of the generosities, but all are best for those who are engaged in the welfare of others.

original: sbyin pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the twenty-seventh chapter, the chapter on the benefits of generosity.

original: // / sbyin pa'i rjes su tshul khrims bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: // / sbyin pa'i rjes su tshul khrims bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: The chapter on morality is taught after that on generosity.

original: gzhon nu tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i phan yon ni bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: gzhon nu tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i phan yon ni bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: The benefits of pure morality, O Prince, are ten.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su bskor cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su bskor cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase surrounded by pristine wisdom

original: ye shes la tshul khrims la sogs pas yongs su 'phel bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes la tshul khrims la sogs pas yongs su 'phel bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: means that pristine wisdom is enhanced by morality, etc.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The phrase perfected by

original: dkar po'i chos rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos rnams kyis so //
translated: means perfected with the virtuous qualities.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rjes su slob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa dang rjes su mthun pa rnams 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rjes su slob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa dang rjes su mthun pa rnams 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase training in the footsteps of the Buddhas means that one increases the training of the Tathagatas.

original: mkhas pa @84b rnams kyis ma smad pa ni smad pa'i las mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa @84b rnams kyis ma smad pa ni smad pa'i las mi byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase not despised by the wise means that one does not perform despicable actions.

original: dam bcas pa las mi g-yo ba ni byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba dang / tshul khrims ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa las mi g-yo ba ni byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba dang / tshul khrims ma nyams pa'o //
translated: The phrase not deviating from one's promises means that one does not abandon the thought of awakening and that one does not violate morality.

original: nan tan la gnas pa ni thams cad nan tan gyis sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan la gnas pa ni thams cad nan tan gyis sgrub pa'o //
translated: The phrase residing in practice means that one accomplishes everything through practice.

original: 'khor ba las grol ba ni 'khor ba la mngon par mi zhen pa tsam yin gyi sems can gyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba las grol ba ni 'khor ba la mngon par mi zhen pa tsam yin gyi sems can gyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase liberated from cyclic existence means that one is merely not attached to cyclic existence, but one does not turn one's back on the welfare of sentient beings.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The attainment of nirvana is the mind that is directed toward the ultimate nirvana.

original: kun nas ldang ba med par gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas ldang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba med par gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas ldang ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of agitation is the absence of the agitation of the passions.

original: ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i tshul khrims kyis ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i tshul khrims kyis ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The attainment of samadhi is the realization of samadhi through the morality of nondistraction.

original: dbul po ma yin par 'gyur ba ni chog shes pa'i nor gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: dbul po ma yin par 'gyur ba ni chog shes pa'i nor gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The absence of poverty is the sovereignty of the wealth of contentment.

original: zhes bya bas tshul khrims kyi nor bsags pas tshul khrims kyi phung po rab tu gnas pa'i phan yon ni bcu po 'di dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya bas tshul khrims kyi nor bsags pas tshul khrims kyi phung po rab tu gnas pa'i phan yon ni bcu po 'di dag go //
translated: These are the ten benefits of the stability of the aggregate of morality through the accumulation of the wealth of morality.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rnams ni don lhag pa med pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rnams ni don lhag pa med pas ma bshad do //
translated: The verses are not commented upon because their meaning is self-evident.

original: sangs rgyas yon tan lus pa tshul khrims rgyus byung bas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yon tan lus pa tshul khrims rgyus byung bas //
translated: The Buddha qualities that remain are born from morality.

original: nges par sangs rgyas nyid ni thob 'gyur ba //
analyzed: nges par sangs rgyas nyid ni thob 'gyur ba //
translated: One will certainly attain Buddhahood.

original: tshul khrims mchog ces sangs rgyas yang dag gsungs //
analyzed: tshul khrims mchog ces sangs rgyas yang dag gsungs //
translated: “Morality is supreme,” the Buddha has declared.

original: brtsan 'grus brtsams la rtag tu legs par srungs //🔽tshul khrims nges par bstan pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /🔽// / tshul khrims kyi rjes su bzod pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gzhon nu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽mes mi 'tshig / mtshon gyis mi 'chi /
analyzed: brtsan 'grus brtsams la rtag tu legs par srungs // tshul khrims nges par bstan pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so / // / tshul khrims kyi rjes su bzod pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir / gzhon nu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / mes mi 'tshig / mtshon gyis mi 'chi /
translated: Always well protect the undertaking of effort.

original: dug gis mi tshugs /🔽chus mi 'chi /🔽nyam nga ba ma spangs par 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽lha rnams de la srung bar byed de /🔽bzod pa dang ldan pa de la rtag tu srung ba'o //🔽lus mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa thob par 'gyur te /🔽mtshan rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽des ngan 'gro'i sgo thams cad bcad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dug gis mi tshugs /🔽chus mi 'chi /🔽nyam nga ba ma spangs par 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽lha rnams de la srung bar byed de /🔽bzod pa dang ldan pa de la rtag tu srung ba'o //🔽lus mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa thob par 'gyur te /🔽mtshan rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽des ngan 'gro'i sgo thams cad bcad par 'gyur te /
translated: This completes the commentary on the twenty-eighth chapter of the Bodhicharyavatara, on morality.

original: bzod thob ngan song ltung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bzod thob ngan song ltung mi 'gyur //
translated: One who has attained patience will not fall into bad rebirths.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba rnyed par dka' bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba rnyed par dka' bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not difficult for him to be reborn in the Brahma world,

original: bzod pa ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir @85a * //
analyzed: bzod pa ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir @85a * //
translated: because patience is the essence of the Brahma-viharas.

original: ro ; / de bde bar nyin mtshan 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ro ; / de bde bar nyin mtshan 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: He passes his days and nights in happiness,

original: sdug bsngal dang phrad par byas pa'i gnod pa thams cad bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang phrad par byas pa'i gnod pa thams cad bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has patience with all the injuries that others inflict on him.

original: de'i lus la dga' ba dang bde ba mi 'dor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i lus la dga' ba dang bde ba mi 'dor bar 'gyur te /
translated: He does not lose the joy and happiness of body,

original: bzod pa ni bde ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa ni bde ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because patience is the essence of happiness.

original: bcu po 'di dag ni bzod pa la rab tu gnas pa'i phan yon yin no //
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni bzod pa la rab tu gnas pa'i phan yon yin no //
translated: These are the benefits of patience.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the verses is self-evident.

original: rdzogs sangs rkang gnyis mchog gyur pas //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rkang gnyis mchog gyur pas //
translated: The Buddha, the best of bipeds,

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum gsungs pas //
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum gsungs pas //
translated: has taught three kinds of patience:🔽Patience in putting up with what is painful,

original: stong nyid chos la bzod pa las //
analyzed: stong nyid chos la bzod pa las //
translated: patience in accepting the ultimate reality of things,

original: gzhan dag bzod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag bzod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and patience in not retaliating against injury.

original: tshul khrims kyi le'u nas brtsams nas le'u'i grangs med de mthar phan yon bcu ste zhes bya ba'i le'u'i bar du'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi le'u nas brtsams nas le'u'i grangs med de mthar phan yon bcu ste zhes bya ba'i le'u'i bar du'o //
translated: The chapter on morality is the first, and the chapter on the benefits is the last.

original: brtson 'grus kyi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The benefits of effort are taught in order to show the benefits of effort.🔽The benefits are ten, as stated in the sutra:

original: gzhon nu phan yon ni 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu phan yon ni 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Prince, there are ten benefits.

original: bsnyen par dka' bar 'gyur ba ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis yon tan thams cad shin tu mthar thug par 'gro ba nyid kyis zil gyis mnan par sla ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par dka' bar 'gyur ba ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis yon tan thams cad shin tu mthar thug par 'gro ba nyid kyis zil gyis mnan par sla ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to overcome because, through the power of effort, one becomes difficult to overcome due to the perfection of all good qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gzung ba thob pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gzung ba thob pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs pa'o //
translated: One obtains the protection of the Buddhas means one is considered by the Buddhas.

original: lhas yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba ni sgrib pa las srung zhing sbed par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: lhas yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba ni sgrib pa las srung zhing sbed par byed pa'o ;
translated: One is protected by the gods means one is guarded and concealed from obscurations.

original: / des thos pa'i chos yongs su mi nyams pa ni de rtag tu 'don par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / des thos pa'i chos yongs su mi nyams pa ni de rtag tu 'don par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not lose the Dharma one has heard means one always recites it.

original: sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams thos pa ni brtson 'grus kyis sngon ma thos pa'i chos thos pa'o //
analyzed: sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams thos pa ni brtson 'grus kyis sngon ma thos pa'i chos thos pa'o //
translated: Hearing the Dharma that has not been heard is the hearing of the Dharma that has not been heard through effort.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rigs 'thob pa ni chos gzhan dag kyang thams cad ting nge 'dzin gyi rigs 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rigs 'thob pa ni chos gzhan dag kyang thams cad ting nge 'dzin gyi rigs 'thob pa ste /
translated: Obtaining the lineage of concentration is the obtaining of the lineage of all other Dharmas through concentration.

original: mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the turning towards.

original: nad nyung bar 'gyur ba ni nad kyi gnyen po'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad nyung bar 'gyur ba ni nad kyi gnyen po'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having few illnesses is because the Dharma is taught as the antidote to illness.

original: de'i zas rnams kyang bde bar 'ju bar 'gyur ba ni khams mi bde ba med pa'i rgyu chos la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zas rnams kyang bde bar 'ju bar 'gyur ba ni khams mi bde ba med pa'i rgyu chos la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: His foods are easily digested because the cause of the absence of an unhealthy humoral constitution is the Dharma.

original: padma lta bur 'gyur zhing mnga' ste ka ma lta bur mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rim gyis dkar po'i chos rnams 'phel par 'gyur zhing 'khor ba'i nyes pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa yin gyi lcags mda' ste ka ltar rim gyis zad pa dang /
analyzed: padma lta bur 'gyur zhing mnga' ste ka ma lta bur mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rim gyis dkar po'i chos rnams 'phel par 'gyur zhing 'khor ba'i nyes pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa yin gyi lcags mda' ste ka ltar rim gyis zad pa dang /
translated: He becomes like a lotus, not like a lotus flower. The white Dharmas increase gradually, and he is not defiled by the mud of the faults of cyclic existence. He is not like an iron arrow, which gradually diminishes and

original: sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: does not generate suffering.

original: 'di dag ni brtson @85b 'grus brtsams pa'i phan yon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni brtson @85b 'grus brtsams pa'i phan yon zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the benefits of undertaking perseverance.

original: don de dag nyid bde bar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: don de dag nyid bde bar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa /
translated: In order to easily understand those topics, he also taught in verse:

original: bsnyen dka' bar yang rtag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: bsnyen dka' bar yang rtag tu 'gyur //
translated: “One always becomes difficult to corrupt,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As before.🔽The Tathāgatas, after beginning perseverance for immeasurable eons, attained unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang bskal pa dpag tu med par brtson 'grus brtsams pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes brtson 'grus brtsoms la rnal 'byor la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang bskal pa dpag tu med par brtson 'grus brtsams pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes brtson 'grus brtsoms la rnal 'byor la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should begin perseverance and be devoted to yoga.

original: bdag gzhan don ldan byang chub sems mchog gi / brtson 'grus kyis ni bzang po kun 'thob cing ;
analyzed: bdag gzhan don ldan byang chub sems mchog gi / brtson 'grus kyis ni bzang po kun 'thob cing ;
translated: Through the perseverance of the supreme thought of awakening, which is endowed with the benefit of self and other, one obtains all that is good.

original: /'jig rten 'das pa'i sangs rgyas yon tan kun //
analyzed: /'jig rten 'das pa'i sangs rgyas yon tan kun //
translated: The qualities of the transcendent buddhas are all accomplished

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i sbyor bas yang dag 'grub //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i sbyor bas yang dag 'grub //
translated: through the application of beginning perseverance.

original: da ni bsam gtan gyi phan yon rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan gyi phan yon rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to thoroughly teach the benefits of meditative stabilization, he said:

original: gzhon nu bsam gtan la mos pa'i phan yon ni bcu ste zhes bya ba sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: gzhon nu bsam gtan la mos pa'i phan yon ni bcu ste zhes bya ba sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: The benefits of being devoted to the meditative concentrations are tenfold.

original: spyod pa la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las kun du mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las kun du mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: One abides in the bodhisattva conduct, that is, one does not transgress the bodhisattva conduct.

original: spyod yul la spyod pa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la spyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: spyod yul la spyod pa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la spyod pa nyid do //
translated: One practices in the domain, that is, one practices the levels, perfections, and so forth.

original: yongs su gdung ba med par gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba nye bar zhi bas bsam gtan gyi bde ba la gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med par gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba nye bar zhi bas bsam gtan gyi bde ba la gnas pa nyid do //
translated: One abides without torment, that is, one abides in the bliss of meditative concentration, since the torment of defilements has been pacified.

original: dbang po sbas par 'gyur ba ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pas sbas pa ste dbang po rnams yul las log par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po sbas par 'gyur ba ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pas sbas pa ste dbang po rnams yul las log par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One’s faculties are hidden, that is, they are hidden by constant meditative equipoise, and the faculties are turned inward from their objects.

original: dga' ba myong ba ni bsam gtan las skyes pa yin gyi yul dang yul can las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba myong ba ni bsam gtan las skyes pa yin gyi yul dang yul can las ni ma yin no //
translated: One experiences joy, which arises from the meditative concentrations, not from objects and sense faculties.

original: 'dod pa las dben pa ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa las dben pa ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: One is free from desire, that is, one is free from craving for sense objects.

original: bsam gtan gyis tshim pa med pa ni bsam gtan gyi bde bas ngoms pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis tshim pa med pa ni bsam gtan gyi bde bas ngoms pa med pa'o //
translated: Lack of satisfaction in meditation is not being sated with the bliss of meditation.

original: bdud kyi yul las thar pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i bdud kyis ma g-yos pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdud kyi yul las thar pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i bdud kyis ma g-yos pa nyid do //
translated: Liberation from the domain of Mara is not being shaken by the Mara of conceptual thought.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul la rab tu gnas pa ni snying rje chen po dang byang chub kyi sems kyis yongs su bzung ba'i bsam gtan bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul la rab tu gnas pa ni snying rje chen po dang byang chub kyi sems kyis yongs su bzung ba'i bsam gtan bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: Abiding in the domain of the Buddhas is the cultivation of meditation which is sustained by great compassion and the spirit of enlightenment.

original: rnam par grol ba rab tu smin par byed pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba yongs su gso ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rab tu smin par byed pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba yongs su gso ba'o //
translated: Maturation of liberation is the purification of the vision of the intuition of liberation.

original: bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' @86a * //
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' @86a * //
translated: These are the ten benefits for the bodhisattva

original: bsam gtan la mos pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: bsam gtan la mos pa'i phan yon no //
translated: who is intent on meditation.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rnams ni don tha dad pa med bsam bshad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rnams ni don tha dad pa med bsam bshad do //
translated: The verses have no different meanings.

original: sa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan mngon ldan pa //
analyzed: sa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan mngon ldan pa //
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with meditation on this stage

original: dus rnams kun du dga' ba mchog ni nyams su myong //
analyzed: dus rnams kun du dga' ba mchog ni nyams su myong //
translated: experiences the highest joy at all times.

original: dpag med yon tan yang dag ldan pa yin //
analyzed: dpag med yon tan yang dag ldan pa yin //
translated: is endowed with the perfection of immeasurable good qualities.

original: rnam mang sangs rgyas sa 'dir myur du 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam mang sangs rgyas sa 'dir myur du 'gyur //
translated: He quickly becomes a Buddha on this manifold stage.

original: shes rab la rnam par gnas pa'i phan yon bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: shes rab la rnam par gnas pa'i phan yon bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: The advantages of being established in wisdom are taught:

original: gzhon nu shes rab spyod pa'i phan yon ni bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhon nu shes rab spyod pa'i phan yon ni bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Prince, the advantages of practicing wisdom are tenfold.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Giving away all possessions is giving away things that are internal and external.

original: sbyin pas dag par rlom sems mi byed pa ni shes rab dang bral ba'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod tsam nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pas dag par rlom sems mi byed pa ni shes rab dang bral ba'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod tsam nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Not being conceited about being purified by giving is because the result of giving that is devoid of wisdom is only wealth.

original: tshul khrims ma ral ba ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma ral ba ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Having unbroken morality is perfecting it.

original: tshul khrims la mi gnas pa ni chos thams cad gnas med par nyams su myong ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims la mi gnas pa ni chos thams cad gnas med par nyams su myong ba nyid do //
translated: Not being established in morality is experiencing all phenomena as groundless.

original: bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa ni chos za bo bzod pa la gnas pa ni sems can gyi 'du shes dang bral bas sems can gyi 'du shes la mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa ni chos za bo bzod pa la gnas pa ni sems can gyi 'du shes dang bral bas sems can gyi 'du shes la mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: He who is established in the power of forbearance is established in the forbearance that is the food of Dharma, and he does not stand in the notion of a sentient being, being free from the notion of a sentient being.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi brtson 'grus yid la byed pa mi dmigs pa la legs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi brtson 'grus yid la byed pa mi dmigs pa la legs par gnas pa'o //
translated: He who has begun striving is well established in the nondiscernment of the mental orientation to the striving of body, speech, and mind.

original: bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed pa ni thams cad la mi gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed pa ni thams cad la mi gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: He who is intent on meditation is the yogin who does not stand in anything.

original: bdud rnams kyis thub par dka' ba ni bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'jig pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par 'byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdud rnams kyis thub par dka' ba ni bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'jig pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par 'byed pa nyid do //
translated: He who is difficult for the demons to overcome is the one who is discerning through the wisdom that destroys the entire circle of demons.

original: pha rol rgol ba thams cad kyis rab tu mi bsgul ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis pha rol rgol ba thams cad mi dmigs par byas nas legs par gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol rgol ba thams cad kyis rab tu mi bsgul ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis pha rol rgol ba thams cad mi dmigs par byas nas legs par gnas pa nyid do //
translated: He who is unmoved by any adversary is well established through the supramundane wisdom that makes all adversaries imperceptible.

original: snang ba 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'du byed 'jug pa thams cad mi shes pa'i mun pa rnams par sel ba'i shes rab kyi snang ba shar ba nyid kyis sems can thams cad la snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung ba'i shes rab thams cad du
analyzed: snang ba 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'du byed 'jug pa thams cad mi shes pa'i mun pa rnams par sel ba'i shes rab kyi snang ba shar ba nyid kyis sems can thams cad la snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung ba'i shes rab thams cad du
translated: The line “he attains the light” means that, by the arising of the light of wisdom that dispels the darkness of ignorance about all the workings of karma, he enters into all wisdoms that are embraced by great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: 'jug gi // nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis la 'dod par mi 'gyur bas dman pa la @86b mos pa'i sems mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug gi // nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis la 'dod par mi 'gyur bas dman pa la @86b mos pa'i sems mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: He does not generate the thought of being content with the lesser vehicle, because he does not aspire to the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la rab tu 'jug pa ni de la mngon par mos pas rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la rab tu 'jug pa ni de la mngon par mos pas rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: He enters into the buddhas’ meditative stabilities, samādhis, and absorptions, because he enters into them with a strong aspiration.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni tha dad med pas ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni tha dad med pas ma bkrol lo //
translated: The meaning of the verses is not explained separately.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bag yod legs pa'i shes rab snang ba gsal //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bag yod legs pa'i shes rab snang ba gsal //
translated: The bodhisattva is heedful, and the light of his wisdom shines well.

original: ye shes snang ba las 'phros snying rjes sems can kun gyi gnyen //
analyzed: ye shes snang ba las 'phros snying rjes sems can kun gyi gnyen //
translated: He is the friend of all sentient beings, because he radiates the light of wisdom and compassion.

original: dngos dang dngos med 'byung dang 'gog pa ma lus 'khrul pa tsam //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med 'byung dang 'gog pa ma lus 'khrul pa tsam //
translated: The entire origination and cessation of things and non-things is mere error.

original: yongs su rtogs nas bde bar gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs nas bde bar gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Having fully understood, one becomes the bliss-gone buddhahood.

original: da ni mang du thos pa'i phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhon nu phan yon ni 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: da ni mang du thos pa'i phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhon nu phan yon ni 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now, in order to teach the benefits of much hearing, it is said, Young man, the benefits are these ten... and so on.

original: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni thams cad du nye bar bstan pa'i tshig yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni thams cad du nye bar bstan pa'i tshig yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: What are they? should be understood as a phrase that is to be applied everywhere.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs shes par byas nas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spong ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs shes par byas nas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spong ba ste /
translated: Having understood the aspects of defilement and purification, one abandons the aspect of defilement.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin no zhes shes nas spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin no zhes shes nas spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Having understood that the ten unwholesome courses of action are the aspect of defilement, one abandons them.

original: the tshom rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la rnam par phye nas bstan pas nges par bskyed nas the tshom sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la rnam par phye nas bstan pas nges par bskyed nas the tshom sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The one called “resolving doubts” is the one that removes doubts by generating certainty through teaching sentient beings after analyzing.

original: lta ba drang por byed pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba ngan pa dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur lta ba dang / mi mnyam pa'i rgyu gtso bo la sogs pa'i lta ba las bzlog nas yang dag pa'i lta ba la rab tu 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba drang por byed pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba ngan pa dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur lta ba dang / mi mnyam pa'i rgyu gtso bo la sogs pa'i lta ba las bzlog nas yang dag pa'i lta ba la rab tu 'jog pa ste /
translated: The one called “straightening views” is the one that, having turned away from bad views such as the view that Īśvara and so on are the cause, and the view that the unequal cause is the principal one and so on, establishes in the correct view.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis lta ba drang por byed do ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis lta ba drang por byed do ;
translated: It straightens views in that way.

original: / lam log pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni gti mug las skyes pa'i mchod sbyin la srog gcod pa la sogs pa spong du 'jug cing bdag nyid kyang mu stegs la sogs pa'i lam las ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / lam log pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni gti mug las skyes pa'i mchod sbyin la srog gcod pa la sogs pa spong du 'jug cing bdag nyid kyang mu stegs la sogs pa'i lam las ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The one called “abandoning wrong paths” is the one that causes one to engage in abandoning killing and so on that arise from delusion, and it causes one to turn away from the paths of the tīrthikas and so on.

original: lam la rab tu gnas pa ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i chos la nan tan byed pas sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam mo //
analyzed: lam la rab tu gnas pa ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i chos la nan tan byed pas sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam mo //
translated: The one called “established in the path” is the path to buddhahood because it causes one to practice the Dharma that causes one to attain buddhahood.

original: sems can thams cad la snang bar gyur pa ni rmongs pa'i mun pa nye bar sle bar nus pa'i bstan bcos thams cad thos pas gsal bar gyur pa'o //🔽ngan 'gro thams cad kyis mi 'jigs pa ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar byed pa'i las mi byed @87a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snang bar gyur pa ni rmongs pa'i mun pa nye bar sle bar nus pa'i bstan bcos thams cad thos pas gsal bar gyur pa'o // ngan 'gro thams cad kyis mi 'jigs pa ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar byed pa'i las mi byed @87a * //
translated: The phrase they become a light for all sentient beings means that they become clear by listening to all the treatises that are able to dispel the darkness of delusion.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase they become fearless with regard to all miserable realms means that they do not perform actions that lead to miserable realms.

original: bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' mang du thos pa'i phan yon yin no //
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' mang du thos pa'i phan yon yin no //
translated: These are the ten benefits of being learned.

original: ma lus don rnams mdzad pa thub pa'i dbang po bzhin //
analyzed: ma lus don rnams mdzad pa thub pa'i dbang po bzhin //
translated: The verse Like the Lord of Sages, they accomplish the aims of all beings without exception praises the bodhisattvas' activities.

original: mang du thos shing chos rnams rnam 'byed la mkhas shing //
analyzed: mang du thos shing chos rnams rnam 'byed la mkhas shing //
translated: The verse They are learned and skilled in discerning phenomena,

original: ma lus bstan bcos don rnams 'byed par bzod pa yis ;
analyzed: ma lus bstan bcos don rnams 'byed par bzod pa yis ;
translated: and with patience they analyze the meanings of all the treatises.

original: / shin tu dri ma med pa sems can don du byas //
analyzed: / shin tu dri ma med pa sems can don du byas //
translated: They are very pure and work for the welfare of sentient beings praises the bodhisattvas' wisdom.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa'i phan yon ni gzhon nu chos sbyin pa'i phan yon ni 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa'i phan yon ni gzhon nu chos sbyin pa'i phan yon ni 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The verse The benefits of generosity with the Dharma are tenfold praises the bodhisattvas' generosity with the Dharma.

original: bya ba ma yin pa spong ba ni bya ba ma yin pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa spong ba ni bya ba ma yin pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The avoidance of what should not be done is because of teaching the Dharma that is the antidote to what should not be done.

original: bya ba la 'jug pa ni yang dag pa'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba la 'jug pa ni yang dag pa'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The engagement in what should be done is because of teaching the right path.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i chos la 'god pa ni bdag nyid kyang de lta bur gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i chos la 'god pa ni bdag nyid kyang de lta bur gnas pa'o //
translated: The establishment of good people in the Dharma is because of one's own abiding in that way.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba ni sems rnam par dag pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba ni sems rnam par dag pas /
translated: The purification of the Buddha-field is because of the purification of mind.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that the Buddha-field becomes pure through the purification of mind.

original: byang chub kyi snying po thob par byed pa ni chos kyi sbyin pas chos kyi sku 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gis byang chub kyi snying po ni byang chub dam pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po thob par byed pa ni chos kyi sbyin pas chos kyi sku 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gis byang chub kyi snying po ni byang chub dam pa ste /
translated: The attainment of the site of enlightenment is because of the attainment of the Dharma-body through the gift of the Dharma. The site of enlightenment is the highest enlightenment,

original: chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'o //
translated: which is the Dharma-body.

original: thob par byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thob par byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Attainment is the accomplishment.

original: dngos po yongs su gtong ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pas dngos por mngon par zhen pa yongs su 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su gtong ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pas dngos por mngon par zhen pa yongs su 'dor ba'o //
translated: The giving of things is the giving up of attachment to things by realizing that all things are insubstantial.

original: gzhan du na skye ba med pa la gtong ba yang med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na skye ba med pa la gtong ba yang med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no giving of the unproduced.

original: nyon mongs pa tshar gcod pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams nus pa thams cad dang bral bar byed pas tshar gcod par byed kyi bcing ba dang dgag pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa tshar gcod pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams nus pa thams cad dang bral bar byed pas tshar gcod par byed kyi bcing ba dang dgag pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The destruction of the afflictions is the destruction of the afflictions by removing all their efficacy, not by binding or stopping them.

original: sems can thams cad la skal ba'i shas sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma god par sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas lhag pa'i bsam pas sems can thams cad la bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la skal ba'i shas sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma god par sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas lhag pa'i bsam pas sems can thams cad la bsngo ba'o //
translated: The giving of a share to all beings is the dedication to all beings of all one’s wholesome roots, without reservation, with an exalted intention.

original: de la dmigs pa'i byams pa bsgom pa ni sems can thams cad nges par gzung ba'i phyir sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po sgom par byed cing mthong ba'i chos la ni bde ba thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i byams pa bsgom pa ni sems can thams cad nges par gzung ba'i phyir sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po sgom par byed cing mthong ba'i chos la ni bde ba thob par 'gyur la /
translated: The cultivation of love that has that as its object is the cultivation of great compassion that has sentient beings as its object, that has the Dharma as its object, and that has no object, in order to take hold of all sentient beings.🔽And in this very life, he obtains happiness.

original: chos sbyin pa dang dus mnyam @87b pa nyid du ni dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa dang dus mnyam @87b pa nyid du ni dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And at the very time of giving the Dharma, he obtains joy and delight.

original: zhes bya ba bcu po ni chos kyi sbyin pa'i pha yon no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bcu po ni chos kyi sbyin pa'i pha yon no //
translated: These are the ten virtues of giving the Dharma.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the verses is selfevident.🔽The Buddha has praised the gift of the true Dharma,

original: bde ba dpag med 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa //🔽dam chos sbyin pa sangs rgyas kyis rab bsngags //
analyzed: bde ba dpag med 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa // dam chos sbyin pa sangs rgyas kyis rab bsngags //
translated: which is the cause of the arising of immeasurable happiness.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa las lhag gzhan med pas //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa las lhag gzhan med pas //
translated: There is nothing superior to the gift of the Dharma.

original: de phyir chos kyi sbyin pa rab tu sbyin par bya //
analyzed: de phyir chos kyi sbyin pa rab tu sbyin par bya //
translated: Therefore, one should give the gift of the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i pha nyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i pha nyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the benefits of abiding in emptiness to the Bodhisattvas,

original: gzhon nu stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phan yon ni 'di bcu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhon nu stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phan yon ni 'di bcu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it says, “Young man, there are these ten benefits of abiding in emptiness.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa la gnas pa ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa la gnas pa ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa nyid de /
translated: Abiding in the Buddha’s abode is abiding in emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: It is the Buddha’s abode.

original: mi gnas par bsam gtan byed pa ni gnas la dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi gnas par bsam gtan byed pa ni gnas la dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Meditation without abiding is the absence of reference to an abode.

original: skye ba la mi smon pa ni chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir khams gsum du skye ba dmigs su med pa nyid do //🔽tshul khrims la mchog tu mi 'dzin pa ni bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la mi smon pa ni chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir khams gsum du skye ba dmigs su med pa nyid do // tshul khrims la mchog tu mi 'dzin pa ni bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Not wishing for rebirth is the absence of reference to rebirth in the three realms, because all phenomena are empty.

original: tshul khrims ni 'di'i don du tshul khrims srung ngo zhes gsum la mchog tu lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'di'i don du tshul khrims srung ngo zhes gsum la mchog tu lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: Not holding ethics as paramount is the absence of the three concepts: “I am ethical,” “Ethics is for this purpose,” and “I will guard ethics.”

original: 'phags pa la mi skur ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa la nan tan byed pa yang mngon par mi nyams par mthong bas stong pa nyid la gnas na yang /
analyzed: 'phags pa la mi skur ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa la nan tan byed pa yang mngon par mi nyams par mthong bas stong pa nyid la gnas na yang /
translated: Not to disparage the noble ones means that when one abides in emptiness, one sees that one will not degenerate in one's practice of the realizations of the noble shravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ci yang med do zhes skur pa mi 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med do zhes skur pa mi 'debs pa'o //
translated: Not deprecating the noble ones means that, since one sees that the noble śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not fall away from their realizations, even when one abides in emptiness, one does not deprecate them by saying, “They are nothing.”

original: mi 'gal bar gnas pa ni thams cad du chos 'gal ba ma dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'gal bar gnas pa ni thams cad du chos 'gal ba ma dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: Abiding without contradiction means that one does not observe any contradiction between phenomena.

original: dngos po mi dmigs pa ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bor yongs su ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po mi dmigs pa ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bor yongs su ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Non-observation of things means that things that are of the nature of the inner and outer are not established as their own nature.

original: 'du byed thams cad stong pa'o zhes nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad stong pa'o zhes nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one realizes that all compounded things are empty.

original: dben par 'gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis dben pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben par 'gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis dben pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Becoming secluded means that one abides in the meditative absorption of emptiness, which is secluded from all afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas la skur pa mi 'debs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bstan pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i lta ba yin gyi gang gzhan dag tu gang zag la sogs pa bstan pa ni dgongs pa can ma yin gyi @88a *
analyzed: sangs rgyas la skur pa mi 'debs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bstan pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i lta ba yin gyi gang gzhan dag tu gang zag la sogs pa bstan pa ni dgongs pa can ma yin gyi @88a *
translated: Not deprecating the Buddha means that the Lord's teaching of the emptiness of all dharmas is the view of nonapprehending, but that the teachings of persons, etc. in other sutras are not intentional,

original: // bden pa nyid yin no zhes ston par byed na de de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: // bden pa nyid yin no zhes ston par byed na de de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
translated: but are the truth itself.

original: dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa ni klog pa dang kha ton la sogs pas lung gi chos 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa ni klog pa dang kha ton la sogs pas lung gi chos 'dzin par byed do //
translated: One upholds the holy Dharma by holding the Dharma of transmission through reading, recitation, etc.

original: rtogs pa'i chos ni mngon sum du byed pas 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid sgom pa kho na dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phan yon yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos ni mngon sum du byed pas 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid sgom pa kho na dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phan yon yin no //
translated: One upholds the Dharma of realization by actualizing it. Therefore, the mere meditation on emptiness is the upholding of the holy Dharma. This is the benefit of abiding in emptiness.

original: ma lus stong par rnal 'byor pas shes kyang //
analyzed: ma lus stong par rnal 'byor pas shes kyang //
translated: The yogi/nī knows that all is empty,

original: lus rnams thams cad rjes su mthun par byed //
analyzed: lus rnams thams cad rjes su mthun par byed //
translated: but acts in accordance with the bodies of others.

original: dpa' bo khams gsum dag na mi 'jigs pas //
analyzed: dpa' bo khams gsum dag na mi 'jigs pas //
translated: The hero is fearless in the three worlds.

original: 'dir ni byang chub rang bzhin sangs rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub rang bzhin sangs rgyas 'gyur //
translated: Here, he becomes a Buddha, the nature of enlightenment.

original: da ni nang du yang dag 'jog gi phan yon bstan par 'dod nas //
analyzed: da ni nang du yang dag 'jog gi phan yon bstan par 'dod nas //
translated: Now, wishing to teach the benefits of inner proper attention,

original: gzhon nu nang du yang dag 'jog gi phan yon ni 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhon nu nang du yang dag 'jog gi phan yon ni 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Young man, the benefits of inner proper attention are these ten.”

original: sems rnyog pa med pa ni sems nyon mongs pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems rnyog pa med pa ni sems nyon mongs pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa nyid do //
translated: A stainless mind is the mind that is not soiled by the mud of the afflictions.

original: bag yod par gnas pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir bag med pa'i gnas spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: bag yod par gnas pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir bag med pa'i gnas spangs pa nyid do //
translated: Dwelling in heedfulness is the abandonment of the state of heedlessness because of always being in equipoise.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni nang du yang dag 'jog gi sangs rgyas kyi yul mngon par dran pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni nang du yang dag 'jog gi sangs rgyas kyi yul mngon par dran pa nyid do //
translated: Recollection of the Buddha is the recollection of the domain of the Buddha that is inner proper attention.

original: chos la dad pa nyid ni lung dang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dag la thams cad du slu ba med pa nyid du dad pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dad pa nyid ni lung dang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dag la thams cad du slu ba med pa nyid du dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in the Dharma is faith in the scriptures and realizations that they are never deceptive.

original: ye shes la nem nur med pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yod dam med dam pa dag gis thob bam mi 'thob ces theg tshom za ba med pa nyid do //🔽sangs rgyas la byas pa gzo ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos rnams thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis yon tan 'di dag 'byung ngo zhes shes nas de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang /
analyzed: ye shes la nem nur med pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yod dam med dam pa dag gis thob bam mi 'thob ces theg tshom za ba med pa nyid do // sangs rgyas la byas pa gzo ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos rnams thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis yon tan 'di dag 'byung ngo zhes shes nas de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang /
translated: Lack of doubt about pristine wisdom is the absence of doubt, such as Is there or is there not the pristine wisdom of omniscience? or Is it or is it not attained?

original: mchod pa la sogs pa la rtag tu 'jug pa nyid do //🔽chos mi spong ba ni chos bstan pa thos na sangs rgyas mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa la rtag tu 'jug pa nyid do // chos mi spong ba ni chos bstan pa thos na sangs rgyas mthong ba yin no //
translated: Appreciation of the Buddha is the constant engagement in seeing the Tathagata, in paying homage to him, in making offerings to him, and so on, with the knowledge, These good qualities arise through the power of hearing, contemplating, and meditating on the teachings revealed by the Tathagata.

original: de'i phyir chos spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Non-rejection of the teaching is the knowledge, When I hear the teaching, I see the Buddha, and therefore I should not reject the teaching.

original: de spangs pas dkon mchog gsum spangs pa yin pas de la ngan 'gro'i 'gro ba las 'gro ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes shes nas spong bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs pas dkon mchog gsum spangs pa yin pas de la ngan 'gro'i 'gro ba las 'gro ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes shes nas spong bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Since, by rejecting it, one rejects the Three Jewels, one should not reject it, knowing that there is no other destiny for me than the miserable destinies.

original: shin tu bsdams @88b par gnas pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdom pa blangs pa ma nyams pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu bsdams @88b par gnas pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdom pa blangs pa ma nyams pa nyid do //
translated: Abiding in very strict self-control means that the vow of the body, speech, and mind has been taken and not violated.

original: dul pa'i sa rjes su 'thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang rjes su mthun pa'i nang du yang dag 'jog pa brten par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dul pa'i sa rjes su 'thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang rjes su mthun pa'i nang du yang dag 'jog pa brten par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Attaining the stage of self-control means that one will be able to rely on the inner meditative practice that is in accord with the stage of the Buddha.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mngon sum du byed pa ni ji skad gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa nyid kyis mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mngon sum du byed pa ni ji skad gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa nyid kyis mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The direct realization of the four analytical knowledges means that one will be able to realize the meditative development of the meditative absorption that has been taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nang du yang dag 'jog la mngon par sbyor ba'i phan yon ni bcu po 'di dag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nang du yang dag 'jog la mngon par sbyor ba'i phan yon ni bcu po 'di dag go //
translated: These are the ten benefits for the bodhisattva who is devoted to inner meditative practice.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse is selfevident.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi so so rang rig pa //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi so so rang rig pa //
translated: The Sugata's spiritual heir,

original: rgyal ba kun gyis rab tu bsngags pa'i bsam gtan gyis //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyis rab tu bsngags pa'i bsam gtan gyis //
translated: by means of the meditative absorption that is praised by all the victors,

original: rtag tu de nyid la ni thim par gyur de 'dir //
analyzed: rtag tu de nyid la ni thim par gyur de 'dir //
translated: always dissolves into that reality here.

original: des na de la nang du yang dag 'jog ces bya //
analyzed: des na de la nang du yang dag 'jog ces bya //
translated: Therefore, it is called “correct meditative practice.”

original: dgon pa na gnas pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the benefits of dwelling in the forest, he says:

original: gzhon nu bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhon nu bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Young man, these ten benefits accrue to the bodhisattva mahāsattva🔽who dwells in the forest.”

original: bya ba nyung bar gnas pa ni khyim gyi bya ba mang po spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba nyung bar gnas pa ni khyim gyi bya ba mang po spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dwelling in few activities means that one has abandoned many household activities.

original: 'du 'dzi ring du spong ba na mang po tshogs nas bre mo'i gtam byed pa dben pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su byas nas spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi ring du spong ba na mang po tshogs nas bre mo'i gtam byed pa dben pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su byas nas spong ba'o //
translated: Abandoning far away the hustle and bustle means that one abandons the opposite of solitude, which is to gather in a group and engage in frivolous conversation.

original: de la rtsod pa med par 'gyur ba ni nags na rtsod pa'i zla med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtsod pa med par 'gyur ba ni nags na rtsod pa'i zla med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Being free from disputes means that there is no one in the forest with whom one might dispute.

original: gnod pa med par gnas pa ni gang la yang mi bzod pa'i sems kyis gnod pa'i sems ma skyes pas gzhan du yang gnod pa'i bsam pa bskyed par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med par gnas pa ni gang la yang mi bzod pa'i sems kyis gnod pa'i sems ma skyes pas gzhan du yang gnod pa'i bsam pa bskyed par mi bya ba'o //
translated: Dwelling without harm means that, since one has not given rise to a harmful mind out of an impatient attitude toward anyone, one should not give rise to a harmful attitude toward others.

original: yang na nad thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nad kyi rjes su gnod pa med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na nad thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nad kyi rjes su gnod pa med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, it means that one is free from harm in the wake of illness, because one is free from all disease.

original: zag pa 'phel bar mi byed pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu las byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa 'phel bar mi byed pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu las byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mi byed pa'o //
translated: He does not increase the defilements, because he does not cause the karma and moral defilement which arise from the causes of passion, aversion and confusion.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir mi byed pa ni ltung ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni dgon pa de na 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir med pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir mi byed pa ni ltung ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni dgon pa de na 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir med pa'o //
translated: He does not cause the basis of dispute, because the dispute which arises from the cause of a downfall is non-existent in that wilderness, since there are no Vinaya or Sutra experts there.

original: shin tu zhi bar spyod pa ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len nye bar zhi ba'i phyir dgon pa na nye bar zhi bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu zhi bar spyod pa ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len nye bar zhi ba'i phyir dgon pa na nye bar zhi bar spyod pa'o //
translated: He is one who practices complete peace, because he practices complete peace in the wilderness through the pacification of the negative propensities of body, speech and mind.

original: shin tu bsdams par gnas pa ni sdom pa gsum gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sdom pa thams cad kyis bsdams pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bsdams par gnas pa ni sdom pa gsum gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sdom pa thams cad kyis bsdams pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is one who abides in complete restraint, because he is restrained by all the moral precepts included in the three systems of moral training.

original: @89a * // thar pa dang mthun pa'i sems kyi rgyud du 'gyur ba ni dus thams cad du mya ngan las 'das pa la zhen pa'i sems kyis gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: @89a * // thar pa dang mthun pa'i sems kyi rgyud du 'gyur ba ni dus thams cad du mya ngan las 'das pa la zhen pa'i sems kyis gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The mind-stream becomes conducive to liberation because it always abides in the mind that is intent on nirvana.

original: rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa ni rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba la zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa ni rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba la zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: The direct realization of liberation is the entry into the direct realization of liberation.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse is self-evident.🔽The yogi/nī who is intent on the highest yoga

original: stong nyid dgon pa'i dbus gnas pa'i //🔽rnal 'byor mchog gzhol rnal 'byor pa //🔽rga shi med pa'i sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: stong nyid dgon pa'i dbus gnas pa'i // rnal 'byor mchog gzhol rnal 'byor pa // rga shi med pa'i sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: in the midst of the wilderness of emptiness🔽attains the state of buddhahood,

original: rtag pa'i gnas ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag pa'i gnas ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: which is free from old age and death.

original: bsod snyoms par dam bca' ba'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod snyoms par dam bca' ba'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the benefits of the ascetic practices of the one who is committed to the life of a mendicant,

original: gzhon nu phan yon 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhon nu phan yon 'di bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it says, “O Prince, there are these ten benefits.”

original: de shes kyi khe 'dod pa ma yin pa ni gnyen ba shes la chags pa dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: de shes kyi khe 'dod pa ma yin pa ni gnyen ba shes la chags pa dang bral ba nyid do //
