translated: The one who is not desirous of the gain that comes from knowledge is free from attachment to the gain that comes from knowledge.

original: snyan pa 'dod pa ma yin pa ni grags pa'i ched du bsod snyoms par yi dam du len cing sbyangs pa'i yon tan len pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: snyan pa 'dod pa ma yin pa ni grags pa'i ched du bsod snyoms par yi dam du len cing sbyangs pa'i yon tan len pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is not seeking fame, since he does not take vows of mendicancy for the sake of reputation, nor does he take up the ascetic practices.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi khyim spangs nas bsod snyoms kyis chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi khyim spangs nas bsod snyoms kyis chog shes pa'o //
translated: He is not seeking gain and honor, since he is content with alms and avoids the homes of the wealthy.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la gnas pa ni bden pa bzhi bsgom pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la gnas pa ni bden pa bzhi bsgom pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: He is established in the four noble lineages, since he is endowed with the cultivation of the four noble lineages.

original: tshul 'chos pa dang kha gsag med par 'gyur ba ni rnyed pa'i don du dbang po yang dag par bsdams pa dang / tshig snyan pa brjod pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa dang kha gsag med par 'gyur ba ni rnyed pa'i don du dbang po yang dag par bsdams pa dang / tshig snyan pa brjod pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: He is without hypocrisy and boasting, since he is free from the concealment of his own faults and the display of virtues.

original: bdag la mi stong pa ni bdag ni bsod snyoms tsam gyis chog pa tshul khrims dang ldan la gzhan ni de lta ma yin no zhes zer ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la mi stong pa ni bdag ni bsod snyoms tsam gyis chog pa tshul khrims dang ldan la gzhan ni de lta ma yin no zhes zer ba med pa'o //
translated: He is not self-deprecating, since he does not say, “I am content with just alms, but others are not like that.”

original: gzhan la mi smod pa ni gzhan gyi skyon mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la mi smod pa ni gzhan gyi skyon mi smra ba'o //
translated: He does not disparage others, since he does not speak of the faults of others.

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spangs pas gzhan gyi khyim du spyod pa ni rung ba dang gya nom pa'i bsod snyoms ster ba'i khyim gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs nas mnyam pa nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spangs pas gzhan gyi khyim du spyod pa ni rung ba dang gya nom pa'i bsod snyoms ster ba'i khyim gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs nas mnyam pa nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: He is free of the concepts of householders, because he has abandoned attachment and anger, and he is free of the concepts of the household that gives him proper and excellent alms.

original: zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa ni nor la zhen pa med pa nyid do //🔽sbyangs pa'i yon tan yo byad pa snyungs pa la gnas shing chos bstan pa gzung bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa ni nor la zhen pa med pa nyid do // sbyangs pa'i yon tan yo byad pa snyungs pa la gnas shing chos bstan pa gzung bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is free of attachment to wealth, because he gives the gift of the Dharma without concern for material possessions.🔽He is one who is to be heeded when he teaches the Dharma, because he is established in the ascetic practices and the practice of living on foraged goods.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams mgu ba'i tshul khrims la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phan @89b yon ni bcu po 'di'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams mgu ba'i tshul khrims la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phan @89b yon ni bcu po 'di'o //
translated: These are the ten benefits of being established in the morality that delights the world.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse is selfevident.

original: gzhon nu de lta bu'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa'i bshad ma thag pa'i dgon pa la gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gter rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhon nu de lta bu'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa'i bshad ma thag pa'i dgon pa la gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gter rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: Prince, the bodhisattva who is established in the ascetic practices and who lives in the wilderness as just explained will find the treasure of the Buddha.

original: chos kyi gter rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi gter rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: He will find the treasure of the Dharma.

original: ye shes kyi gter rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ye shes kyi gter rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: He will find the treasure of pristine awareness.

original: dus gsum gyi shes pa'i gter rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi shes pa'i gter rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will find the treasure of the knowledge of the three times.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi gter rnyed par 'gyur zhe na zhes don nges par dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi gter rnyed par 'gyur zhe na zhes don nges par dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: How does he find the treasure of the Buddhas?

original: dben pa la spyod cing dgon pa la gnas nas mngon par shes pa lnga 'thob ste /
analyzed: dben pa la spyod cing dgon pa la gnas nas mngon par shes pa lnga 'thob ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “He practices in solitude and dwells in the forest, and so he attains the five superknowledges.

original: lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul te de mi las 'das pa lha'i mig rnam par dag pas phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul te de mi las 'das pa lha'i mig rnam par dag pas phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams mthong ngo //
translated: With the divine eye, which surpasses the human, he sees the infinite, countless blessed buddhas in the ten directions.

original: de sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: He never loses sight of the Buddha.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi gter rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi gter rnyed pa yin no //
translated: This is how he finds the treasure of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag phyogs bcu na chos gang ci ston pa de yang lha'i rna bas thos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag phyogs bcu na chos gang ci ston pa de yang lha'i rna bas thos te /
translated: Whatever Dharma those Buddhas, those Blessed Ones, teach in the ten directions, he hears with the divine ear.

original: de'i phyir de chos nyan pa dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de chos nyan pa dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, he is never separated from listening to the Dharma.

original: de ltar na chos kyi gter rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi gter rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he finds the treasure of the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ye shes gang dang ldan pas chos thams cad 'dzin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ye shes gang dang ldan pas chos thams cad 'dzin te /
translated: “The bodhisattva finds the treasure of wisdom by means of which he retains all the Dharmas.

original: kun bzung nas mi brjed cing bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes nas sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: kun bzung nas mi brjed cing bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes nas sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: Having retained them, he does not forget them. Knowing their meaning and their underlying intent, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: de ltar na ye shes kyi gter rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ye shes kyi gter rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he finds the treasure of wisdom.

original: de mngon par shes pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa shes pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa shes pa la 'jug ste /
translated: “He finds the treasure of the knowledge of the past, future, and present thoughts and deeds of all sentient beings by means of the superknowledges.

original: de ltar na sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba shes pa'i gter rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba shes pa'i gter rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he finds the treasure of the knowledge of the past, future, and present.

original: mdor bsdus na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In brief, one will attain the qualities of a Buddha.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi yon tan ma lus pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi yon tan ma lus pa //
translated: The qualities of the holy Dharma

original: tshig gis brjod pa mi nus bsam par dka' //
analyzed: tshig gis brjod pa mi nus bsam par dka' //
translated: cannot be expressed in words, are difficult to imagine,

original: gus pas zhugs par gyur kyang brjod mi nus //
analyzed: gus pas zhugs par gyur kyang brjod mi nus //
translated: and cannot be expressed even by those who have entered with devotion.

original: @90a * // gzhan gyi don du zhugs pas mi legs min //
analyzed: @90a * // gzhan gyi don du zhugs pas mi legs min //
translated: But it is not wrong to enter for the sake of others.

original: phan yon bcu pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i 'grel ba rdzogs so /🔽// / da ni rab tu byung ba ni legs par rtogs pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: phan yon bcu pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i 'grel ba rdzogs so / // / da ni rab tu byung ba ni legs par rtogs pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: This concludes the commentary to the twenty-ninth chapter, on the ten benefits.

original: zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gzi brjid kyi tshogs kyi rgyal po'i le'u /
analyzed: zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gzi brjid kyi tshogs kyi rgyal po'i le'u /
translated: Now, in order to teach that renunciation is in accord with the realization of the Dharma, there is the chapter on the king of the assembly of splendor.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One said, and so on.

original: gzhon nu de lta bas na lha'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid kyi bde ba yang spangs te rab tu byung zhes khyod kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba nas gzhon nu bdag nyid yongs su gtong bas kyang sems can de dag gi don bya'o zhes🔽bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gi don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhon nu de lta bas na lha'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid kyi bde ba yang spangs te rab tu byung zhes khyod kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba nas gzhon nu bdag nyid yongs su gtong bas kyang sems can de dag gi don bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gi don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the text from Prince, for the sake of those sentient beings, I will give up even my own self up to here has been explained.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon byung ba'i le'u 'di tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon byung ba'i le'u 'di tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to teach this chapter on the past, said Thus have I heard and so on.

original: 'das pa'i bskal pa brgya mang rab dran te //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngon byung ba'i gtam gsungs te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i bskal pa brgya mang rab dran te // zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngon byung ba'i gtam gsungs te /
translated: Remembering many hundreds of past eons,🔽I see the world with my purified divine eye,

original: 'das pa'i bskal pa brgya phrag mang po ngas dran te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i bskal pa brgya phrag mang po ngas dran te /
translated: and I see beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, all according to their actions.🔽I see this world with my purified divine eye, and I see beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, all according to their actions.

original: dus de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa gzi brjid tshogs kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba de'i bstan pa la mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i dge slong bye ba phrag bcu byung ste /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa gzi brjid tshogs kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba de'i bstan pa la mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i dge slong bye ba phrag bcu byung ste /
translated: At that time, in the doctrine of the thus-gone King of Radiant Accumulations, there appeared ten million monks who possessed the six higher perceptions.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: They had attained the correct discriminations,

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis yang dag par brgyan pa /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis yang dag par brgyan pa /
translated: were adorned with the qualities of training,

original: sems zhi ba'i dge 'dun byung bar gyur to /
analyzed: sems zhi ba'i dge 'dun byung bar gyur to /
translated: and were a saṅgha of peaceful minds.

original: der grong khyer ni bye ba brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa drug byung ngo //
analyzed: der grong khyer ni bye ba brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa drug byung ngo //
translated: There were 7,600 million cities,

original: grong khyer re re la yang dpag tshad lnga brgya yod pa la me tog dang / 'bras bu sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i ljon shing mchog gis brgyan cing khyab pa /
analyzed: grong khyer re re la yang dpag tshad lnga brgya yod pa la me tog dang / 'bras bu sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i ljon shing mchog gis brgyan cing khyab pa /
translated: each of which was five hundred leagues in size and adorned with the finest trees bearing various flowers and fruits.

original: bya sna tshogs skad snyan pa 'byin pas gang pa'i skyed mos tshal brgyas brgyan pa na yang rdzing bu padma dang / autpal dang / dri zhi ma pa dang / dri zhim ldan pa la sogs pas brgyan pa'i chu yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas yongs su gang ba yid du 'ong ba la bya'i tshogs kyis brgyan pas skyed mos tshal ji snyed yod pa de snyed dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: bya sna tshogs skad snyan pa 'byin pas gang pa'i skyed mos tshal brgyas brgyan pa na yang rdzing bu padma dang / autpal dang / dri zhi ma pa dang / dri zhim ldan pa la sogs pas brgyan pa'i chu yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas yongs su gang ba yid du 'ong ba la bya'i tshogs kyis brgyan pas skyed mos tshal ji snyed yod pa de snyed dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: It was adorned with a hundred pleasure groves filled with the sweet songs of various birds. There were as many ponds as there were pleasure groves, adorned with lotuses, blue lotuses, and fragrant water lilies, filled with water possessing the eight qualities, delightful and adorned with flocks of birds.

original: de'i tshe 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir sa'i bdag po brten pas byin zhes bya ba bu lnga @90b brgyas brgyan pa yid rab tu dga' ba /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir sa'i bdag po brten pas byin zhes bya ba bu lnga @90b brgyas brgyan pa yid rab tu dga' ba /
translated: At that time, in this Jambudvīpa, there was a king named Dṛḍhabāhu, who was adorned with five hundred sons, his mind filled with joy.

original: phas kyi rgol ba dang / mu ge dang// bdud la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang bral bas 'dzam bu'i gling dang / lha'i gnas la khyad par med pa'i rgyal srid kyi bde ba kha na ma thob med pa nyams su myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba dang / mu ge dang// bdud la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang bral bas 'dzam bu'i gling dang / lha'i gnas la khyad par med pa'i rgyal srid kyi bde ba kha na ma thob med pa nyams su myong bar gyur to //
translated: Free from the harm of adversaries, famine, and Māra, he experienced the bliss of kingship, without any difference between Jambudvīpa and the heavenly realms, free from wrongdoing.

original: yang de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa gzi brjid tshogs kyi rgyal po khyad par du ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyi yon tan nges par ston cing chos ston to //
analyzed: yang de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa gzi brjid tshogs kyi rgyal po khyad par du ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyi yon tan nges par ston cing chos ston to //
translated: At that time, the Tathāgata Tejorāśi-rāja taught the Dharma, teaching the greatness of the king of samādhis, and revealing the qualities of the Tathāgata.

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin gsal bar bye ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad bdag med par rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir /🔽srid pa'i 'gro ba rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin gsal bar bye ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad bdag med par rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir / srid pa'i 'gro ba rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: In order to illuminate the nature of the ultimate, and in order to establish all phenomena as selfless,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “The wanderings of existence are like a dream,” and so on.

original: 'gro ba drug gi 'khor bar 'byung bas na srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi 'khor bar 'byung bas na srid pa'o //
translated: “Wanderings of existence” means arising in the six realms of saṃsāra.

original: der skyes pa ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: der skyes pa ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: Those who are born there are the wanderers.

original: de dag ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: They are like a dream.

original: ji ltar rmi lam ni 'gro ba sna tshogs su ltung pa'i sems can rnams skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal so sor rang rig pa nye bar dmigs na yang rmi lam gyi dngos po grub pa med pas skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa de dag bden par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam ni 'gro ba sna tshogs su ltung pa'i sems can rnams skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal so sor rang rig pa nye bar dmigs na yang rmi lam gyi dngos po grub pa med pas skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa de dag bden par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as in a dream, although the various beings who fall into the various destinies are perceived to be born, to cease, to be happy, and to be miserable, by their own individual experience, since the things of a dream do not exist, their birth and death, etc. do not truly exist.

original: 'di la su yang mi skye 'chi ba med //
analyzed: 'di la su yang mi skye 'chi ba med //
translated: Here, no one is born, no one dies.

original: ces bya ba ni skye ba yang med do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni skye ba yang med do //
translated: This is because there is no birth.

original: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no birth, like the son of a barren woman.

original: ma skyes pa la 'chi ba yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la 'chi ba yang med pa nyid do //
translated: And there is no death for that which is unborn.

original: sems can ming dang srog kyang mi rnyed de //
analyzed: sems can ming dang srog kyang mi rnyed de //
translated: One does not find a sentient being, a life-force, or a living being.

original: zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag ni sems can zhes bya ba yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gtso bo zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag ni sems can zhes bya ba yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gtso bo zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: Here, the Sāṃkhyas say that what is called a “sentient being” is the primary nature, which has the nature of the three qualities.

original: de yongs su gyur pa na 'gro ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa na 'gro ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that it is the world when it is transformed.

original: mi rnyed ces bya ba ni tshed mas nges par brtags na nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mi rnyed ces bya ba ni tshed mas nges par brtags na nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Not found” means that when one investigates with discernment, it is not perceived.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: It is not reasonable that it transforms.

original: rtag na ni rang gi ngo bo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba yin pas yongs su 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag na ni rang gi ngo bo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba yin pas yongs su 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: If it were permanent, it would not transform, since its nature would not change into something else.

original: skad cig ma yin na yang skad cig gnyis par gnas pa'i skabs med pas yongs su 'gyur ba med ces bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin na yang skad cig gnyis par gnas pa'i skabs med pas yongs su 'gyur ba med ces bya'o //
translated: If it were momentary, it would not transform, since it would not endure for a second moment.

original: srog ni phyogs kyi gos can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag ste /🔽de yang phung po lnga po las gzhan @91a * //
analyzed: srog ni phyogs kyi gos can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag ste / de yang phung po lnga po las gzhan @91a * //
translated: Life is the self imputed by the Lokayatas.

original: du dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not perceived as different from the five aggregates.

original: ming ni rig byed pa la sogs pas brtags pa'i skyes bu ste sred med kyi bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni rig byed pa la sogs pas brtags pa'i skyes bu ste sred med kyi bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Name is the person imputed by the Grammarians, such as Narayana.

original: de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not perceived.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽chos 'di rnams ni dbu ba chu shing 'dra //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / chos 'di rnams ni dbu ba chu shing 'dra //
translated: For that reason,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: These phenomena are like foam and like a plantain tree.

original: dbu ba'i gong bu ni snang ba tsam ste nges par brtags na ci yang med pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ba'i gong bu ni snang ba tsam ste nges par brtags na ci yang med pa'o //
translated: The bubble is merely an appearance; if it is examined carefully, it is nothing at all.

original: phung po lnga po yang dbu ba'i gong bu bzhin du bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phung po lnga po yang dbu ba'i gong bu bzhin du bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo med pa nyid do //
translated: The five aggregates are like a bubble in that they have no essence of self, etc.

original: chu shing so sor phye na snying po ci yang med pa de bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i snying po yong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chu shing so sor phye na snying po ci yang med pa de bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i snying po yong pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the plantain tree has no core when it is broken open, so the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc. have no core.

original: de lta bas na sgyu ma lta bu /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgyu ma lta bu /
translated: Therefore, they are like an illusion.

original: nam mkha' ltar rang bzhin med pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar rang bzhin med pa /
translated: Like space, they are essenceless.

original: nyams su myong ba rnams ni sprin lta bu /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba rnams ni sprin lta bu /
translated: Experiences are like a cloud.

original: glog lta bu /
analyzed: glog lta bu /
translated: Like lightning.

original: chu'i zla ba lta bu /
analyzed: chu'i zla ba lta bu /
translated: Like a reflection of the moon in water.🔽Like a mirage.

original: smig rgyu ltar mthong ba nyid na mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo skad cig ma'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu ltar mthong ba nyid na mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo skad cig ma'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When they are seen, they are seen to be essentially momentary, in the sense that they cannot be apprehended.

original: dpe 'di dag ni gang zag la bdag med par sgrub pa'i phyir bstan te /
analyzed: dpe 'di dag ni gang zag la bdag med par sgrub pa'i phyir bstan te /
translated: These examples are given to prove the selflessness of the person,

original: 'ga' zhig la grags pa'i dbang du byas nas yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la grags pa'i dbang du byas nas yin no //
translated: from the point of view of what is familiar to some.

original: bdag med pa gnyi ga bsres nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir srid pa gsum po rmi lam bzhin du stong /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyi ga bsres nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir srid pa gsum po rmi lam bzhin du stong /
translated: In order to teach both kinds of selflessness, it says: The three worlds are empty like a dream.

original: myur du 'jig cing mi rtag sgyu 'dra nyid //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: myur du 'jig cing mi rtag sgyu 'dra nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: They quickly perish, are impermanent like an illusion.

original: rab tu snang zhing gsal ba yang rmi lam nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir dang / skad cig ma nyid dang / snying po med pa nyid du rab tu rtogs so //🔽'dir gang nas kyang ma 'ongs shing /
analyzed: rab tu snang zhing gsal ba yang rmi lam nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir dang / skad cig ma nyid dang / snying po med pa nyid du rab tu rtogs so // 'dir gang nas kyang ma 'ongs shing /
translated: Here, it is understood that they are empty like a dream, because they appear and are manifest like a dream, because they are momentary, and because they are insubstantial.

original: 'di nas kyang gar yang 'gro ba med pa ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nas kyang gar yang 'gro ba med pa ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Here, nothing comes from anywhere, and nothing goes from here anywhere, because all things are emptiness and signlessness.

original: de'i phyir mi dag 'jig rten 'dir yang shi nas ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dag 'jig rten 'dir yang shi nas ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it says: No one dies in this world and goes to the next.

original: mi dag 'jig rten 'di nas shi bar gyur pa yang med la /🔽'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba yang med do //
analyzed: mi dag 'jig rten 'di nas shi bar gyur pa yang med la / 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba yang med do //
translated: No one dies in this world and goes to the next.

original: 'gro ba dang 'od ba med pas rtag tu khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'od ba med pas rtag tu khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of going and coming, there is always pervasion.

original: skad cig ma nyid yin pas kyang skye ba'i yul de nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur bas 'gro ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin pas kyang skye ba'i yul de nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur bas 'gro ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is momentary, it dies in the very place where it is born, so it does not go anywhere.

original: gal te de lta na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud zos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud zos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, one might wonder whether one would encounter the results of actions not done, and whether the results of actions done would perish.🔽To dispel such doubts, the Buddha said:

original: las byas rnams ni nam yang med mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: las byas rnams ni nam yang med mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The results of actions done will never disappear.🔽When a person who has done virtuous and nonvirtuous actions falls asleep, one sees that they experience the happiness and suffering of the higher realms and lower realms, and so on.

original: dge @91b ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i skyes bu gnyid kyis log pa'i tshe mtho ris dang ngan song la sogs pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa mthong yang de dag tu song ba'i bya ba med pa dang /
analyzed: dge @91b ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i skyes bu gnyid kyis log pa'i tshe mtho ris dang ngan song la sogs pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa mthong yang de dag tu song ba'i bya ba med pa dang /
translated: But there is no action of going to those places.

original: 'dir shi bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir shi bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that they would die here.

original: de lta na ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, they would not experience happiness and suffering,

original: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they do not go anywhere.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'i skyes bu la sogs pa med kyang las dang 'bras bu rnam par nyams pa med do zhes bya ba yin par /🔽'khor ba na yang dkar nag 'bras bu ster ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'i skyes bu la sogs pa med kyang las dang 'bras bu rnam par nyams pa med do zhes bya ba yin par / 'khor ba na yang dkar nag 'bras bu ster ;
translated: The meaning of the verse is that even though there is no person who goes to another world, karma and its result are not undermined.

original: / zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //🔽rtag pa ma yin chad par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: / zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no // rtag pa ma yin chad par mi 'gyur te //
translated: The verse “Even in cyclic existence, white and black results are given” teaches this.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse “It is not permanent, nor is it annihilated” teaches this.

original: gal te rtag pa yin na ngo bo gcig tu gyur pas las dang 'bras bu nyams su myong ba yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rtag pa yin na ngo bo gcig tu gyur pas las dang 'bras bu nyams su myong ba yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were permanent, it would be a single entity, and the experience of karma and its result would not occur.

original: chad par gyur na yang /
analyzed: chad par gyur na yang /
translated: If it were annihilated,

original: thams cad yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: thams cad yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: then since everything would not exist,🔽karma and its result would not exist.

original: las dang 'bras bu yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa ltar na ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba grub pa yin gyi gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i skyes bu rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba ngan pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa ltar na ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba grub pa yin gyi gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i skyes bu rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba ngan pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams la ni med do //
translated: Thus, according to our assertion, the connection between karma and its result is established, but it does not exist for those who follow the bad paths of the eternalist and nihilist views imputed by others.

original: las bsags med cing gnas pa dag kyang med //
analyzed: las bsags med cing gnas pa dag kyang med //
translated: And there is no accumulation of karma and no abiding.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: sngon dang phyi ma phrad pa med pas bsags pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma phrad pa med pas bsags pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: since there is no contact between prior and subsequent moments, there is no accumulation of karma.

original: skad cig ma so so rang gi ngo bo so sor 'byung ba na de nyid du gnas pa med na ji ltar las dang 'bras bu nyams su myong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma so so rang gi ngo bo so sor 'byung ba na de nyid du gnas pa med na ji ltar las dang 'bras bu nyams su myong ba yin zhe na /
translated: If the individual moments arise individually and do not abide, how can karma and its result be experienced?

original: de yang byas nas reg par mi 'gyur min //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang byas nas reg par mi 'gyur min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not the case that what is done is not experienced.

original: gang gis las byas pa des reg par mi 'gyur ba min te /
analyzed: gang gis las byas pa des reg par mi 'gyur ba min te /
translated: It is not the case that what is done by one is not experienced by that one.

original: nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is not experienced.

original: de lta na yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even so, it is taught that it is experienced.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa myong bar 'gyur ba'ang med //🔽ces bya ba la ;🔽gzhan gyis byas pa gzhan gyis myong ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa myong bar 'gyur ba'ang med // ces bya ba la ; gzhan gyis byas pa gzhan gyis myong ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Nor is there experience of what is done by another.🔽It is not the case that what is done by another is experienced by that other.

original: las gzhan zhig byas nas 'bras bu gzhan zhig myong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: las gzhan zhig byas nas 'bras bu gzhan zhig myong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that having done one thing, one experiences another.

original: srog gcod pa'i las byas nas sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod nyams su myong na ni so sor nges pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyams par thal bar @92a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i las byas nas sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod nyams su myong na ni so sor nges pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyams par thal bar @92a * //
translated: If one experiences the result of generosity, such as wealth, after having committed the act of killing, then the result of the karma would be uncertain.

original: 'gyur ro // 'pho ba med cing phyir yang 'ong ba med //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'pho ba med cing phyir yang 'ong ba med //
translated: There is no transference and no return.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du rtag pa'i bdag 'ga' yang 'pho ba yang med de bdag la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du rtag pa'i bdag 'ga' yang 'pho ba yang med de bdag la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no permanent self that transfers from this world to another world, because there is no self, etc.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa nas 'ga' zhig 'dir 'ong pa yang med de 'pho bar smra ba tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa nas 'ga' zhig 'dir 'ong pa yang med de 'pho bar smra ba tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does anyone come here from another world, because the proponent of transference is refuted by valid cognition.

original: thams cad yod pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad yod pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Everything does not exist.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du mi bden pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du mi bden pa'i phyir /
translated: Everything imagined by others is false, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: med pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does everything not exist.

original: sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i so sor snang ba la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'dogs pas med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i so sor snang ba la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'dogs pas med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent, because the conventions of the world are applied to the individual appearances that are like an illusion.

original: lta ba'i gnas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a basis for views,

original: dngos po'i ngo bor yongs su ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor yongs su ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: because it is not established as the nature of an entity.

original: dag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not pure,

original: sngon ma dag pa las phyis dag par 'gyur ba ma yin pa ni sems can gcig la dag pa dang / ma dag pa ni yongs su brtags pa tsam yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon ma dag pa las phyis dag par 'gyur ba ma yin pa ni sems can gcig la dag pa dang / ma dag pa ni yongs su brtags pa tsam yin zhes bya'o //
translated: because it is not the case that it is impure at first and then becomes pure later. It is said that purity and impurity in a single sentient being are merely imputed.

original: de'i spyod pa 'jug pa tsam yang med de /
analyzed: de'i spyod pa 'jug pa tsam yang med de /
translated: There is not even the mere engagement of its conduct,

original: thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at all.

original: de bzhin du 'jug pa dang / 'jug pa med pa zhi ba ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jug pa dang / 'jug pa med pa zhi ba ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the pacification of engagement and nonengagement is engagement.

original: gzod nas zhi ba ni 'jug pa'i ngo bo med pa'am sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzod nas zhi ba ni 'jug pa'i ngo bo med pa'am sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The primordial pacification is the absence of the nature of engagement or the establishment of it.

original: skye med zhi ba mtshan ma med pa'i gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye med zhi ba mtshan ma med pa'i gnas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The pacification of nonarising is the state of signlessness.

original: skye ba med pa ni zhi ba'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni zhi ba'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: Nonarising is the state of pacification.

original: skye ba ni nyes pa thams cad kyi gnas yin pa nyid dang / rab tu ma zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba ni nyes pa thams cad kyi gnas yin pa nyid dang / rab tu ma zhi ba nyid do //
translated: Birth is the abode of all faults and is not at all peaceful.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the abode free from all signs.

original: bde gshegs spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bde gshegs spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “the domain of the Tathāgata” indicates that this is not the domain of others.

original: de lta bu'i rab tu zhi ba dang stong pa nyid nges par rtogs pas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dri ma med pa bsnyengs pa med pa'i stobs bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / ye shes bcu la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa rnam par dag pa rnams 'bad pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rab tu zhi ba dang stong pa nyid nges par rtogs pas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dri ma med pa bsnyengs pa med pa'i stobs bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / ye shes bcu la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa rnam par dag pa rnams 'bad pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By realizing such peace and emptiness, one will effortlessly attain the stainless qualities of a buddha, such as the ten powers, the ten perfections, the ten masteries, and so on.

original: mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyi khyad par yang 'bad pa med pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyi khyad par yang 'bad pa med pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: One will also effortlessly attain the various kinds of miracles and the superknowledges.

original: 'gro dang 'jug med mkhas pa'i @92b chos kyi 'gros //
analyzed: 'gro dang 'jug med mkhas pa'i @92b chos kyi 'gros //
translated: The wise one’s way of Dharma is without going or coming.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni gar yang 'gro ba med pas mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba mad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni gar yang 'gro ba med pas mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba mad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the Dharma-dhātu is not going anywhere, because it is not going. This is because there is no going or coming in suchness.🔽The wise one’s way of Dharma is without going, because it is like that.

original: de 'dra'i 'gro ba 'gro med ces bya ba ni chos nyid kyi 'gros ni mkhas pas nan tan gyis rtogs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dra'i 'gro ba 'gro med ces bya ba ni chos nyid kyi 'gros ni mkhas pas nan tan gyis rtogs par bya ba ste /
translated: The way of Dharma is to be realized by the wise one through practice.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be realized by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de dag nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just those,

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gar yang mi 'gro ste //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gar yang mi 'gro ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Dharma-dhātu does not go anywhere.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang / chos nyid ces bya ba ni rnam grangs kyi sgra zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang / chos nyid ces bya ba ni rnam grangs kyi sgra zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Dharma-dhātu, suchness, the perfect end, emptiness, and the way of Dharma are synonyms.

original: zhi bar zhi nye bar zhi ba'i 'gros //
analyzed: zhi bar zhi nye bar zhi ba'i 'gros //
translated: The way of peace, peace, and complete peace.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba ni gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid do //🔽rab bzhi ni tha ma'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba ni gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid do // rab bzhi ni tha ma'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Peace” is peace from the beginning.🔽“ Tranquility” is freedom from the end of the end.

original: nye bar zhi ba ni dbus med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba ni dbus med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Calmness” is freedom from the middle.

original: rtag tu dngos po'i rang bzhin rjes su song //🔽zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba shin tu mthong bar dka' ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: rtag tu dngos po'i rang bzhin rjes su song // zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba shin tu mthong bar dka' ba'i gnas te /
translated: “ Always in accord with the nature of things”

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: is the stage of the Sugata, which is unshakable and very difficult to see.

original: de lta bu'i gnas de ni tshig gis brjod par nus pa ma yin no //🔽dbyangs kyis bshad kyang dbyangs kyi 'jug pa med //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas de ni tshig gis brjod par nus pa ma yin no // dbyangs kyis bshad kyang dbyangs kyi 'jug pa med //
translated: That stage cannot be expressed in words.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: “ Even if it is explained in song, there is no engagement of song.”

original: dbyangs ni sgra'i ngo bos stong pa nyid yin pas gang nas kyang mi 'ongs gar yang mi 'gro //
analyzed: dbyangs ni sgra'i ngo bos stong pa nyid yin pas gang nas kyang mi 'ongs gar yang mi 'gro //
translated: Song is empty of the nature of sound, so it does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere,

original: gar yang gnas pa med pa ste ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gar yang gnas pa med pa ste ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and does not abide anywhere, because it is empty of intrinsic reality.
